story:
Our site www.MeetMeThereEvents.com

Our Team

Jen Alexander - James Nealon - Mark Carter

Funding this campaign is really about the people and you helping make something very special happen. Be sure to check out all these member smiles from past events here 

How it started

Before moving I owned an event planning business in NYC for over 18 years. Having worked for clients who were planning such important private events, I became highly skilled in being detailed oriented, diligent, resourceful and creative. After exiting the private party world, I went on to become a Licensed Realtor for RE/MAX. But, they say, "Do what you love and you'll love what you do". Well, I love running this group and want to do it full time. I've never had so much fun in my life creating fun for other people.

Your contributions are actually not for me. They are for the members. As they are the recipients of this service. Life is filled with work, families, stress, bills and plenty of adult seriousness. Members need our group as an outlet to express their inner kid and to have more laughter and enjoyment in their lives. Because we do these as group events, they benefit by meeting many new friends that they wouldn't normally meet in their daily lives.

What We Need 

$50,000 is what it would take to get it started. It's all about the marketing. We have proven the concept on a very small grass roots effort. Now it's time to tell the world. By the way, our members pay an annual membership. It's extremely affordable with no pressure to participate if they can't all the time. Unlike a similar group who charges over 100 times what we do. 

The Majority of funds will be used to run radio spots for approximately 10 - 15 months consistently. It would not be spent all at once. Approximately  $3,000.00 a month would be spent on this marketing. This would allow for consistency and more importantly, letting me see the conversion rate after 90 days. The marketing will drive traffic to our web site and increase membership. The balance for S.E.O and web traffic marketing.

The Impact

Not only do we plan events for our members but, we post information about charities, community events and encourage them to get involved. From time to time we actually plan an outing that brings our members to a charity event such as when we did the "Walk for MS", or "beach cleanup". Part of my plan is to be able to grow the membership and have recurring community events that we can actively participate in on a regular basis. Part of our blog is dedicated to allowing members to post information about charitable events or non profits. This gives them an outlet to share with other members. My goal is to be a bigger part of the community and to bring Meet Me There Events to more U.S. cities in the future. You can request this information as outlined in our business plan.

My success is the fact that I have planned over 350 events and brought many new friendships to life. Your contribution will allow people who are looking for more social interaction, the ability to do so more frequently without costing and arm and a leg. Plainly put, I am a people person. I work hard at fulfilling my members needs and wants and put them first before mine. I have dozens of unsolicited testimonials from members who have said such great things about how I planned and executed our events.

Here are some testimonials from real members

•This was my first meet me there event with this group. Everyone was really fun and made me feel right at home. Great group.   -Scott

•Had a great time. Well organized. Nice people.  -Kate

•Yeaaaaaa! I had fun! and I won money! woo hoo - will post pics later. Thanks Adrian!!  -Abigail 

•"Get out and enjoy these amazing adventures. The flying trapeze class is an incredible experience and the Segway tour was a blast! Don't miss out!! –Mari

•"It was my first event, I will be attending more. Everyone is very friendly ” –Diane

•"Wow lots of events to choose from and great opportunity to meet others.“ –Jean

•"Very impressed with Adrian's event-planning skills. I will be looking for more of his meetups to attend.“ –Melissa

•What a great time had at beach day. We played volleyball, swam, paddle ball, and had some great fun meeting people.  -John

See more member reviews here: www.meetmethereevents.com/member-reviews

Re-usable shopper bag

Cotton tote bag

story:
Short Summary

We are Crafty Devil Brewing Company.  Founded by two best mates Rhys Watkins & Adam Edinborough in 2014 in Rhys's garden shed. Since then the brewery has grown beyond our wildest dreams employing both Adam & Rhys, 2 more full time staff and 7 part time. The brewery is now producing 2000 litres of beer a week.  In October 2015 we also opened our first venue the Crafty Devil Cellar a small bar and shop in the suburb of Canton in West Cardiff. We are proud to be a Cardiff craft brewery in the City where we have grown up. 

Canned in Cardiff is the next step in our journey. Allowing us to make more beer, by expanding the brewery capacity, and most importantly can our own beer!

When we started the Brewery we had the dream of being totally independent allowing us the freedom to create whatever we wanted, whenever we wanted to. By contributing to this you would be helping us realise this dream. 

Having control over the canning process will allow us to be more innovative by making sure our one  off and small batch brews make it into cans and out into the world. Our beer will be canned at it's freshest and totally under our control.This campaign will also enable us to move the brewery to a better facility with a secure lease. Helping us grow quickly and reach more customers, making sure the product that reaches them is a fair reflection of our passion and hard work. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for £83,000 to fund this exciting project this will be the breakdown of costs:

  • Cask Canning Line £38,000
  • Labelling Machine £9,000
  • New pressure tank £5,000
  • Building Work/Working Capital £31,000

As a supporter of our campaign there are a series of great perks for you including:

  • An invite to Crafty Devil's Annual Party including beer!
  • A number of limited edition Canned In Cardiff Cans (The First Beer off the new Canning Line)
  • 'Another Brick In the Wall....Wall' Your name on a Brick at the new Brewery
  • Life Discounts off Crafty Devil Beers & Merch
  • A Year of Beer!
  • Plus Many more.......

If we do not reach our entire goal we have the option to purchase a manual canning machine which is slower but will still allow us to can onsite. We would also need to reconsider how we fund the associated building works.

The Impact

This project is valuable to the Crafty Devil customer as it will keep us fiercely independent and loyal to them, making sure we provide them with new and exciting beer with ever increasing quality at an affordable price. An increased range of beers will be available in can to take away and to a wider audience. It will also create local jobs, contributing to the wider economy. The environmental impact will also be positive with none of the current haulage needed to transfer beer, cutting our carbon footprint.

We have managed to build Crafty Devil Brewing from the ground up with no external funding, calling on family and friends. The business now employs 9 members of staff all on the 'real' living wage or above. It is now time to move the business on to the next level and that is where you come in!

We are a proud local craft brewery who believe in the community we have been involved in many charity projects and try to give back as much as we can. We have a loyal following which is amazing and we believe this is testament to our project and the trust we have built.

Risks & Challenges

The value of this project carries risks and challenges to us. There is a risk that the demand for our product does not meet our new capacity. In addition to this the building works could cost more than anticipated. We have mitigated this by courting new customers who are interested in buying our cans in large volumes. We have also appointed a trusted builder who will do the required work locating the brewery in the new premises.

The challenges we have include project managing the works and ensuring time frames are kept to. We will meet these challenges through project discipline and a realistic time frame. Also, Adam was in construction and Rhys was a Project Manager in a their former lives!

Other Ways You Can Help

Giving us money is not the only way you can help! We need all you Crafty Devils to share our campaign and get in touch if you can help in any other way. Indiegogo has share tools you can also use to get the word out.

Thank you for reading this campaign and thank you in advance for your support.

story:
My name is Makame, I am born and raised in Nungwi, on the Northern tip of Zanzibar. I have been working at Mnarani Turtle Aquarium for over 10 years and just 3 years ago I start my own company called Zanzibar Cycling Adventures (www.zanzibarcyclingadventures.com) to show tourists some of my islands hidden treasures. 

I have always had dreams of having my own bed and breakfast accommodation so I have been saving money the whole time and now I have been able to start my own place.

I want my place to be locally run and to be with the local people from my village, providing jobs for them. My plan for now is to finish the three rooms that are being built and have a small restaurant to begin welcoming guests. I hope I can finish this before the start of the next high season in July 2017. 

The location of my B&B is very close to Mnarani Aquarium and right next to the beach, you can see from the photos how close to the sea it is. 

The donations will go to putting electricity, finishing the bathrooms and bedrooms and preparing the garden. 

Any donation will be very kind, I also want to offer something in return for donations so I made a plan that for every $30 I can offer 1 night accommodation with breakfast for up to 2 people. My plan is to finish building by July 2017, you can already plan your trip from that time and this offer can last until July 2019.

I am sure I can complete building by July 2017 because I am also putting everything I make into it. In the situation that I don't manage to finish building by July 2017 and you have planned your holiday for that time, I will find other accommodation for you or I can repay the money.

Please also tell people about my project, sharing on Facebook and social media. 

There is more pictures and information about my B&B on my Facebook page

https://www.facebook.com/Makames-Beach-BB-59374...

Thank you to everyone for supporting me.

story:
My story

My name is Stephen Hope and I am the Founder and Owner of www.date420friendly.com. With a background in sales, I have bmetI created this site  as I knew that I wanted to create a judgement free environment  as a platform for to connect people from around the world to one another, who share like minded views on the cannabis movement and wish to socially interact with somebody who is accepting of the 420 lifestyle, be it romance or friendship. Offer membership, and some products with anyone who donates and supports us at Date420Friendly.com

As we are trying expand into new territory and all corners of the world, I need your help to grow . Though we are ranked in the top pages of google, we still need to use ads and publicity to reach out to a global community. We plan on hosting events for people to meet and increase our presence in the Cannabis industry conventions.Your contribution will help me achieve that and in exchange I will be able to give you some perks such as gold membership, baseball hats, stickers, and brand new glass pipes and shout out on Social Media.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 8,000 US to hire a Public Relations professional, to place ads in Cannabis Industry publications and to attend a few local Cannabis Industry conventions.

The Impact

With the new laws about the legalization of Marijuana there will be a greater need for people who are accepting of the 420 lifestyle to want to connect with one another, no matter their location and make new friends and seek potential romantic partners.

I am an Enterpreneur and have put my personal funds for this start up because I believe in allowing people who share similar interest to interact in a judgement free environment.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can always help get the word out !

  • Make some noise about our Indie Go Go campaign. There are built in Share Tools for you to talk about us on Social Media or tell your friends about it!
  • You can check out the web site and join it-it's easy to sign up! Posting a Profile is Free!

story:
Hello everyone! 

 

I'm Chelsi! A self taught baker/cake artist.  I've been making sweet treats for the great people of Baton Rouge since 2012.  I offer a nice list of treats with custom options available! Chelsi is my name and custom caking is my game!   Come visit sometime at www.chelsicakes.com !

 

Funding will go towards equipment, supplies & the tools needed to ensure you have the best experience!

 

Thanking you in advance for your contributions! Looking forward to creating your treats in my very own place! ;)

 

  • PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD! ANYTHING HELPS!
  • REMEMBER to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
L'Atelier Tentaculaire - Un endroit, Tous les arts

*Version Française et Anglaise en alternance / French and English version alternately*

Notre Petite Histoire

En 2015, nous nous sommes rencontrées à l’école de théâtre et ce fut une évidence pour toutes les deux qu'un jour, nous allions partir en entreprise ensemble; c'est à ce moment que naquit la première ébauche de cette compagnie. 

Après mille et une péripéties et formations acquises, nous avons revues nos idées et créé un concept unique qui rassemble tous nos besoins et désirs. Il était clair que nous voulions un espace rempli d'art et d'artistes, un espace dans lequel ils se sentiraient chez-eux et pourraient produire librement. Nous avions envie de créer un sentiment familial et envie d’unifier les artistes dans un même lieu, c’est ainsi que l’ATELIER TENTACULAIRE est né. 

Ainsi L'Atelier Tentaculaire se veux être une entreprise locale dont la vocation est de promouvoir les artiste émergents et de les unir autour de créations communes mise à l'avant dans nos lieux. De jour, L'Atelier T sera aussi un café où breuvages et nourritures seront offerts . De soir, l'endroit se changera en un bar artistique avec une salle de spectacles  où seront présentés nos divers artistes de la scène dans une programmation variée et soigneusement conçue.

Short Summary

In 2015, we met at the theater school and it was obvious for both of us that one day, we were going to go open a business together; it was at this time that the first draft of this company was born.

After a thousand adventures and acquired training, we have reviewed our ideas and created a unique concept that brings together all our needs and desires. It was clear that we wanted a space filled with art and artists, a space in which they would feel at home and could produce freely. We wanted to create a family feeling and wanted to unite the artists in the same place, this is how the TENTACULAR WORKSHOP (L'Atelier Tentaculaire) was born. Thus wants to be a local company whose vocation is to promote emerging artists and to unite them around common creations put forward in our places.

During the day, L'Atelier T will also be a café where beverages and foods will be offered. In the evening, the place will change into an artistic bar with a stage where our various performing artists will be presented in a varied and carefully designed program.

Nos besoins, Vos Récompenses

Ce que vous recevez en investissant dans cette campagne:

''Événement'' fait référence à n'importe quel spectacle, atelier, conférence ou exposition tenue à l'Atelier Tentaculaire

''Plateau'' fait référence aux divers espaces artistiques et à leur matériel spécialisé associé disponibles à  l'Atelier Tentaculaire (Par exemple: l'espace de photographie, de peinture, de dessin, etc.)

''Abonnement de jour'' vous donne accès à un espace de travail aménagé pour la durée de l'abonnement, un casier et un caddie pour votre matériel et diverses plages de réservation  de plateau de jour, de soir comme de fin de semaine. De plus, vous aurez un rabais sur les réservations de plateaux (rabais qui diffère selon votre abonnement) et un accès à un certain nombre d'événements.

''Abonnement de soir'' vous donne accès au vestiaire ainsi qu'à TOUS nos événements gratuitement en plus d'un 20% de rabais sur le billet d'entrée d'un invité.

  • 25$ - Le 5 à 7: Vous recevrez une consommation gratuite
  • 75$ - La Petite Soirée : Vous recevrez 2 consommations  ainsi qu'un billet pour l'événement de votre choix
  • 175$ - Les Deux font Paire: Vous recevrez 2 consommations  ainsi qu'une paire de billets pour l'événement de votre choix en plus d'un tablier édition spéciale de l'Atelier (à récupérer sur place)
  • 250$ - La Sortie à deux: Vous recevrez un repas à partager avec une bouteille de vin ainsi qu'une paire de billets pour l'événement de votre choix en plus d'un tablier édition spéciale de l'Atelier (à récupérer sur place)
  • 500$ - L'Artiste en moi: Vous recevrez une séance 3 heures d'utilisation du plateau de votre choix, 3 repas ainsi que 3 consommations en plus d'un tablier édition spéciale de l'Atelier (à récupérer sur place) 
  • 500$ - L'Oiseau de Nuit: Vous recevrez  un billet pour 3 événements de votre choix OU 3 billets pour le même événement, 3 repas ainsi que 3 consommations en plus d'un tablier édition spéciale de l'Atelier (à récupérer sur place)
  • 1 000$ - Le 7 Chanceux: Vous recevrez une séance 7 heures d'utilisation du plateau de votre choix, 7 repas ainsi que 7 consommations OU 2 bouteilles de vin en plus d'un tablier édition spéciale de l'Atelier (à récupérer sur place)
  • 1 000$ - Le Méthodique: Vous recevrez un abonnement d'un mois de jour OU de soir à nos services avec tous ses bénéfices en plus d'un tablier édition spéciale de l'Atelier (à récupérer sur place) 
  • 5 000$ - Le Balcon: Vous recevrez un abonnement d'un an de jour OU de soir à nos services avec tous ses bénéfices, un rabais de 10% sur toutes vos consommations d'alcool et de nourriture pour l'année en plus d'un tablier édition spéciale de l'Atelier (à récupérer sur place)
  • 10 000$ - La Première Rangée: Vous recevrez un abonnement d'un an de jour OU de soir à nos services avec tous ses bénéfices, un rabais de 25% sur toutes vos consommations d'alcool et de nourriture pour l'année en plus d'un tablier édition spéciale de l'Atelier (à récupérer sur place)
  • 15 000$ - La Passe V.I.P.: Vous recevrez un abonnement d'un an de jour ET de soir à nos services avec tous ses bénéfices, un rabais de 40% sur toutes vos consommations d'alcool et de nourriture pour l'année et un rabais partageable de 25% avec un ami* en plus d'un tablier édition spéciale de l'Atelier (à récupérer sur place)

*C'est-à-dire un rabais de 40% si vous vous présentez seul ou un rabais partageable de 25% pour vous et 25% pour votre invité lorsque vous venez accompagnés.

What We Need & What You Get

What you receive by investing in this campaign:

'' Event '' refers to any show, workshop, conference or exhibition held at Atelier Tentaculaire

'' Set '' refers to the various artistic spaces and their associated specialized material available at Atelier Tentaculaire (For example: photography, painting, drawing space, etc.)

'' Day subscription '' gives you access to a workspace fitted out for the duration of the subscription, a locker and a shopping trolley for your equipment and various day or evening and weekend reservation slots. In addition, you will have a discount on tray reservations (discount which differs depending on your subscription) and access to a certain number of events.

'' Evening subscription '' gives you access to the cloakroom as well as to ALL our events for free in addition to a 20% discount on a guest's entrance ticket.

  • $ 25 - The Happy Hour : You will receive a free drink
  • $ 75 - Small Night-Out: You will receive 2 drinks and a ticket for the event of your choice
  • $ 175 - The Two Make a Pair: You will receive 2 drinks and a pair of tickets for the event of your choice in addition to a special edition apron from the Atelier Tentaculaire (to be picked up on site)
  • $ 250 - Outing for two: You will receive a meal to share with a bottle of wine as well as a pair of tickets for the event of your choice in addition to an apron special edition of the Atelier Tentaculaire (to be picked up on site )
  • $ 500 - The Artist in Me: You will receive a 3-hour session using the set of your choice, 3 meals and 3 drinks in addition to a special edition apron from the Atelier Tentaculaire (to be picked up on site)
  • $ 500 - The Night Bird: You will receive a ticket for 3 events of your choice OR 3 tickets for the same event, 3 meals as well as 3 drinks in addition to a special edition apron from the Atelier Tentaculaire (to be picked up on site )
  • $ 1,000 - The Lucky 7: You will receive a 7-hour session using the set of your choice, 7 meals and 7 drinks OR 2 bottles of wine in addition to a special edition apron from the Atelier Tentaculaire (to be picked up on site )
  • $ 1,000 - The Method: You will receive a one month, day OR evening, subscription to our services with all its benefits in addition to a special edition apron from the Atelier Tentaculaire (to be picked up on site) 
  • $ 5,000 - The Balcony: You will receive a year, day OR evening, subscription to our services with all its benefits, a 10% discount on all your alcohol and food purchase for the year in addition to an apron special edition of the Atelier Tentaculaire (to be picked up on site)
  • $ 10,000 - The First Row: You will receive a year, day OR evening, subscription to our services with all its benefits, a 25% discount on all your alcohol and food purchase for the year in addition to an apron special edition of the Atelier Tentaculaire (to be picked up on site)
  • $ 15,000 - The Pass V.I.P.: You will receive a year, day AND evening, subscription to our services with all its benefits, a 40% discount on all your alcohol and food purchase for the year and a shareable discount of 25 % with a friend * in addition to a special edition apron from the Atelier Tentaculaire (to be picked up on site)

* In other words, you will receive a 40% discount if you come alone or a shareable discount of 25% for you and 25% for your guest when you come accompanied. 

Nos Défis

Notre but avec L'Atelier Tentaculaire est de démocratiser l'art au Québec. En d'autres mots, nous souhaitons rendre l'art plus accessible à tous et l'éloigner du cadre rigide institutionnel qui empêche les artistes de rayonner à leur plein potentiel. Par ailleurs, nous désirons nous inscrire dans les débat sociaux actuels et amener sur le marché une entreprise qui réfléchie différemment et qui est centrée autours de sa clientèle et de ses employés. De plus, nous voulons avoir une consommation éco-responsable, ce qui peut être difficile dans le domaine artistique. Ainsi, nous voulons mettre de l'avant et éduquer notre clientèle sur l'usage intelligent de nos matériaux, pour permettre à tous de diminuer notre emprunte écologique. 

Éventuellement, nous allons développer des partenariat avec des entreprises de recyclage de matière toxiques, suite à la quantité de produit nocifs qui se retrouve dans les divers médium d'art. En plus, nous prioriseront les produits qui respecte l'environnement et le commerce équitable, et ce, dans tous nos secteurs d'activités. Le composte, le recyclage et la réutilisation seront au cœur de nos priorités en tant qu'entreprise. 

Le contexte actuel de l'industrie nécessite que nous mettions en place un système d'éducation à cette consommation intelligente. 

Our Challenges

Our goal with L'Atelier tentaculaire is to democratize art in Quebec. In other words, we want to make art more accessible to everyone and move away from the rigid institutional framework that restreint artists to reach their full potential. In addition, we want to be part of current social debates and bring to the market a company that thinks differently and that is centered around its customers and employees. In addition, we want to have an eco-responsible consumption, which can be difficult in the artistic field. Thus, we want to put forward and educate our customers on the intelligent use of our materials, to allow everyone to reduce our ecological footprint.

Eventually, we will develop a partnership with companies that recycle toxic materials, due to the quantity of harmful products found in various art mediums. In addition, we will prioritize products that respect the environment and fair trade, in all our sectors of activity. Compost, recycling and reuse will be at the heart of our priorities as a company.

The current context of the industry requires that we set up an education system for this intelligent consumption.

Vous désirez contribuer autrement?

Nous avons la solution!

  • N'hésitez pas à aimer notre page Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/lateliertentaculaire) et à nous suivre sur Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/latelier_tentaculaire/) @latelier_tentaculaire
  • Parlez-en autour de vous en partageant cette campagne ainsi que les liens vers nos réseaux sociaux!
  • Venez régulièrement chez nous avec vos amis lorsque nous serons ouverts!

Other Ways You Can Help?

We have the solution!

  • Feel free to like our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/lateliertentaculaire) and follow us on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/latelier_tentaculaire/) @latelier_tentaculaire
  • Talk about it around you by sharing this campaign and the links to our social networks!
  • Come regularly with us with your friends when we are open!
story_txt:
L'Atelier Tentaculaire - Un endroit, Tous les arts
*Version Française et Anglaise en alternance / French and English version alternately*
Notre Petite Histoire
En 2015, nous nous sommes rencontrées à l’école de théâtre et ce fut une évidence pour toutes les deux qu'un jour, nous allions partir en entreprise ensemble; c'est à ce moment que naquit la première ébauche de cette compagnie. 
Après mille et une péripéties et formations acquises, nous avons revues nos idées et créé un concept unique qui rassemble tous nos besoins et désirs. Il était clair que nous voulions un espace rempli d'art et d'artistes, un espace dans lequel ils se sentiraient chez-eux et pourraient produire librement. Nous avions envie de créer un sentiment familial et envie d’unifier les artistes dans un même lieu, c’est ainsi que l’ATELIER TENTACULAIRE est né. 
Ainsi L'Atelier Tentaculaire se veux être une entreprise locale dont la vocation est de promouvoir les artiste émergents et de les unir autour de créations communes mise à l'avant dans nos lieux. De jour, L'Atelier T sera aussi un café où breuvages et nourritures seront offerts . De soir, l'endroit se changera en un bar artistique avec une salle de spectacles  où seront présentés nos divers artistes de la scène dans une programmation variée et soigneusement conçue.
Short Summary
In 2015, we met at the theater school and it was obvious for both of us that one day, we were going to go open a business together; it was at this time that the first draft of this company was born.
After a thousand adventures and acquired training, we have reviewed our ideas and created a unique concept that brings together all our needs and desires. It was clear that we wanted a space filled with art and artists, a space in which they would feel at home and could produce freely. We wanted to create a family feeling and wanted to unite the artists in the same place, this is how the TENTACULAR WORKSHOP (L'Atelier Tentaculaire) was born. Thus wants to be a local company whose vocation is to promote emerging artists and to unite them around common creations put forward in our places.
During the day, L'Atelier T will also be a café where beverages and foods will be offered. In the evening, the place will change into an artistic bar with a stage where our various performing artists will be presented in a varied and carefully designed program.

''Abonnement de jour'' vous donne accès à un espace de travail aménagé pour la durée de l'abonnement, un casier et un caddie pour votre matériel et diverses plages de réservation  de plateau de jour, de soir comme de fin de semaine. De plus, vous aurez un rabais sur les réservations de plateaux (rabais qui diffère selon votre abonnement) et un accès à un certain nombre d'événements.
''Abonnement de soir'' vous donne accès au vestiaire ainsi qu'à TOUS nos événements gratuitement en plus d'un 20% de rabais sur le billet d'entrée d'un invité.

250$ - La Sortie à deux: Vous recevrez un repas à partager avec une bouteille de vin ainsi qu'une paire de billets pour l'événement de votre choix en plus d'un tablier édition spéciale de l'Atelier (à récupérer sur place)

story:
There are so many reasons for the jewelry industry to come together to collaborate on goals and principles, not the least of which is we are faced with growing demands from banks, NGOs and governments. In addition, the Millenials are coming! And though they still like the shiny and beautiful objects of our industry, their buying decisions are grounded in social and environmental justice.

It’s time for us to self-organize and self-manage our industry to address positive social and environmental outcomes; if we don’t, all the outside influencers will do it for us – which just might put us out of business. This summit is about coming together to collaborate on identifying shared goals and developing tools and practices that can help us achieve those goals over time.

If you’re in the jewelry business - anywhere along the supply chain – we want your voice in the conversation. Part of funding the summit is simply registering for the event in March! Join your colleagues in taking the lead on making jewelry a sustainable, even resilient business!

Read on further for our mission statement and the goals of the summit.




Mission Statement 

Our community of individuals from all sectors in the jewelry industry seeks at the summit to develop a shared vision to meet the challenges, to sustain our business and to improve the supply chain for our products. The purpose of the summit is to discuss challenges and opportunities in the jewelry industry that can better support everyone in the supply chain.


Goal: The goal of the summit is to develop a set of guiding principles towards which businesses can voluntarily progress to achieve best practices. After the summit, tools can be developed to assist industry members to set goals and achieve improvement in meeting the goals developed by consensus. A positive result of the widely attended and public forum will be to demonstrate to governments, civil society, to the banking community and to consumers that the industry is pro-actively engaging in creating a positive environment to benefit everyone in the supply chain and is doing so in a manner that allows access for all companies to voluntarily engage at all levels.

Format: A two and ½ day industry wide event, professionally facilitated, open to all. Located centrally in New York, NY, we plan to host this event during the month of March 2016 immediately preceding the JA/NY trade show. Attendees will be from every sector of the international trade from producers to retailers, and everyone in between, and from all sectors, including precious metals, color gemstones and diamonds.

Program: The program will include education on current challenges in all sectors of the industry, information on supply chain integrity systems already in place, and a review of current expectations of government regulators, banks that finance the industry and consumers regarding responsible business practices. 

The summit will be an interactive and facilitated discussion about important industry issues pertaining to business practices and the supply chain with the goal of ensuring that the jewelry industry will thrive in the 21st Century. 

Participants will include members of the diamond, colored gem and precious metal industries, trade associations, financial institutions, as well as those in the international communities. They will have the opportunity to shape the outcome of the discussions, and to develop tools to ensure that the industry can support the entire supply chain.


Registration Fee: $400

story:
Thank you for checking out my Campaign!

I am Markella Smith, Community Organizer, Entrepreneur, Mother to 3 amazing boys and a Lifelong North Minneapolis Resident!

I am a strong believer in the power of the village and the idea that community often already has all that it needs to thrive and with a little support, amazing things can happen! As an entrepreneur myself, I've been able to take a skill I learned from my grandmother and turn into a business that has helped sustain my family through the years.

Fast Forward to 2020, COVID hits, and Community Markets and Vendor Events are canceled. Stores are closing left and right, leaving so many artists and makers without a place to sell their wares! More than ever, a central place to sell giftable items and somewhere people could intentionally shop local and support local was needed. And that's where the vision of having a central gift shop where local artists, makers and entrepreneurs not only have a permanent space to sell their items, but community members have a central place to connect, came to life.

This gift shop will essentially be a small business incubator with a village feel, where community members can come get business advice and support from someone who looks like them and lives in the same community as them. A community member could potentially walk in the door with an idea, and walk out with a plan of action to get their items displayed in the shop. A space that supports and encourages BIPOC Artists, Entrepreneurs and Makers to go after their dreams and obtain greatness. 

This space will also feature a space of holistic healing and togetherness that represents the people who live within the community.

What We Need

The full goal of this campaign is $10,000! This $10,000 will help transform a vacant store front space into a beautiful gift shop, one that the North Minneapolis more than deserves!

You contributions will be used in the following way:

  • Security System and Cameras for the space
  • Exterior Painting and brightening up the corner
  • Shelving and a space divider to separate the gift shop from the community event space.
  • Aesthetics for the Gift shop & the Community Space so that it is warm and welcoming!

Even if we do not reach my entire goal all funds raised will be used to get the space functioning and get the shop open.

The Impact

Your contribution is a chance to make a real impact in a community that is under served and undervalued. North Minneapolis has long been disinvested in and as a community of mostly BIPOC individuals this is a chance to help bring the concept of building Generational Wealth through entrepreneurship into the community!

The Gift Shop will:

  • Create a space for us by us, where we can cultivate dreams and turn them into reality.
  • Offer trainings and support to businesses and individuals to help build out branding and professional business appearance with labeling and displays. 
  • Give community the opportunity to support local business and help stimulate the local business economy!
  • Employ people from the community (mostly teens) and circulate money back into the community through the consignment of products!
  • Feature a space of holistic healing and togetherness that represents the people who live within the community.

Risks & Challenges

Every business idea comes with some risks, and let's face it, COVID let us see just how challenging the retail world could be, but the last year has taught me how to pivot and the nice thing about The Dream Shop is that it gives other makers, businesses and artists a place to keep sales coming in year round! And if something happens where the physical location needs to shut down or close for  a while... well that's where our online platform will come in to play! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially but want to help in some way?

Share, share, share!

Sharing this campaign helps in so many ways! You never know who this dream may resonate with and the further the reach the larger the impact!

Follow us on Social Media!

Be sure to follow our FB & Instagram page for all the updates: @TheDreamShopMpls
story_txt:
Thank you for checking out my Campaign!
I am Markella Smith, Community Organizer, Entrepreneur, Mother to 3 amazing boys and a Lifelong North Minneapolis Resident!
I am a strong believer in the power of the village and the idea that community often already has all that it needs to thrive and with a little support, amazing things can happen! As an entrepreneur myself, I've been able to take a skill I learned from my grandmother and turn into a business that has helped sustain my family through the years.
Fast Forward to 2020, COVID hits, and Community Markets and Vendor Events are canceled. Stores are closing left and right, leaving so many artists and makers without a place to sell their wares! More than ever, a central place to sell giftable items and somewhere people could intentionally shop local and support local was needed. And that's where the vision of having a central gift shop where local artists, makers and entrepreneurs not only have a permanent space to sell their items, but community members have a central place to connect, came to life.
This gift shop will essentially be a small business incubator with a village feel, where community members can come get business advice and support from someone who looks like them and lives in the same community as them. A community member could potentially walk in the door with an idea, and walk out with a plan of action to get their items displayed in the shop. A space that supports and encourages BIPOC Artists, Entrepreneurs and Makers to go after their dreams and obtain greatness. 
This space will also feature a space of holistic healing and togetherness that represents the people who live within the community.

What We Need
The full goal of this campaign is $10,000! This $10,000 will help transform a vacant store front space into a beautiful gift shop, one that the North Minneapolis more than deserves!
You contributions will be used in the following way:

Security System and Cameras for the space
Exterior Painting and brightening up the corner
Shelving and a space divider to separate the gift shop from the community event space.
Aesthetics for the Gift shop & the Community Space so that it is warm and welcoming!

Even if we do not reach my entire goal all funds raised will be used to get the space functioning and get the shop open.

The Impact
Your contribution is a chance to make a real impact in a community that is under served and undervalued. North Minneapolis has long been disinvested in and as a community of mostly BIPOC individuals this is a chance to help bring the concept of building Generational Wealth through entrepreneurship into the community!
The Gift Shop will:

Create a space for us by us, where we can cultivate dreams and turn them into reality.
Offer trainings and support to businesses and individuals to help build out branding and professional business appearance with labeling and displays. 
Give community the opportunity to support local business and help stimulate the local business economy!
Employ people from the community (mostly teens) and circulate money back into the community through the consignment of products!
Feature a space of holistic healing and togetherness that represents the people who live within the community.


Risks & Challenges
Every business idea comes with some risks, and let's face it, COVID let us see just how challenging the retail world could be, but the last year has taught me how to pivot and the nice thing about The Dream Shop is that it gives other makers, businesses and artists a place to keep sales coming in year round! And if something happens where the physical location needs to shut down or close for  a while... well that's where our online platform will come in to play! 

Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute financially but want to help in some way?
Share, share, share!
Sharing this campaign helps in so many ways! You never know who this dream may resonate with and the further the reach the larger the impact!
Follow us on Social Media!
Be sure to follow our FB & Instagram page for all the updates: @TheDreamShopMpls

story:
Last year, after graduating, I made a powerful choice to move to back to Kenya to tackle what I care most about: Providing opportunities for women, the poor, and marginalized minorities to make sure that children don’t grow up in poverty.

The seed of this mission was planted at the age of 9 when a civil war destroyed my family home, farm, and everything we owned. With nothing left, we moved to a ghetto in Nairobi, where I got to experience absolute poverty first-hand. 

Now, years later, I have the education and expertise to make a difference. I need the funds... and that's where you come in.

HOW WE WILL MAKE THIS VISION A REALITY

ECODUNIA is a social enterprise that works with local producers in Kenya to make products that are not only environmentally sustainable, but are useful and unique. We are creating opportunities and empowering women, the poor, and marginalized minorities. 

We are building a brand that has the capacity to provide work to over 500 jobs in Kenya in the next two years. We are committed to providing dignified work opportunities that will help workers pull themselves out of poverty. 

 

WHAT IS A SOCIAL ENTERPRISE

A social enterprise is a for-profit business that prioritizes people, communities and the environment before profit. And profits are reinvested into the business and into the communes they serve. 

They often don't appeal to traditional investors, as the profit margins are generally low.  However, once up and running, these businesses self-sustain and benefit everyone.

 

 

COST OF MAKING THIS VISION A REALITY 

How much does it cost to turn this dream into a reality?  So far, it has cost me all my savings (it's not like I had a lot). We have done the math and our final magic number to launch ECODUNIA is $31,000. Here is a breakdown of how we will use the money: 

  • Product Development (investing in the community to bring you a great product)
  • Building Inventory (money in the pockets of the workers as they create your order)
  • Shipping (from Eldoret to your door)
  • Marketing (Please let your friends know, we’ll tell everyone else)
  • Operating expenses (y’know, gotta keep the lights on)
  • Buying more Inventory  (The Circle of Life keeps the wheels turning)
 
Preview your Amazing Trip to Africa: Authentic Kenyan Experience and a Safari

 

Risks & Challenges

Our business is operating in a country where more than a million youth enter the labor market annually without skills. According to the British Council report, many Kenyans lack the necessary skill sets that the job market requires. Helping unskilled workers to become qualified for the work they are doing requires an investment of time and money.

That's where your money and our work combine to make a difference and help those in need. AND YOU GET COOL THINGS THAT YOU CAN USE (OR GIFT) AND YOU WON’T HURT THE PLANET WHILE DOING IT.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need you and we need your money.  We can’t do this without you. Make a commitment to:

  • Contribute some cash and choose you Perks 
  • Tell your friends and family to do the same
  • You know your friend who can’t afford cool bags right now, double your pledge for any perk and email us your friend’s info. We’ll send them a duplicate of your perk, too.
  • Spread the word on social media - Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, and myspace.com. Email and text are great, too. Phone calls are even better. 

Lastly, a word from Mother Earth: “STOP using single-use plastic. I’m drowning here. Buy cool cotton bags and make a pledge today.”

story:
*** UPDATE: We've been able to save some money as we go! We scored 3400 sq ft of used rubber flooring locally at a third of retail cost and we've been able to use recycled materials to build the new checkout counter =)

What we've spent on the move so far

$2,720: rubber flooring

$342: New point-of-sale hardware

$800: twenty shopping carts

$75: concrete to fill holes and build a handicap ramp

$565: White paint

$1100: National Grid Deposit

$2,000 (approx.): labor

$740: Four 4x8 Signs by Liberty Graphics

$63: Flags for front of building

$250: misc (hardware, fire extinguisher signs, no-smoking signs, etc)

$160: LED ceiling lights

$200: Site planning permit

$1,800: Asphalt pad for forklift

RUNNING TOTAL = $10,815

What we have left to spend (Estimated)

$200: Cart corral

$350: Another point-of-sale setup

$500: Banners and signs for in the store

$2,000: labor

$1,000: Freight (we have a local driver to move our trailers, merchandise and shelving)

$1,875: Direct Mail and radio advertising to promote the new location

$825: Utilities (Costs about this much at each location and we're overlapping for a month) 

$1,000 Misc (Thinset concrete and epoxy resin for the checkout counter, hardware, various building materials to finish out the new space, unexpected costs)

RUNNING TOTAL: $7,750

 

Click on a Perk to the the right for details --->

 

FROM THE OWNER...

*DISCLAIMER!!! Money is a touchy subject to many people. It may even offend you that we're asking for contributions. So I want to say NO ONE IS UNDER ANY OBLIGATION WHATSOEVER. This campaign is to reach people who WANT to be a part of our business. And we are offering incentives as well, so people who donate $50 or more are essentially buying a year-long discount card to use whenever they'd like. Plus there's merch. Plus there's this whole Wall of Honor thing. Plus... You get the idea. So let's jump in!

The Short & Sweet

We're moving, expanding our inventory and enhancing the whole shopping experience at Callahan's! Same beautiful staff, same core values... but with a NEW Dix Ave location, NEW sources for liquidation merchandise, and NEW ways to save money. Also - DREW IS COMING BACK! I've been on hiatus while working on some other projects but now I will personally be in charge of sourcing, marketing, customer relations and most importantly COMMUNITY IMPACT, meaning- finding creative and fun ways to give back to our neighbors in need. There's no point owning a business if it doesn't help people. You need to have a purpose.

We're locals through and through. This is our town and you are our people... and we plan to be here for a long time doing WHAT we love with the PEOPLE we love. To do that we need to grow and evolve, and to do that... well, we need YOU.

This is a growth campaign. We're asking for the support of our people to get over some of the financial hurdles that stand in the way of a really awesome and fulfilling future. A golden opportunity came knocking and we answered, knowing it was by far the best path forward for our little business. That's the broad stroke. Now the details... 

What We Need & What You Get 

  • Short answer: We need a minimum of $20k to relocate seamlessly, although anything above that certainly won't go to waste! The more we raise, the better equipped the store can be and the cooler the merchandise can be. You can join the Callahan Clan as a contributing member and get a year's worth of discounts on our sweet merch. Increasing levels of contribution will come with increasing levels of membership and perks. Read on!
  • Long answer... Moving is no small or inexpensive matter, especially for a business that operates within microscopic margins. We've kept our promise to keep prices low but that means we ride a fine line. In order to KEEP keeping our promise we need to keep overhead down. In order to do THAT we need some growth capital. Here are some of the costs of moving...
    • ELBOW GREASE: The new building was an auto-body shop... need I say more?  It takes some serious spit-shine to polish... well, ACTUAL grease. We're demolishing walls, refinishing floors, renovating this and that, cleaning, painting, and turning a messy ol' garage into a shiny yet functional retail store. Feng shui ain't free!
    • LABOR: Employees appreciate paychecks, even when the store's not making any money (like say- during a big labor intensive relocation project!)
    • MARKETING: People need to know! And we need to hit the ground running. Radio, mail, and even Facebook can be expensive... but as they say "You need to spend money to make money."
    • SHELVING & DISPLAYS: New store; new layout; new displays. We're thrifty and we'll reuse whatever we can but there's no way to avoid some store display purchases.
    • UTILITIES: Can't avoid the overlap. Paying utilities at two locations until the clean break is made AND putting down deposits on the new accounts. 
    • MERCHANDISE: Keeping up with regular supply and demand is a challenge in and of itself... But stocking a vacant warehouse CHOCK full of merch in the course of several weeks; well that's a logistical nightmare to say the least!
    • SUPPLIES & EQUIPMENT: our point of sale system is old and slow (kinda like how I feel in the mornings) but we can't slow down! Not in this industry. So we need new hardware. And we need shopping carts that don't squeak and wobble and veer off to the left. And we need new business cards, and we need to build a new checkout counter... get the idea?

The Impact

Hudson Falls will get a big cool liquidation warehouse run and operated BY locals FOR locals. Or non-locals... we don't care - come one, come all!  We love everybody =)  

Along with the move we're going to shift our focus back to the community where it belongs. My personal motto for this business is "Never get greedy." We want to give back to our neighbors and I have a lot of ideas to implement. 

Risks & Challenges

"Nothing risked, nothing gained."

In some ways we're rolling the proverbial dice, in other ways we're leaning confidently on a known and proven system. Our business model works, Hudson Falls has accepted us as one of their own, and we know the industry inside and out, along with its pitfalls (some of which we've experienced firsthand). But we're not going to settle for same-ol-same-ol. We've heard from our customers and what we've heard is "Bring us something new and exciting!"  So that's the plan. We're going to roll those dice and play with new sourcing opportunities. The shelves should be filled with an ever-changing, mind-boggling variety of merchandise.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute financially but that doesn't mean you can't help! In this day and age of saturated social media* and exhaustive ad campaigns NOTHING spreads a message like a friendly human talking to another friendly human with real mouth parts and real words! Tell your people about us and we will be forever grateful. Also - we take recycled shopping bags... so that's TWO ways you can help!   =)

*social media does actually work. A Facebook share is the digital equivalent to giving us a big ol' bear hug. Or like giving us the classic finger pistol coupled with a wink and a click of the tongue that tells us"I got your back."  

 

And that's all I have to say about that.

story:
Short Summary

  • We (Boroka & Tamas) always loved dogs and we have a passion for them, so after we returned home, we decided to start our own mobile dog grooming business.
  • It's important for us because we love dogs, and because we would like to support other dog owners by providing a top notch service in Cluj Npoca.
  • We would like to support dog shelters in the future as there are many left behind pupppies on the streets.
  • Any £ - $ - euro - lei helps :) 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We had some investments so we bought the van and we hired a company who will be able to do the conversion.
  • We would need a bath, hair dryer, generator, water heater, water pump and a grooming table, grooming tool.

The Impact

  • We will own the first mobile pet grooming salon in Romania and we are planning to expand in the future in Romania and Hungary.
  • As Ex- Mariott emplyees we were lucky enough to learn what it means to provide and outstanding service and we will spread this knowledge across Eastern Europe.
  • Unfortunately we have loads of stray dogs in this region, so we would like to support them and hopefully the government will reduce the numbers by implementing the right laws.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

  • There is a risk with the current economical situation.
  • It wil take a few months, years until we will be well known.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If someone could help us with a website creation as we have our domain already.
  • You can send us tools: towels, clippers, scissors, dog treats, shampoo. :)

story:
The Origin of Puppyccino's

It was another sweltering summer day at Zilker Park. Our Pyrenees-Husky pup trotted along close to us, but would never step into the sunlight. He'd lay waiting in the shadows for a cloud to roll across the sun before darting over to his next hiding place. He must have been no more than 3 months old, but all that puppy energy was drained by the Texas heat. Tera and I would patiently wait for him to rest before continuing our walk - the weather was just too exhausting for us. That may be the first moment we began to imagine doing things another way. The day we thought of Puppyccino's.

 

The Plan:

Puppyccino's will be an indoor dog park and cafe where dog parents and their pups can socialize, play, and spend some time enjoying life together. We're not a replacement for your weekend hikes, evening walks, or days swimming in Barking Springs - we're an alternative for those stormy days and dreadful heatwaves. Maybe you have to dedicate some of your evening to work or you have finals coming up and just can't make it out with your pup - we're here for you.

Fun Additions:

We want to be your destination for an exciting day with your dog. We'll stay true to the Austin way by featuring beer brewed by local breweries, coffee roasted in-town, and wine from Texas wineries. We will work with other local businesses to bring you free dog yoga, movie nights with your pup, and special menus from hometown food trucks - including specially prepared food for canines.

 

Giving Back:

Puppyccino's is taking on the mission of finding a home for as many shelter dogs as possible. We too often hear stories of dogs being abandoned, discarded, or neglected. They deserve much better and we'll give it to them. Puppyccino's is working with local rescues to set aside part of our space as a dedicated foster facility. This area will be connected but separated from the main play yard so these dogs feel safe and content. They'll be dubbed our cafe dogs and will be available for attention and adoption by anyone who applies to the appropriate rescue.

 

The Full Story:

My name is Steven "Vince" Parish. I'm a graduate of UT and a long-time Austin resident. Tera is a graduate from Tamkang University in Taiwan. We were inspired by our dog Nanuk to create Puppyccino's.

It was early 2018 when we started planning out our vision of what Puppyccino's will be. The concept has evolved from a food truck that serves coffee with a tented yard to the full-fledged dog cafe and indoor dog park we’re working toward today. We spent six months bouncing the idea off of every person we met at Austin's off-leash trails and dog parks. We collected targeted surveys to learn what the community needed, talked to baristas and cafe owners to find out what to expect, and worked with business professionals to construct a solid business plan.

We want Puppyccino's to change the way you spend time with your dog. We want it to be your Friday night and Sunday brunch destination where you can bring your dog AND they have fun on their visit. We want it to be the go-to place for inclement weather and those days your pup is feeling bored laying at home. Our business is happy dogs and happy dog parents.

We're offering all of this to you. Our model and our plan are solid. The last step is generating enough contributions to open the doors. We're reaching out to everyone that thought it was a great idea and really wants to see it become a reality. Please help us get there.

Thank you.

 

Your Contributions Will:

  • Create a space that all dog parents will love!
  • Aid in the rescue of countless homeless pups
  • Provide living-wage jobs for numerous Austin food-industry workers
  • Provide a retail space for Austin breweries, wineries, and coffee roasters
  • Build a place where humans and dogs can interact in new ways
  • Assist us in funding the following:
    • Deposit and rent to secure warehouse space within Austin
    • Interior construction
    • Equipment rental and purchases
    • Initial licensure
story_txt:
The Origin of Puppyccino's
It was another sweltering summer day at Zilker Park. Our Pyrenees-Husky pup trotted along close to us, but would never step into the sunlight. He'd lay waiting in the shadows for a cloud to roll across the sun before darting over to his next hiding place. He must have been no more than 3 months old, but all that puppy energy was drained by the Texas heat. Tera and I would patiently wait for him to rest before continuing our walk - the weather was just too exhausting for us. That may be the first moment we began to imagine doing things another way. The day we thought of Puppyccino's.

 
The Plan:
Puppyccino's will be an indoor dog park and cafe where dog parents and their pups can socialize, play, and spend some time enjoying life together. We're not a replacement for your weekend hikes, evening walks, or days swimming in Barking Springs - we're an alternative for those stormy days and dreadful heatwaves. Maybe you have to dedicate some of your evening to work or you have finals coming up and just can't make it out with your pup - we're here for you.
Fun Additions:
We want to be your destination for an exciting day with your dog. We'll stay true to the Austin way by featuring beer brewed by local breweries, coffee roasted in-town, and wine from Texas wineries. We will work with other local businesses to bring you free dog yoga, movie nights with your pup, and special menus from hometown food trucks - including specially prepared food for canines.

 
Giving Back:
Puppyccino's is taking on the mission of finding a home for as many shelter dogs as possible. We too often hear stories of dogs being abandoned, discarded, or neglected. They deserve much better and we'll give it to them. Puppyccino's is working with local rescues to set aside part of our space as a dedicated foster facility. This area will be connected but separated from the main play yard so these dogs feel safe and content. They'll be dubbed our cafe dogs and will be available for attention and adoption by anyone who applies to the appropriate rescue.
 
The Full Story:
My name is Steven "Vince" Parish. I'm a graduate of UT and a long-time Austin resident. Tera is a graduate from Tamkang University in Taiwan. We were inspired by our dog Nanuk to create Puppyccino's.
It was early 2018 when we started planning out our vision of what Puppyccino's will be. The concept has evolved from a food truck that serves coffee with a tented yard to the full-fledged dog cafe and indoor dog park we’re working toward today. We spent six months bouncing the idea off of every person we met at Austin's off-leash trails and dog parks. We collected targeted surveys to learn what the community needed, talked to baristas and cafe owners to find out what to expect, and worked with business professionals to construct a solid business plan.
We want Puppyccino's to change the way you spend time with your dog. We want it to be your Friday night and Sunday brunch destination where you can bring your dog AND they have fun on their visit. We want it to be the go-to place for inclement weather and those days your pup is feeling bored laying at home. Our business is happy dogs and happy dog parents.
We're offering all of this to you. Our model and our plan are solid. The last step is generating enough contributions to open the doors. We're reaching out to everyone that thought it was a great idea and really wants to see it become a reality. Please help us get there.
Thank you.

 
Your Contributions Will:

Create a space that all dog parents will love!
Aid in the rescue of countless homeless pups
Provide living-wage jobs for numerous Austin food-industry workers
Provide a retail space for Austin breweries, wineries, and coffee roasters
Build a place where humans and dogs can interact in new ways
Assist us in funding the following:
Deposit and rent to secure warehouse space within Austin
Interior construction
Equipment rental and purchases
Initial licensure

story:
The Grove started as a little seed planted in Tom's head during a trip to Montenegro in summer 2013. It grew, through excited emails, reconnaissance trips and inter-continental video calls, into this: the refurbishment and renovation of a derelict mill in the stunning olive grove-lined hills of southern Montenegro. Built in 1860, and originally housing a soap factory and later an olive mill, this unique piece of Balkan history has been neglected and fallen into ruin and disrepair since the earthquake of 1979. 

Having cobbled together the funds to purchase the property, we are to transform it into a hub of creativity. Providing high end hostel/hotel accommodation in the form of private rooms and dormitory beds for those travelling through, the space will also host retreats, workshops and events. We cannot wait for you to visit, stay with us, and contribute to making this place what we know it can be.

For detailed information on the progress so far, video tours of the internals and to stay up to date, please visit http://thegrovemontenegro.blogspot.co.uk

The building and local area

Set in the picturesque town of Stari Bar, The Grove is conveniently tucked away from view beneath a towering 9th century fort, in a valley, next to an aqueduct, with a river running past our doorstep that powers a water wheel. Hiking trails leave from our backyard and meander up the peaks opposite. The silver-green of olive leaves shade the foothills, and fruit and nut trees fill gardens with abundance. The cobbled main street of Stari Bar has a decidedly friendly, local air, and the restaurants and cafes bustle in the warmth of early evening. For those after the ocean, we are 3km from the crystal clear Adriatic Sea - important, as Bar is one of Europe's sunniest cities.

The building sits on a substantial plot, however we were also able to secure a sizeable chunk of land at the rear of the property. This will be terraced, and used for cultivation of fruits and vegetables. 

A close-up satellite view of the building: https://www.google.com/maps/@42.0914946,19.1373739,20z/data=!3m1!1e3?force=lite


Montenegro 

A small, unassuming country that never fails to surprise you. From the unspoilt, stunning beaches, to the breathtaking mountains, it is a remarkably beautiful land. Montenegrin is spoken, a Slavic language, and the Euro is the currency used. Friendlier folks you will be hard pressed to meet. Lake Skadar is an impressive body of water, located just over the hills from us. A bird watcher's paradise, it is an important draw to the region, and a site of significant European biodiversity. In a couple of hours by train you can be in Kolašin, skiing the slopes in winter, or hiking the alpine terrain in spring. The quaint walled towns of Kotor and Budva are easily reachable on relaxed day trips, over land or by sea.

Further Afield 

What an inspiring area to find ourselves in. As a place to come and explore and be creative, we are ideally located at somewhat of a crossroads between East and West. There are ferry links twice weekly over to Bari in Italy, the route through Montenegro from Croatia to Albania (or vice versa) is a backpacker's dream, and there are direct trains through the mountains and over spectacular viaducts on the renowned Bar to Belgrade line. This link to Serbia, and others to Bosnia and Herzegovina, Macedonia and Greece all make for an exciting place to visit.

The below images are taken throughout nearby Bosnia and Croatia.

  

       



The Work

Alas, our building needs significant love. Structurally sound as it is, we are in need of a kickstart to enable us to quickly gut the interior, strengthen the exterior and replace the first floor. We will refit the interior ourselves - indeed the Quilliam brothers have faced such a challenge before - the entire renovation of a heritage-listed building that now houses their grand teahouse in Newcastle, UK. 

Whilst we can tile, install bathrooms, kitchens, windows, internal walls and such matters ourselves, we need to retro-fit with earthquake-proof reinforcement, and install a new first floor - all requiring professional engineering and architectural expertise. We are working with local architects and tradesmen, restoring the building to its original splendour with traditional wooden beams and stone work. Their knowledge and expertise is invaluable in this project.

Needless to say, any work we can do ourselves - any measure we can take to save funds by using our own sweat and blood - we will! This £20,000 is the total we need to complete the structural engineering work straight away. Once this work is complete, everything will be done by our hands, and by those kind enough to drop in and assist. Any additional funds raised through this campaign will be used to help make the establishment as green as possible: we are investing in solar thermal and PV panels, micro-hydro power (our water wheel), grey water recycling, low energy cooling systems and energy storage solutions. We are working with renewable energy engineers from Podgorica (the capital of Montenegro) who are designing these systems with the architects from stage one, to create one congruent, eco-friendly building. 


Time Scale

Once fund raising is complete, phase one will proceed. This consists of all structural work, the rebuilding of the first floor, roof work, external joinery and connection to mains services. This will be completed by spring 2016. In Autumn 2016, phase two will begin. This will consist of the internal first fit, building of internal partitions, installation of services and mech work. The final phase will begin in early 2017. The project will be ready by summer 2017. 

Throughout all of this there will be work to do in the gardens. Terracing the back plot, neatening the river bank, building the plunge pool and constructing pergolas, fire pits and seating areas. For example. 

The Team

Pat (Missing from above photo due to baby delivery!) -  After completing a degree in Fine Art Painting, Pat found he was not highly employable but very proficient at polyfillering. Having set up Quilliam Brothers with, well, his brothers, he found himself a beautiful wife who taught him how to plaster. Walls, that is. They very recently had a daughter, Bea. She is glorious. The plastering and polyfillering skills are strangely applicable. He is very excited to teach Bea what a Montenegro is.

Tom - At the age of 18 he ran away to join a Danish Cirkus, after living the cliché of pootling around Europe in a VW camper he settled in Budapest, initially apprenticing as a woodwind instrument maker. In 2003 he set up the award winning Loft Hostel Budapest. The journey into tea began in 2007 with his first trip to India. The Quilliam Brothers started importing and trading tea in 2009 and their teahouse opened in 2013. He is a saxophone player and a lover of hand made things and hospitality and Mr Rubiks and trains and old olive mills in Montenegro.

Sam - Deciding not to pursue higher education, he worked hard to earn some pennies, whilst playing in a band called 'Vinyl Jacket'. After playing Glastonbury and achieving radio success, the time had arisen for the Quilliam Brothers Teahouse. He is a keen footballer and sportsman with a love of a flutter or two. He cannot wait for The Grove to become a reality!

Chris - Since his early twenties he's been on and off the road across the continents. On one such trip he landed in Budapest, met the Q brothers and ended up managing the Loft Hostel. After a stint living in Chile he ended up in Melbourne, Australia, teaching at a wonderful school, Candlebark - which only strengthened his belief in what groups of like-minded people can achieve when working together. He loves puns, printing his photographs in the darkroom (and hopes to build one at The Grove), and listening to most music that contains shiny instruments.

Risks and challenges

All renovation projects run the risk of falling behind schedule, and over budget. To combat the inevitability of these delays, we have built ample breathing room into our schedule for the works to be completed. From January 2016, one of us will be living on site, seeing the works through, working hand in hand with the contractors and architects to ensure the project is completed to a high standard, and on schedule.

Financials. After the major structural works have been completed the internal fit out will be done by ourselves. This means there is not much risk of things spiralling out of control. We will always be there to shop around, our labour costs will be kept to a minimum and if that fails, we have a contingency in case of unexpected costs.

Legalities. Our relationship with our legal team in Montenegro is of upmost importance to us. They are such a vital element in this process. Permits and certifications are things often left until the last minute, as an afterthought. We have been in constant communication since day one, throughout the purchase and to present day, ensuring the slick transition from pipe dream to renovation project to functioning accommodation.

story:
• Kalayaan ATIN ITO is a group of 10,000 Filipino youth volunteers from the entire Philippine  archipelago organized by themselves to peacefully support the United Nations Convention on the Laws of the Seas as the basis in resolving the  dispute at the Spratlys  Group of Islands.
  • The wisdom of the world leaders in 1982 when they  have foreseen that in the future a sea raw may occur between countries will be put to waste if UNCLOS will not be used to resolve  the dispute. Gone are the days that territorial disputes are  resolved through the barrel of the guns. 
  • Supporting the 10,000 youth to conduct their 30 days  peaceful patriotic voyage at the Spratlys to  call on all parties to peacefully address the dispute will defuse the brewing military build up in the south china sea and avoid  catastrophic entanglement between claimant countries. 

What We Need & What You Get


The Impact

  • If civilian participation will not be done and we continue to allow respective armed forces of the claimant countries to figure out how they can militarily assert their interests in the disputed territories, then tensions will heighten and freedom of navigation will be jeopardized. Worst, recklessness or miscalculations might result to military engagement.
  • In the past 6 Months, our group (Kalayaan ATIN ITO) conducted information drive in all the 81 provinces of the Philippines and encourage the citizens to promote the use of peaceful means to resolve the dispute issues base on international law. Please check our FACEBOOK PAGE: Kalayaan ATIN ITO 
  • Because of the success of the information drive we have done in alll the provinces of the country, 10,000 youth volunteered to join the peaceful voyage to call for peaceful resolution of the dispute.

Risks & Challenges

  • A flotilla of a least 100 fishing boats to be used in this voyage requires accurate boat handling and a challenging logistical support.
  • The biggest challenge that is confronting us is the limited amount of time we have to source out our; Transportation, Food, Shelter in the small Islands, Rest Room facilities, Drinking Water, Communication Equipment, Medical and Evacuation Team, Safety, Security and invitation to the  world youth to participate.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Every one is encourage to challenge all claimant countries to submit their disputes to the United Nations Convention on the Laws of the Seas (UNCLOS), International Tribunal on the Laws of the Seas(ITLOS) and resolve the dispute  peacefully. If we all do this, we will be living peacefully in the whole world.
  • We appreciate if we you can invite other to  use Indiegogo by sharing it to others.!

And that's all there is to it..

story:
Check out our 1 week only Perk!! For $100 you can name a shade of makeup after your pet!! Check out our perks on the right side of the page for more details!





My name is Amber Fawcett, from London, Ontario, Canada. Ferris and Char Char Comestics is my brainchild. The inspiration for my venture came from my two little fur babies, Ferris B and Charlotte. Ferris, a Brussels Griffon, is a little gentleman with a heart of gold, equipped with a beard most men would envy! Charlotte was my eight year old, tiny white Pomeranian princess who I lost far too soon to a heart abnormality in 2014. To pay tribute to these two loves of my life, I made them the namesakes of my company. 


I have combined my love of makeup and my passion for animals into a social enterprise that really makes a difference. Our amazing product line is manufactured in Toronto, using the highest quality ingredients. Whether you wear makeup everyday or only on special occasions, Ferris and Char Char is a brand for everyone! You'll discover beautiful shades named in tribute to animals we've known and loved. Our partner shelters and rescues across Canada and the US receive 10% of all sales. It's our effort to help change the lives of so many animals that need it.


             



      


NEW PERK ADDED!!

ONLY $15

Try Cherry Bomb for 28% off the retail price


    Puddles

    Rufus

    Rover





For your $15 donation, you will receive a Ferris and Char Char 'I helped make this happen' keychain as well as a big thank you on the website



For your $25 donation, we will send you an eyeshadow in the colour of your choice and the Ferris and Char Char keychain along with a shout out on the site



A $50 donation will be honored with an eyeshadow, a vinyl lip lacquer (in the colours of your choice) the keychain and of course a thank you on our site 



A donation of $100 will be honored with an eyeshadow, a vinyl lip lacquer, a mascara (in the colours of your choice) a keychain and a huge thank you on the website



And the BIG one! (only 20 available)


For $250 you will get everything listed above for the $100 donation  and on top of that, we will name a makeup shade after your pet! It will become a permanent product of ours and your pet will have their picture placed beside their shade with a little write up about them. 

Make your pet a star today!!



* Shortly after you have selected the PERK you would like to purchase, you will receive an online survey from Ferris and Char Char Cosmetics which will let you notify us of the shades you have chosen


 

Eyeshadow Shades To Choose From


FEATURES

  • triple milled
  • highly pigmented
  • (P) Pearlized or frosted (M) Matte, no pearl 

These eyeshadows are sheer enough that you don’t feel like you are wearing makeup at all yet gives you enough radiant colour to stand out.


  SNOWBALL M - BARELY BEIGE HIGHLIGHT

  BAXTER M - MUTED TAUPE PEACH

  MARLEY M - LIGHT MEDIUM TAUPE BROWN

  BRINKLEY P- HIGH SHINE DARK PINK CHAMPAGNE

  BANDIT M - MUTED TAUPE BROWN

  BUDDY M - MUTED GOLDEN BROWN

 FIGARO P - MUTED GOLDEN PLUM BROWN AND GOLD SHIMMER

  CHARLIE P - INTENSE PEACH BROWN AND GOLD SHIMMER

  WINN DIXIE P - BRIGHT GLOWING APRICOT WITH SILVER FLECKS

  LADY P - WARM PINK AND GOLD SHIMMER

  TOM M - RICH WARM DUSTY ROSE

  DUCHESS P - DUO CHROME PINK AND PEACH WITH GOLD SHEEN

  LUCKY M - MUTED GREY PLUM

  MONTY P - VIVID BLACK PURPLE WITH RICH RED FLAKES

  ASTRO P - MUTED REDDISH PINKED PLUM

  SCAMP M - INTENSE PURE MATTER BLACK

  SPARKY P - INTENSE BLACKENED NAVY CHARCOAL

  SHADOW M - WARM MUTED TONED CHARCOAL


Vinyl Lip Lacquer Shades To Choose From


FEATURES

  • high impact pigments
  • more coverage and shine than lipgloss
  • longwear lip-hybrid formula
  • similar to liquid lipstick with insane high watt shine
  • fade proof

story_txt:
Check out our 1 week only Perk!! For $100 you can name a shade of makeup after your pet!! Check out our perks on the right side of the page for more details!My name is Amber Fawcett, from London, Ontario, Canada. Ferris and Char Char Comestics is my brainchild. The inspiration for my venture came from my two little fur babies, Ferris B and Charlotte. Ferris, a Brussels Griffon, is a little gentleman with a heart of gold, equipped with a beard most men would envy! Charlotte was my eight year old, tiny white Pomeranian princess who I lost far too soon to a heart abnormality in 2014. To pay tribute to these two loves of my life, I made them the namesakes of my company. 
I have combined my love of makeup and my passion for animals into a social enterprise that really makes a difference. Our amazing product line is manufactured in Toronto, using the highest quality ingredients. Whether you wear makeup everyday or only on special occasions, Ferris and Char Char is a brand for everyone! You'll discover beautiful shades named in tribute to animals we've known and loved. Our partner shelters and rescues across Canada and the US receive 10% of all sales. It's our effort to help change the lives of so many animals that need it.
