story:
Already 10 maternal deaths and 38 neonatal deaths from January to June 2015 in the small town of Duekoue. That's unacceptable. Maternal and newborn deaths are preventable.

1- Leocadie’s story

Our team met Leocadie in the town of Duekoue. Leocadie at the time was 5 months pregnant and was additionally caring for her first son Kouassi. Her story really touched us. Leocadie was diagnosed with anemia in pregnancy which is frequent in the African setting. Anemia in pregnancy could be dangerous for the mother and the baby. When asked if she took an anti-anemic drug, Leocadie told our team that her husband didn’t have the money to buy the drug. Her husband had promised to sell herbs to shepherds in order to gather enough money for the drug. Until then she has to wait despite the risks for her and her baby. If she doesn't get the money, Leocadie could be the next victim of pregnancy. Leocadie could have bought the drug herself, if she had an income-generating activity. 

Keep Mothers Alive (KMA) will start a microloans project for women like Leocadie in order to empower them.

2-  Maternal mortality issue

The majority of women in developed countries view pregnancy and childbirth as the most amazing experiences of their life. Unfortunately, for women living in less developed parts of the world, becoming pregnant and giving birth to a newborn baby means putting their lives at risk. This sad reality is expressed in an African proverb which reads, “Every woman who gives birth has one foot in her grave.”

According to the World Health Organization, in 2013, approximately 800 women per day died due to complications during pregnancy and childbirth combined. Of the 800 daily maternal deaths, 500 occurred in Sub-Saharan Africa and 190 in South Asia, compared to only six deaths in developed countries. Most of these deaths were preventable.  According to the World Health Organization, maternal death is defined as "the death of a woman while pregnant or within 42 days of termination of pregnancy, irrespective of the duration and the site of the pregnancy, from any cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy or its management, but not from accidental or incidental causes.”. 

The risk of a woman in a developing country dying from a maternity-related cause during her lifetime is about 23 times higher compared to a woman living in a developed country. Maternal mortality is a health indicator that shows very wide gaps between rich and poor countries.

3-  About the organization

Keep Mothers Alive is a Virginia-based nonprofit organization created by a Harvard School of Public Health alumnus who holds a strong belief that regardless of where a mother lives, giving birth should be a moment of joy and not a moment of tragedy and despair. Keep Mothers Alive is dedicated to the improvement of women’s health in developing countries. It is a credible and results-driven organization that intends to help decrease maternal mortality.

My personal story

My name is Diagaunet Franck Dodie, I am the founder of Keep Mothers Alive. I was born and raised in Africa. I am a medical doctor from Ivory Coast who immigrated to the US in 2012, and the following year I attended the Harvard School of Public Health. I came to this country to live my American dream, but I am not seeking the traditional American dream: landing a well-paying job or owning a nice car. Instead, I believe I have been given an opportunity that should be used to impact the lives of others at a large scale.

Maternal death is not just a public health issue for me, it is a personal issue. Years ago, I experienced the tragedy of losing a relative during childbirth. In 2003, when I was in my 5th year of medical school on the Ivory Coast, a close cousin named Madeleine died from eclampsia while giving birth to twins. The newborns also did not survive. It was a painful experience for me and my family. It was this personal experience that set the groundwork for Keep Mothers Alive. I decided to mobilize others who felt just as passionately about the importance of maternal health as I did to join together and tackle maternal mortality in Africa.

4-  Target community Background

Duekoue is a small town of about 72,000 people in the western part of the Ivory Coast in West Africa. In 2011 during the Ivorian Civil War, the city suffered the largest massacre in the country’s history. More than 1,000 people were killed in a single day and much of the town’s infrastructure was destroyed. Women and children paid the heaviest price in this war. Four years later, while the community is still healing from the tragedy, the consequences of the civil war persist. Maternal mortality is one of the highest in the country. The community has endured hardship, the women have become even more vulnerable and something needs to be done immediately. Our project aims to help alleviate the suffering of the women in this community.

5-  Current Situation at the maternity ward

5-1  Infrastructure

The maternity ward is cramped. There is only one delivery room with four beds. Deliveries take place in poor conditions. The average temperature in the region is 86 degrees Fahrenheit and there is no air-conditioning.

The office of the midwife is not suitable for antenatal visits and family planning. There is only one examination bed.

There is no room dedicated to obstetric emergencies.

There are no special rooms for the immediate postpartum. Women are released immediately after birth leading to an increased risk of postpartum hemorrhage. 

Beds, mattresses and blankets are obsolete.

There is one operating room and one recovery room with a single bed that is shared with general surgery.

5-2  Medical Equipment

There is no gynecological exam lamp. There are also not enough delivery kits, stethoscopes, blood pressure cuffs, or glucose meters. The maternity ward of Duekoue has no ultrasound and no Radiology center available.

5-3  Causes of maternal mortality

There have already been 10 maternal deaths and 38 child deaths reported from January to June 2015 in the small town of Duekoue. These deaths are a result of postpartum hemorrhage, eclampsia, infection, underground induced abortions, anemia (frequent shortage of blood components), home deliveries and failed deliveries by traditional birth attendants.

6-  Our Project

KMA plans to implement a comprehensive approach to tackle each of the aforementioned causes of maternal mortality by:

a-  Increasing antenatal care and skilled birth attendance.

Our organization intends to raise awareness about their importance by recruiting community health workers (CHW) to provide information sessions within communities. The CHW will use mobile technology to reach out to the most underserved populations.

b-  Providing medical supplies and equipment 

The use of life-saving supplies like oxytocin at birth can prevent postpartum hemorrhage, a leading cause of maternal mortality. KMA is poised to provide the equipment and supplies needed for a better care.

c-  Providing training for health care workers

We will provide continuous medical education and training for mid-wives. We believe that providing the right care at the right time will significantly reduce the risk of maternal mortality.

d-  Women Empowerment (Community ownership)

We believe that the viability of our project will depend on its acceptance by the community. We will contribute to build capacity and finance women's associations to be autonomous and take ownership of the fight against maternal mortality. This strategy is the best way to make the project sustainable.

We set our goal to $ 55 000

The budget will consist of five major sections.

-  40% of the budget will be used to provide medical equipment and drugs to enhance the quality of care.

-  23% of the budget will be used to recruit and pay monthly salaries of 10 community health workers as well as a supervisor who will serve as a bridge between the community and health center.

-  5% of the budget will be used for healthcare workers’ training activities in order to update their knowledge on detection and management of risk factors during pregnancy, care of obstetric emergencies and quality improvement.

-  20% of the budget will be used for women's empowerment activities. Recognizing that poverty is the underlying cause of maternal mortality and that the country has limited resources, a significant portion of the project will be dedicated to the financing of income-generating activities of women's associations or cooperatives in order to make the project sustainable. Associations and cooperatives are powerful vehicles of social inclusion and the political and economic empowerment of their members. 

-  12% of the budget will fund administrative, logistical and marketing aspects surrounding the implementation of the project.

Money raised above the goal will help fund the entire yearlong project which amounts to $200,000:

-  Cover the costs of developing a mobile application that will be used by field teams to assess risk factors for pregnant women and maintain regular contact with those at risk.

-  Expand the microloan initiative to reach out to more vulnerable women in order to make the project more sustainable.

-  Upgrade the infrastructure of the maternity ward to enhance the quality of care.

Start of the project: November 2015

End of the project: November 2016

7-  The Impact

We believe that our project will impact not only women, but the entire community of Duekoue and the surrounding villages. In African societies, mothers are a central pillar of the family and the entire community. Therefore the project will impact more than 100 000 people. In one year, the community health workers will have done 36,500 home visits in the target community which will have a substantial impact in terms of prevention of maternal and infant mortality.

8-  How you can help?

According to Mother Teresa, “We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.”

Donate

With $20 you provide a life-saving drug, Oxytocin, to prevent postpartum hemorrhage to 20 women.

With $25 you provide a delivery kit to 5 women.

With $ 75 you provide a C -section kit to one woman.

 With $100 you pay one month of salary for a community health worker.

Start a fundraiser: You can start a fundraiser with your friends and family to keep more mothers alive. We will share your initiative on our Website and Facebook page.

Share our crowdfunding message and video with friends. #with$20save20

story:
Think of a restaurant you enjoy. It could be your favorite place to grab dinner or a local breakfast staple. Besides a great meal, restaurants have a special ability to foster relationships as places to get to know people, catch up on friendships, or be around other people in the community. Imagine what it would be like to not be able to afford that experience. 

Now think of a delicious, healthy meal you recently ate. It probably contained fresh and local vegetables and protein and other healthy ingredients. Perhaps it was even chef prepared? Unfortunately nutritious meals like these can cost $15 or more. Imagine not being able to afford a healthy meal.

We believe that all people should have access to healthy and affordable food and should experience dignity in a restaurant where they can enjoy a meal with others. 

Hence, A Place at the Table: a nonprofit pay-what-you-can cafe that provides community and healthy food for all regardless of means. 

We know that if we provide healthy food as our tool for hospitality then walls, barriers, and divisions among groups of people can be broken down and change can happen. We believe that when we come together around a table with a meal, we will experience the power of community. 

We plan to open in July/August of 2016. 

A Place at the Table intends to serve anyone who wants a healthy chef-prepared meal, including people who want a reasonably-priced meal, people who are unable to pay, especially students and staff at NC State University and others living or working near us, or anyone searching for community.  

The Perfect Location

We have an opportunity to open in Hillsborough Lofts, a student apartment building under construction on Hillsborough Street in Raleigh, NC.  This is an  ideal location because it is adjacent to the NC State University campus  and is surrounded by neighborhoods with a mix of affluent and some  lower-income housing.  

But We Need Your Help or We May Miss this Leasing Opportunity

We need $100,000 by January in order to sign the lease for this location.  Please help us make our dream possible!  To date we have raised over $10,000 in grants and personal donations.  We need your help to reach our $100,000 goal!   

Where is my donation going?

$25,000  Start up Expenses- (Construction of the cafe space, Kitchen Expenses)

 $40,000  Food Costs & Working Capital- To be successful, a restaurant should have at least 6 months working capital at all times.   

$35,000  Rent for one year. We are excited for our location to be on Hillsborough St., but rent is not cheap!

What do I get?

•  A community cafe in Raleigh, NC, on Hillsborough Street where you can experience community and healthy food for all regardless of means

•  Perks - check out what we're offering :)

•  A tax deduction 

•  Chance for recognition as a founder for some donations

The Impact

•  All people feel welcome, included, and accepted around the table

•  All people have access to a healthy, locally sourced, and delicious meal

•  All people are given a hand-up versus a hand-out and by volunteering become a part of the community.

How does a community cafe work?

A Place at the Table is a place where people can pay the suggested donation, pay for someone else’s meal, or pay by volunteering at the restaurant. 

A Place at the Table will be operated based upon the following guidelines:

•  Pay-what-you-can pricing – Each customer sets his/her own price for their meal. The café has a suggested donation range based on plate size.

•  Patrons choose own portion size –The café offers medium and large plates and     serves food cafeteria style.  Patrons can specify what they want and how much of each available item. This helps eliminate food waste, curbs overeating, and supports our patrons adhering to personal budgets.

•  Healthy, seasonal foods – We are committed to providing local, organic and seasonal food when possible, sustainably grown, raised or caught.

•  Patrons may volunteer in exchange for a meal – This provides a “hand up, not a hand out” opportunity, and a properly trained volunteer may be able to find future employment in the food service industry.

•  Volunteers are used to the greatest extent possible – Volunteers are the key to building a sustainable community. Volunteers may work for meals or to support efforts to curb hunger in our community.

•  Paid staff earns a living wage

•  Community Table – Our dining area will be a welcome environment for all who visit.  Large tables will provide the opportunity for people to socialize without the social and economic boundaries found in so many dining places today.  Cafe staff and volunteers will help those who want to participate by introducing diners and suggesting topics of conversation.  

Why We Will Be Successful 

We are following a proven model developed by the One World Everybody Eats Foundation, which has fostered over 50 cafes across the nation. Of these,  22 cafes have been operating for over 3 years, 6 have opened in the last 1-2 years, and 12 more will open in the next 1-2 years. We also have strong verbal support from our community. 

Meet Our Team

Who are we? 

Check out our website to meet the Board of Directors.

Other Ways to Help

•  Volunteer with us after we open.  We will need volunteers daily.

•  Offer in-kind donations. We are a start-up restaurant, so before opening, we are seeking donations of restaurant equipment, kitchen supplies.  Once we are open, we need food donations.

Sign up for our newsletter at www.aplaceatthetableraleigh.org.
story_txt:
Think of a
restaurant you enjoy. It could be your favorite place to grab dinner or a local
breakfast staple. Besides a great meal, restaurants have a special ability to
foster relationships as places to get to know people, catch up on friendships,
or be around other people in the community. Imagine what it would be like to
not be able to afford that experience. 
Now think of a
delicious, healthy meal you recently ate. It probably contained fresh and local
vegetables and protein and other healthy ingredients. Perhaps it was even chef
prepared? Unfortunately nutritious meals like these can cost $15 or more.
Imagine not being able to afford a healthy meal.
We believe
that all people should have access to healthy and affordable food and should
experience dignity in a restaurant where they can enjoy a meal with
others. 
Hence, A
Place at the Table: a nonprofit pay-what-you-can cafe that provides
community and healthy food for all regardless of means. 
We know that if we
provide healthy food as our tool for hospitality then walls, barriers, and
divisions among groups of people can be broken down and change can happen. We
believe that when we come together around a table with a meal, we will
experience the power of community. 
We plan to open in
July/August of 2016. 
A Place at the
Table intends to serve anyone who wants a healthy chef-prepared meal,
including people who want a reasonably-priced meal, people who are unable
to pay, especially students and staff at NC State University and others living
or working near us, or anyone searching for community.  
The Perfect
Location
We have an
opportunity to open in Hillsborough Lofts, a student apartment
building under construction on Hillsborough Street in Raleigh, NC.
 This is an  ideal location because it is adjacent to the NC State
University campus  and is surrounded by neighborhoods with a mix of
affluent and some  lower-income housing.  
But We Need Your
Help or We May Miss this Leasing Opportunity
We need $100,000
by January in order to sign the lease for this location.  Please help us
make our dream possible!  To date we have raised over $10,000 in grants and personal donations.  We need your help to reach our $100,000 goal!   
Where is my
donation going?
$25,000  Start up Expenses- (Construction of the cafe space, Kitchen Expenses)
 $40,000  Food Costs & Working Capital- To be
successful, a restaurant should have at least 6 months working capital at all
times.   
$35,000  Rent for one year. We are excited for our location to be on Hillsborough St., but rent is not cheap!
What do I get?
•  A community cafe in Raleigh, NC, on
Hillsborough Street where you can experience community and healthy food for all
regardless of means
•  Perks - check out what we're offering :)
•  A tax deduction 
•  Chance for recognition as a founder for some
donations
The Impact
•  All people feel welcome, included, and
accepted around the table
•  All people have access to a healthy, locally
sourced, and delicious meal
•  All people are given a hand-up versus a
hand-out and by volunteering become a part of the community.
How does a
community cafe work?
A Place at the
Table is a place where people can pay the suggested donation, pay for
someone else’s meal, or pay by volunteering at the restaurant. 
A Place at the
Table will be operated based upon the following guidelines:
•  Pay-what-you-can pricing – Each customer sets
his/her own price for their meal. The café has a suggested donation range based
on plate size.
•  Patrons choose own portion size –The café
offers medium and large plates and     serves food cafeteria
style.  Patrons can specify what they want and how much of each available
item. This helps eliminate food waste, curbs overeating, and supports our
patrons adhering to personal budgets.
•  Healthy, seasonal foods – We are committed to
providing local, organic and seasonal food when possible, sustainably grown,
raised or caught.
•  Patrons may volunteer in exchange for a meal
– This provides a “hand up, not a hand out” opportunity, and a properly trained
volunteer may be able to find future employment in the food service industry.
•  Volunteers are used to the greatest extent
possible – Volunteers are the key to building a sustainable community.
Volunteers may work for meals or to support efforts to curb hunger in our
community.
•  Paid staff earns a living wage
•  Community Table – Our dining area will be a
welcome environment for all who visit.  Large tables will provide the
opportunity for people to socialize without the social and economic boundaries
found in so many dining places today.  Cafe staff and volunteers will help
those who want to participate by introducing diners and suggesting topics of
conversation.  
Why We Will Be
Successful 
We are following a
proven model developed by the One World Everybody Eats Foundation, which has
fostered over 50 cafes across the nation. Of these,  22 cafes have been
operating for over 3 years, 6 have opened in the last 1-2 years, and 12 more
will open in the next 1-2 years. We also have strong verbal support from our
community. 
Meet Our Team
Who are we? 
Check out our
website to meet the Board of Directors.
Other Ways to Help
•  Volunteer with us after we open.  We
will need volunteers daily.
•  Offer in-kind donations. We are a start-up
restaurant, so before opening, we are seeking donations of restaurant
equipment, kitchen supplies.  Once we are open, we need food donations.
Sign up for our
newsletter at www.aplaceatthetableraleigh.org.

story:
LANGUAGE: ENGLISH | FRENCH | CREOLE | SPANISH 


There is an emergency situation in Haiti that started over five years ago with a terrible earth quake...

On Tuesday the 12th of January 2010 a 7.0 magnitude earthquake devastated the island nation of Haiti, killing over three hundred thousand people.  In addition to the terrible loss of human life, the disaster also claimed the destruction of over a quarter million homes, and near thirty thousand commercial structures, including government, health and administration buildings, roads and telecommunications infrastructure.

The nation continues to suffer from the decay of hope; with massive health & sanitation problems -

  • Overburdened Government
  • Lack of Healthcare
  • Desperate Poverty and Illness

The Church remains, and the people of Haiti have been praying for Salvation, not only in the eternal hope, but for life and well being for their families and their communities which have been devastated.

The Bishop of Haiti is asking for our help, and we will answer that call.

The mandate of the SDHEPA is concerned with the Social Welfare of the Haitian people and in particular those who are undocumented living inside the Dominican Republic.

Watch this next video presented in English, Creole & Spanish to see some of the people we are trying to help:


The 'Hospital for Haiti' Project Goals

    • Build a Hospital (HOSCOMQ-1) ‘Quisqueya Compassion Hospital’ in the city of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.
    • Establish a Hospital in the border city of Ouanaminthe, Haiti (HOSCOMQ-2) .
    • Funding Goal: Raise $3 Million US dollars for project start-up and Y1 & Y2 operations
    • Provide first-world health services to 200,000+ displaced Haitians and local Dominican citizens currently living in the northern province of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.
    • Provide first-world health services to 100,000 Haitian citizens living in Northern Haiti.
    • The SDHEPA is a registered non-profit #340985 with CODUE which is the official Dominican Republic Government Ministry responsible for religious charity status.
What happens if this campaign exceeds it's funding target?

Firstly, that would be a great problem to have! Secondly - we've got 10 Hospitals we'd like to roll-out across many deeply affected areas of Haiti and the Dominican  Republic where the people have fled since the earthquake.

The demand for Healthcare & Sanitation is so massive, please give today - We will deploy as many healthcare centers into our network as funding dollars permit. For more about our organization, mission & mandate - please visit our official website! 
See: http://sdhepa.org

The Scope & Impact

This campaign is being conducted in cooperation with all SDHEPA Haitian affiliated international organizations including churches and businesses, government agencies in Haiti, the Dominican Republic, the United States, Canada, France, Mexico; the SDHEPA Fund is administered by a nationally registered Canadian intermediary.
See: http://sdhepa.org

  • Over 300,000+ Displaced Haitian's in the North
  • We've rallied all the churches in Haiti & the Dominican to cooperate
  • Now we need the people of the world's to join us!

Raising Hope From Rubble

Every conceivable barrier exists in terms of the devastation of the country of Haiti. Widespread violence, chaos & disease are rampant, roads, bridges and airfields are in disrepair, and sanitation needs to be completely rebuilt.

  • We've got unity among the churches and the labor forces
  • The people of Haiti are strong and ready to build a better life
  • We've organized a distinguished group of local board members
  • We're ready to proceed with the project right now!

Please Donate Today

Give your one-time best gift or perhaps tithe your income to this project for the next two months. This campaign is short, we have just sixty days to raise our goal of three million dollars - and we're praying for your generosity as we establish a brand new hospital program for Haiti.

All proceeds are being directed to the SDHEPA HOSCOMQ Hospital Project, official non-profit information can be found below - We need your help to do this good work.

Please give generously today - All major credit cards and paypal are accepted.

There's no minimum amount, and it's simple to give! Just click 'Donate' and pick a perk to direct your funds to a variety of critical needs for the hospital project - including baby food, construction supplies, building fund & structures, administration, international shipping & logistics and more.

We'll make sure your dollars go exactly where you specify.

Contribute By Sharing on Facebook

Some people can't contribute money, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Share this page on Facebook & Twitter
  • Use hashtag's #HospitalForHaiti and #AnswerTheCall
  • Publish this message to your church newsletter
  • Post this story on your local message board
  • Tell your prayer group and pastor about it
  • Spread this campaign to friends everywhere
  • Rally your church to make a group donation
  • Every dollar counts and there is no minimum gift
  • Please consider even a small donation today
  • We'll keep you up to date on the project each month!

Shoot a Selfie in Support of #HospitalforHaiti

Click below to print a poster & shoot a selfie in support of this campaign! Available in English, French, Spanish & Creole! Simply click the poster below to visit the dowloads page. Don't forget to add the hashtag #HospitalforHaiti  when you share your selfie on instagram, facebook, pinterest or twitter! 

Click here to see all languages: http://sdhepa.org/shoot-a-selfie-in-support-of-hospitalforhaiti/

About the SDHEPA - Social Development Haiti Evangelical Pastors Association 

Established in June 2012 to address these local needs, the SDHEPA has now grown to over 1000 organizations from a start of 434 members comprised of Churches, Schools, Orphanages and Medical Clinics.

Official Contact Information

SDHEPA is a registered non-profit with CODUE which is the official Dominican Republic Government Ministry responsible for religious charity status. The SDHEPA is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing financial aid, social, spiritual, health, housing and education to the most needy of Haiti.

Official Website: http://sdhepa.org

SDHEPA - Officially Registered Non-Profit

Registration No. 340985
Puerto Plata Central Church of Christ
Bishop Gelimard Joseph
Calle 05 No. 10, Mirador Sur
Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
HOSCOMQ Hospital Project
829-561-0703

SDHEPA Board of Directors

The Board Members of SDHEPA meeting at the proposed Hospital location, a disused commercial building to be converted to a first-world Hospital for Haiti.

SDHEPA Board Members, from left to right - Haitian Coordinator Pastor Wilner Smith, Chairman Bishop Gelimard Joseph, Deputy Chief Medical Officer Dr.(Ret.) Jerry Lamour, Chief Medical Officer Dr. Lambert Emmauel.

Local Government Support

We are most grateful to Chief Noel in Dajabon for his support of this most excellent SDHEPA Hospital Project. Our team is very committed to the completion of this Hospital project to help the poorest of Haiti and the Dominican access first-world medicine.


Members of the Board meet Haitian Government officials at the Haitian Consulate in Dajabon, Dominican Republic – October 2015 SDHEPA Board Member - Haitian Coordinator Pastor Wilner Smith, Consulat d’Haiti, Dajabon Republique Dominicaine – Consul Chef de Poste Luckner Noel, SDHEPA Board Member - Chairman Bishop Gelimard Joseph, SDHEPA Board Member - Deputy Chief Medical Officer Dr.(Ret.) Jerry Lamour, SDHEPA Board Member – Dominican Coordinator Radio Pastor Israel Gonzales.


International Evangelical Support

SDHEPA is grateful for the enthusiastic support of church leaders in Miami, Ft. Lauderdale, Toronto, Montreal and around the World wherever the Diaspora of Haiti call home - Please give generously today.

SDHEPA Board meeting with Florida Pastors and Haitian Church Leader – October 2015 Pastor Jeannot St. Louis, SDHEPA Board Member – North American Coordinator Pastor Julsain Blanc, SDHEPA Advisory Committee - Secretary General MMI Luc Lefort Fontus.

SDHEPA Board meeting with Florida Pastors and Haitian Church Leader – October 2015, SDHEPA Board Member – Vice Chairman/International Coordinator Chris Skaarup with Pastor Edouard N.  Surin.

SDHEPA Board meeting with Florida Pastors – October 2015, SDHEPA Board Member – Vice Chairman/International Coordinator Chris Skaarup with SDHEPA Board Member – North American Coordinator Pastor Julsain Blanc.

Haitian & Dominican Local Support

We are overwhelmed with joy for these good works provided by SDHEPA who have organized grass roots efforts to establish a new Hospital for Haiti. Our International co-ordinator Chris traveled to Haiti last month to further help coordinate this campaign.


Pastors meeting in ‘Sanctuary’ village  outside Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic – October 2015  SDHEPA Board Member – Dominican Coordinator Radio Pastor Israel Gonzales with ‘Sanctuary’ Pastor Jhony Galant.


SDHEPA international co-ordinator, Chris, in the town of Sanctuary, delivering supplies, meeting local leadership and purchasing artwork from the towns people for gifts.

From the Video Archives

Meet Bishop Gelimard Joseph on a TV Interview with SUN Media originally aired July 7th 2012 during the launch of SDHEPA group and the awareness drive for action in Haiti.

Interview with Bishop Gelimard Joseph of Haiti


Our sincerest thanks for your support of the Hospital for Haiti campaign. Please click the 'Donate' button to give!

Don't forget to share using the hastags #HospitalforHaiti and #AnswerTheCall.

story:
http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/chennai/Saudi-woman-cuts-off-Tamil-Nadu-maids-arm/articleshow/49279142.cms

Kasthuri Munirathnam's hand was severed off as she attempted to escape from her employer's home in Saudi Arabia.

We want to help her family become whole again - the goal is to raise money for her family and her in a time where they need it more than ever.

No human should ever have to be subjected to this. But we can make a difference. We can be there to help with her medical bills, and feed her family. We can be there to show her that our thoughts and hearts are with her. We can be there to show her that despite losing a hand, we are there to lend her many hands. 
We can make her whole again.


I have been contacting various organizational representatives to facilitate a way to provide her with the money from this campaign. These organizations include the Indian Embassy in Riyadh, Kingdom Hospital where she is currently receiving treatment, and the Indian Social Forum of Saudi Arabia.



Update: 



So here's my game plan-

I have been in contact with the Indian Embassy in Riyadh and the Kingdom Hospital in Riyadh where she's receiving treatment. I have the contact number for her doctor as well.

I've reached out to various Indian governmental officials (namely Sushma Swaraj) over social media in order to get their help.

The hurdle was that many people do not work on Fridays in Saudi Arabia but I should be able to get in touch with someone who can speak to her soon.

Basically, I'm going to get two things.

1.) Her contact info and bank information so the funds can be directly deposited to HER and HER alone.

2.) I will get some form of acknowledgement by the embassy or indian social forums to vouch for the authenticity of the campaign. 

Admittedly, this campaign is in early stages and is obviously unverified, much to my chagrin at this point. I'm hoping to change that asap, but for the time being what I ask is you bookmark this page and check back shortly when I do indeed have the means to prove what we're doing is real and genuine.

story:
Hello!

We are passionate about serving our community healthy, sustainable food and want to continue to do so after we move to our new location with ease and grace. Help us by donating whatever you can in order for us to move in, renovate and be back on our feet as FAST as possible . . . January 1st is our goal date to reopen in our brand new, mid-island location . . . Location to be announced soon!


Who Are We?

Realm Food Co. is made up of young entrepreneurs, James Hannah and Kyla Campbell. They have been cooking food at various local restaurants up until they began working for themselves late last year, with their first few gigs popping up at various venues in the Parksville/ Qualicum Beach area. They soon found a space of their own in Qualicum and became quite successful in the short period of time that they have been open. After a few minor hiccups, including that of a name change -Radius turned Realm - they have built up quite a following in the mid-island area, stretching to as far as Victoria and Courtenay, with a nice little mention in EAT magazine in their last issue. 
---
At Realm Food Co., we want to re-establish the connection between farmers and people to ultimately raise awareness on the importance of eating locally. In this way, Realm offers a compelling humane model to the world and contributes to a proudly sustainable Oceanside community. Our goal is to provide customers with a unique gastronomic experience using food grown and obtained in a way that respects the well being of farmers, the environment, and you. Real, local flavour is what we do! We want to give you the gift of a truly unique experience… From farm to table! Whether you’re looking for a quick bite to eat, full dining experience, a smoothie to go or Sunday brunch, Realm Food Co. is the place to gather in warmth and good company.

Why We Need Your Help

We are in a position where we need to move Realm to a new local location. This means we will be temporarily putting a hold on the business, purchasing and updating equipment to serve you better, financing any renovations needed in our new space... We are looking into our options now to do all of this, but we are asking YOU, our amazing community and world at large, to help us follow through with all of this as fast as possible so that we can continue to serve you up local, organic food in our own sweet way . . . We are super excited for what is to come!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need your help to fund our transition into the brand spanking new location
     . . . By assisting us, it will help guarentee an opening date for January 1st, 2016 
  • By donating $25, you will receive a beautiful vinyl sticker of our wonderful mascot, Eve . . . If you don't know what she looks like, stop into the restaurant before we close at our current location - she is the goddess overseeing all operations high up on the wall
  • By donating $50, you will receive a REALM t-shirt, as well as an Eve vinyl sticker
  • By donating $100, you will receive a REALM t-shirt, Eve vinyl sticker and a $30 gift certificate to be honoured at our new location
  • By donating $250+, the REALM team will come cook you and your family a three course, local, organic, gourmet meal chez YOU, with live entertainment by a singing chef (guess who that might be???)

The Impact

  • We want to re-establish the connection between farmers and people to ultimately raise awareness on the importance of eating locally. In this way, Realm offers a compelling humane model to the world and contributes to a proudly sustainable Oceanside community
  • Healthier bellies means healthier people - it's time to eat more of the good, clean food that our beautiful community has to offer


Other Ways You Can Help

  • We understand what it means to be on a budget and we are absolutely understanding of the fact that not all of you can afford to donate out of your own pocket, but the power of the internet is HUGE! If you could share this on social media to help us spread the word, it would mean the world to us! Thank you, thank you, thank YOU!
story_txt:
Hello!

We are passionate about serving our community healthy, sustainable food and want to continue to do so after we move to our new location with ease and grace. Help us by donating whatever you can in order for us to move in, renovate and be back on our feet as FAST as possible . . . January 1st is our goal date to reopen in our brand new, mid-island location . . . Location to be announced soon!


Who Are We?

Realm Food Co. is made up of young entrepreneurs, James Hannah and Kyla Campbell. They have been cooking food at various local restaurants up until they began working for themselves late last year, with their first few gigs popping up at various venues in the Parksville/ Qualicum Beach area. They soon found a space of their own in Qualicum and became quite successful in the short period of time that they have been open. After a few minor hiccups, including that of a name change -Radius turned Realm - they have built up quite a following in the mid-island area, stretching to as far as Victoria and Courtenay, with a nice little mention in EAT magazine in their last issue. 
---
At Realm Food Co., we want to re-establish the connection between farmers and people to ultimately raise awareness on the importance of eating locally. In this way, Realm offers a compelling humane model to the world and contributes to a proudly sustainable Oceanside community. Our goal is to provide customers with a unique gastronomic experience using food grown and obtained in a way that respects the well being of farmers, the environment, and you. Real, local flavour is what we do! We want to give you the gift of a truly unique experience… From farm to table! Whether you’re looking for a quick bite to eat, full dining experience, a smoothie to go or Sunday brunch, Realm Food Co. is the place to gather in warmth and good company.

Why We Need Your Help
We are in a position where we need to move Realm to a new local location. This means we will be temporarily putting a hold on the business, purchasing and updating equipment to serve you better, financing any renovations needed in our new space... We are looking into our options now to do all of this, but we are asking YOU, our amazing community and world at large, to help us follow through with all of this as fast as possible so that we can continue to serve you up local, organic food in our own sweet way . . . We are super excited for what is to come!
   What We Need & What You Get  We need your help to fund our transition into the brand spanking new location . . . By assisting us, it will help guarentee an opening date for January 1st, 2016  By donating $25, you will receive a beautiful vinyl sticker of our wonderful mascot, Eve . . . If you don't know what she looks like, stop into the restaurant before we close at our current location - she is the goddess overseeing all operations high up on the wall
By donating $50, you will receive a REALM t-shirt, as well as an Eve vinyl sticker
By donating $100, you will receive a REALM t-shirt, Eve vinyl sticker and a $30 gift certificate to be honoured at our new location
By donating $250+, the REALM team will come cook you and your family a three course, local, organic, gourmet meal chez YOU, with live entertainment by a singing chef (guess who that might be???)    The Impact  We want to re-establish the connection between farmers and people to ultimately raise awareness on the importance of eating locally. In this way, Realm offers a compelling humane model to the world and contributes to a proudly sustainable Oceanside community Healthier bellies means healthier people - it's time to eat more of the good, clean food that our beautiful community has to offer


    
Other Ways You Can Help
 We understand what it means to be on a budget and we are absolutely understanding of the fact that not all of you can afford to donate out of your own pocket, but the power of the internet is HUGE! If you could share this on social media to help us spread the word, it would mean the world to us! Thank you, thank you, thank YOU!

story: JobsHunt is a job portal!
story_txt: JobsHunt is a job portal!

story:
Our Story

We are passionate about out of the box ideas and about creating a new shopping experience. Nowadays we want more from our stores than simple buying the things that we need. While thinking how we can make shoppers a part of the store we found the great franchise formula jouw marktkraam with already more then 25 succesfull stores in the Netherlands. Just the concept we were looking for. It is so great that we want te be a part of this amazing franchise family. 

This great formula is mentioned in many (local) news papers and on different TV stations. A concept which originally started in Finland more than 20 years ago and has been accepted by the people and  has become a part of the shopping street. This shopping concept called itsepalvelukirpputori literally translated self service markt. This concept gives you the opportunity to sell your things without having to be present.

Our shop is also your shop!! 

"Jouw Marktkraam" allows anyone to sell their crafts, second hand goods and new products by hiring a stand. Painting artist can rent a nail to show their work and get new commissions. A Hairdresser or make-up artist? No problem, you can rent a chair to provide for your customers without having your own salon! A Start-up of a new product and or a pre-sale? We have the possibility to display your new products and show them to customers from around the world with the help of the shops great location in the beautiful tourist city of Haarlem in the Netherlands. Do you have a shop or are you a wholesaler and you need a place to sell excess stock or to expand your sales opportunities, we are there fore you! And webshops? Sure you are more then welcome! Increase your sales and let people know about your online store. We also want a small promotion space were shoppers can taste, smell, see and try products. Are you for example a beekeeper? Rent the unique promotion space as long as you need and let the customer taste your sweet honey and start selling your liquid gold.

How does it work?
It is simple! We have different possibilities to rent your own little spot in our store. We have large and small stands, nails, book shelves, window spots, chairs, promotion space and garden space. You always rent for at least 1 week (the chairs and promotion space are rented per hour). You place your stuff in the stand and if you like you can decorate it. (we are there to help you) We have price tags with a unique barcode which belongs to your account. We also have security tags and more stuff to bring your little shop to life. Then you take a nice cup of coffee or tea and a slice of home made apple pie in the courtyard and we will do the rest! The full proceeds of the sale is for you. You can check during the day how your sales are going on the realtime app. You therefore know when there are empty spots on your stand so you are able to drop in and fill this with other products. At the end of your rental period we transfer the income to your bank account. You can pick up the rest of your products or donate them to the special stand where we raise money for different charities. (local and international.)


The location

We choose the location of Haarlem in the Netherlands. Which has the most varied selection of shops in the Netherlands, a compact historic center and the charming Golden Streets, makes Haarlem shopping city number 1. You will not only find exclusive home furnishing shops, trendy fashion boutiques, trendy concept stores, vintage boutiques, specialty children's stores and craft stores, but also the major (inter) national retail chains. With over 4,000 national and municipal monuments, Haarlem is the second city in the Netherlands for listed monuments. Situated on the Grote Markt, the oldest part of the city and once the tournament field of the Counts of Holland are the medieval town hall complex, Hoofdwacht (Main Guardhouse), Grote or St. Bavokerk (St Bavo’s Church) and Vlees- and Vishal (Meat and Fish Hall). Elsewhere in the city, you can admire De Waag (Weighhouse), Hodshon Huis (Hodshon House), Amsterdamse Poort (Amsterdam Gate) and Kathedrale Basiliek St. Bavo (St Bavo’s Cathedral). Or visit the hofjes, almshouses with courtyards, the oldest of which dates from 1395. Every year a lot of national and international tourists visit this beautiful city.

The shop will be situated in a busy shopping street in the historic center.The large shop windows will invite people to come in and the courtyard gives the store a big extra. We will have a terrace in the courtyard were shoppers can sit down and enjoy a nice cup of coffee, tea or other refreshment and children can play in the sandpit. In the winter we will have the smallest Christmas market in the world and during the spring time shoppers can enjoy the flowers and buy flower bulbs to bring home. 

When will the store open?

We are currently busy preparing everything in order to set up the store. We will open the doors for the public hopefully by the end of January 2016. And you are all invited to come and see the store and celebrate with us.

Who will shop in the store

Not only the locals will love our store but also national and international tourists will find there way to the shop. The shop will be full with all kinds of different products which you can't find in the other shops. There will be products for everyone!! Buyers will come to shop for a present, a souvenier, cheap designer clothes, decorations for home and garden, toys for children, smart products (smartwatch, finders etc) , art and match more! Local buyers will know that every week there are new sellers so new reasons to visit the store and tourists will find unique presents and souvenirs to take home.


Why crowd funding

Yes we can take a loan from the bank but we like to give something back!! With crowd funding we can do that. We have different perks for everyone all around the world and you will all be a part of our store, how great is that! See the different perks and choose the one you like


What We Need & What You Get

This is how we"ll spend the money:

  • €4000 Special Cash register ( for scanning unique barcodes referending to our sellers, accounting program, and communicate with the app)
  • €8000 for wood and material to make the stands
  • €1000 for paint, nails, sales counter, clothes hangers, presentation torsos and security tags
  • €3000 Franchise fee (one-off)
  • €6000 Rent, insurance, gas, electricity, water and deposit 
  • €3000 Printer to print unique barcode labels, barber chair and advertisement
If we raise more, and I hope we do, we will spend it on a nice wooden floor. If we raise less we will loan this part.
What we will give back:
We have a perk for everyone, choose the perk you like and you will not be disappointed!
We have two options to chose from.
Option 1: If you choose to display your products in the store, we will discuss a date. You receive unique barcode labels for pricing and some security tags.
Option 2: If you choose to make a donation and like to receive a goodiebag, we will send you (worldwide) a well-stocked goodiebag with Dutch products and more!! Money well spent!
For those who donate €500 and more, you can send your product to us, we will price them for you, we will sell the product for you and more! All details will be discussed. For businesses a great opportunity to increases sales opportunities in the Netherlands. But if you would like a goodiebag, that is also ok:-) 
Some pictures from jouw marktkraam stores in the Netherlands.

 

        

     


Risks & Challenges

We can’t predict the future, but here’s what we do know: 
There are more then 25 stores allready and they are doing good business. The people love the concept and the opportunity to make some extra money. Small and big companies (around the world) can extend there sale locations. We don't have our own stock, so the only risk we have, is that we have a month that we don't rent out enough stands, but we will save money from the profit in order to cope with this. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

tell others about us, visit us and buy some gifts for your friends. And rent a stand, if you are able to now, or in the future. We would love to get to know you!! And follow us on facebook no matter were you life, join us!

story:
I am Mariam Adam From Gaza Strip, Palestine, I have been married 10 years ago, and I have 3 children.

The siege, the bad economic situation, and the high unemployment rate mad me launched this campaign, Because I can’t find any work for me or for my husband , So we can’t meet the needs of our children, In addition to that we are drowning in debts.

I am looking for your generous contributions to help me and my family for live as others.

If I got overall amount that will be 9000$ I will use it like this:

6500$ pay for debts

500$  clothes for my children and school requirements.

2000$ to build a small project for my family.

Please help me by

- Donation.

- Invite your friends to support us.

- Pray for us.

story:
Rowster Coffee and Chef Joel Wabeke are pleased to present: " That Early Bird" at 1445 Lake Dr. SE

Two forces in the local culinary scene have teamed up, creating a community-focused concept of coffee and food. Chef Joel Wabeke and Rowster Coffee have come together to offer a seasonal menu crafted around eclectic flavors that are healthy yet indulgent. Breakfast sandwiches built around homemade sourdough English muffins and Japanese milk bread, hearty grain based salads, vegetable filled soups, drip coffee to go, and a full espresso bar will be some of the things to expect. Giving you fresh food and quality coffee, in a fast & casual style of service.
Your life is busy! You have plenty of demands on your time & energy, and our purpose is to provide a place to fit your various needs. What you want, when you want it. Whatever we have that we can offer, it's yours. 


What We Need & What You Get

We are heavily relying on our community in a variety of ways, and this is one of the ways that you (yes you!) can be a great help!

You deserve to be provided with excellent coffee and food in a relaxed, casual atmosphere. We have a few different directions for the perks we are offering (at a great value we might add!), and we are confident that you will enjoy.

This is what the gift cards look like!


The Impact

We are adding to the heartbeat of this vibrant neighborhood. Creating that '3rd place', where you can enjoy a quick coffee in the morning, a leisurely snack in the afternoon, meeting a dear friend (or new one!), or even some enjoyable work. Early Bird will be that place, where you have a sense of belonging; where you have a sense of home.

Your experiences, your memories; they make up who you are. We invite you to come and make warm lasting memories with us.


Team

Joel Wabeke began his career working in several local Grand Rapids restaurants ranging from Gaia to Gibson's before attending The Culinary Institute of American in Hyde Park, New York. From there Joel spent time in England at one of the top restaurants in the world, The Fat Duck, and at the highly regarded gastro pub, The Hinds Head. Returning to the US he worked in the kitchens of Journeyman and Reserve in Michigan, and Balena in Chicago. Joel acted as chef de cuisine for six.one.six in the JW Marriott, and one of Detroit's top restaurants, Wright and Company. Closer to home, he was also the opening and excutive chef at Terra GR. 


Born and raised near Grand Rapids, Stephen Curtis was impacted by quality ingredients at an early age. With immediate family from England, he did not grow up with traditional American coffee; rather, they enjoyed a French press or a pour over at home.  So, it felt natural to work in a coffee shop in 2001.  “I fell in love with the culture that specialty shops created, the people, and the comforting qualities of a hand crafted quality beverage. When I had the opportunity to take over that shop in 2006, I jumped at the chance”, said Curtis. Fueled by this desire to understand the why, roasting coffee played in taste and quality, he began roasting coffee in a little home roaster.  In 2009, a coffee roaster purchase from eBay allowed him to roast more coffee for the shop, starting in the garage. Through this process he met Kurt Stauffer, the founder of Rowster Coffee.  Connecting over the shared appreciation of culture and quality coffee allowed them to team up to open a retail shop and roasting site combined.  In June of 2010, Rowster Coffee re-launched at 632 Wealthy Street SE.


Thank You

A special thanks to our team for their dedicated time and assistance.  The Cares Family (landlord), Darrel Herweyer from DAR Development and Kristen Moore on behalf of Mretail (now with Vision Real Estate Investment). Their contribution towards improving the building and their commitment to the Eastown community is appreciated.

story:
Coworking Comes

to San Bernardino! 







The Vision

The Revolve Project team has been dedicated to making an impact in the City of San Bernardino since we first began as CalState University SB students, looking for our own way to develop as professionals and execute our skill sets. For the last few years, our team has continuously been on the hunt for 'quality' forms of basic office and work space for solid productivity. A place to work and network and be a part of community and also a space that supports small business development. After years and countless hours of struggling through the hassles and uncomfortableness of dealing with the one crowded noisey coffee shop after another, we decided to set out and create an INCREDIBLY AFFORDABLE Coworking Hub of our own -and bring back an all new entrepreneurial and creative life force to the heart of San Bernardino!

Alas, our journey has secured a fantastic location inside the historic downtown Andreson Building, which is directly across the street from SB City Hall. It has an SBX express bus line stop right in front, is just two blocks down from the California Theatre and Regal Cinemas-- and our favorite part; Right next to the downtown Court Street Square Events Space! Downtown San Bernardino is the perfect location for The Headquarters and our vision, which is to create a dynamic think tank and creative work space that will allow people to come together to work and build a thriving community of professional Do-ers, Start-Ups and Entrepreneurial Creatives. 

In the past, our teams and associated organizations have used the Court Street Square for the Downtown Summer Festival, Turn Up The Vote rally Event, Food Truck Market Nights, Chamber Of Commerce Community Events and more. So we plan to continue reviving a downtown buzz for our city with more community events that will cultivate and grow culture. In addition to that, The Headquarters will provide resources to other small business minded professionals looking to develop and launch their ventures. Our Coworking space will provide small businesses & start-ups with the various resources to get going right where we need them...  in the heart of downtown SB!

  • Downtown San Bernardino needs support and growth of existing small businesses.

  • The HQ will provide space for those needing a launch pad to get started creating jobs, income and eventually economic impact that our city needs to grow and revive. 

  • The HQ will be a catalyst for new business creation, non-profit facilitation, business community involvement, and small business education & resources.

  • The membership pricing structure will allow anyone to afford workspace at a fraction of the cost of what it would be to rent out a private office lease. 


San Bernardino has held the title of an "All-America City".  The Headquarters is going to be a major force that will help the future growth of that title. 

Why We Are Fundraising

We need to do some remodeling and re-furnishing ;)
Interior Designs have been researched, created and cost-effectively chosen, now we just need to raise the money to help outfit The HQ with the appropriate furniture and amenities that will make this space truly be a comfortable yet stylish think tank. 


3 Ways To Fund Support & Our Offerings

  1. A "Down For The Cause" Donation.
    --Offering special shout out's on our website.

  2. A Membership Sign-up:
    --Offering our initial membership sign up rates through this campaign.

  3. A Major Sponsorship Donation:
    --Offering a range of quality sponsorship packages to be a stake holder//Partner in The HQ.


    ***Offering The Headquarters 'swag' for various donation levels



Economic Impact

From Survey data, we found that local entrepreneurs and independent contractors are stuck meeting at Starbucks, Denny's, IHOP, McDonald's or other chain restaurants because of the free wifi and a space that allows for them to do business or meet clients. However most people are unsatisfied by the limitations of these such spaces- as they are chain business establishments and are not evolved to house dynamic community interaction and workflow. 

This means that up till now San Bernardino has NOT provided an economic hub for Entrepreneurial thinkers and this is stifling the growth potential.    

  • We need the entrepreneurs and proactive do-ers of our city creating work, projects and opportunities for themselves and their peers. 

  • San Bernardino needs affordable shared workspace to support displaced entrepreneurs who need a basic "Headquarters" for their business ventures.
    The HQ will provide that!


Not only do we plan to help launch small businesses, but we plan to provide:
• Resources
• Workshops
• Attract Chamber Of Commerce meetings
• Showcase expert guest speakers
• Host networking mixers
• Provide innovative financial backing of small businesses//startups
• Facilitate community projects.


* And most significantly, The HQ team is developing an all new unique Non-profit program for Youth Entrepreneurial Development to be housed at the hub as well!!


Location

Street Level View of The Andreson Building

320 North E. Street, San Bernardino, CA 92401

__________________________________________________________  ____    __     _

The HQ is 2,200 square feet of office workspace that will be outfitted to house: 

• High-speed Wifi
• Print service
• Multifunctional worktables
• Couch seating
• A TV monitor Wall
•  Keurig coffe makers
• Snack/food preparation countertop space
•  A full size pull down projector 
• Private reservable office rooms
• A large conference room
• Rotating Art Exhibitions






Press Coverage:

Thank you to-


The Press Enterprise.com:
• http://goo.gl/9ztWxF


And to the Inland Empire Explorer:
• http://goo.gl/pM6sZe




Some Of Our Supporters








Risks & Challenges

  • Small businesses have a ruff 1/5 survival rate. If we support small businesses and start-ups to develop and launch together in San Bernardino at the same time, with knowledge of a community support network, then we can act to keep these businesses alive. While The HQ will strive to act as the support base for these new businesses, we will need support too!

  • We want to maximize the resources we can provide startups and currently we have secured 2,200 square feet of actual floor space at low rates; but in the near future rental rates may change (especially for extended hours of operation). This is why we need your support NOW so that we can get the long term resources and members established which will allow for long term sustainability. 



Other Ways You Can Help

We need to create a BUZZ for this project, so spreading the word will be HUGE!

  • Ask folks to get the word out. Tell them how San Bernardino's Downtown is going to have a NEW Entrepreneurship hub called The Headquarters!
  • Share this campaign page to your social media and local Social Media Groups! Use the hashtag-   #TheHQ  -when you do share ;)
  • If you want to see the location please let us know as we are more then happy to schedule you a quick tour while it is being renovated.


Share This Flyer:

The Headquarters SB Page:




__________________________________________________________  ____    __     _




Inquiries at:

TheHeadquartersSB@gmail.com





Thank you deeply for your interest and care in our vision and for the growth of San Bernardino. 


-The HQ Team
story_txt:
Coworking Comes


to San Bernardino! 








The Vision The Revolve Project team has been dedicated to making an impact in the City of 
San Bernardino since we first began as CalState University SB students, looking for our own way to develop as professionals and execute our skill sets. For the last few years, our team has continuously been on the hunt for 'quality' forms of basic office and work space for solid productivity. A place to work and network and be a part of community and also a space that supports small business development. After years and countless hours of struggling through the hassles and uncomfortableness of dealing with the one crowded noisey coffee shop after another, we decided to set out and create an INCREDIBLY AFFORDABLE Coworking Hub of our own -and bring back an all new entrepreneurial and creative life force to the heart of San Bernardino!Alas, our journey has secured a fantastic location inside the historic downtown Andreson Building, which is directly across the street from SB City Hall. It has an SBX express bus line stop right in front, is just two blocks down from the California Theatre and Regal Cinemas-- and our favorite part; Right next to the downtown Court Street Square Events Space! Downtown San Bernardino is the perfect location for The Headquarters and our vision, which is to create a dynamic think tank and creative work space that will allow people to come together to work and build a thriving community of professional Do-ers, Start-Ups and Entrepreneurial Creatives. 
In the past, our teams and associated organizations have used the Court Street Square for the Downtown Summer Festival, Turn Up The Vote rally Event, Food Truck Market Nights, Chamber Of Commerce Community Events and more. So we plan to continue reviving a downtown buzz for our city with more community events that will cultivate and grow culture. In addition to that, The Headquarters will provide resources to other small business minded professionals looking to develop and launch their ventures. Our Coworking space will provide small businesses & start-ups with the various resources to get going right where we need them...  in the heart of downtown SB! 
Downtown San Bernardino needs support and growth of existing small businesses.
 The HQ will provide space for those needing a launch pad to get started creating jobs, income and eventually economic impact that our city needs to grow and revive. 

The HQ will be a catalyst for new business creation, non-profit facilitation, business community involvement, and small business education & resources.

The membership pricing structure will allow anyone to afford workspace at a fraction of the cost of what it would be to rent out a private office lease. 
  San Bernardino has held the title of an "All-America City".  The Headquarters is going to be a major force that will help the future growth of that title. 


Why We Are Fundraising
We need to do some remodeling and re-furnishing ;)Interior Designs have been researched, created and cost-effectively chosen, now we just need to raise the money to help outfit The HQ with the appropriate furniture and amenities that will make this space truly be a comfortable yet stylish think tank. 

   



3 Ways To Fund Support & Our Offerings

A "Down For The Cause" Donation.--Offering special shout out's on our website.

A Membership Sign-up:--Offering our initial membership sign up rates through this campaign.

A Major Sponsorship Donation:--Offering a range of quality sponsorship packages to be a stake holder//Partner in The HQ.***Offering The Headquarters 'swag' for various donation levels












Economic Impact 
From Survey data, we found that local entrepreneurs and independent contractors are stuck meeting at Starbucks, Denny's, IHOP, McDonald's or other chain restaurants because of the free wifi and a space that allows for them to do business or meet clients. However most people are unsatisfied by the limitations of these such spaces- as they are chain business establishments and are not evolved to house dynamic community interaction and workflow. 
This means that up till now San Bernardino has NOT provided an economic hub for Entrepreneurial thinkers and this is stifling the growth potential.       We need the entrepreneurs and proactive do-ers of our city creating work, projects and opportunities for themselves and their peers. 
 San Bernardino needs affordable shared workspace to support displaced entrepreneurs who need a basic "Headquarters" for their business ventures.The HQ will provide that!
    


Not only do we plan to help launch small businesses, but we plan to provide:• Resources• Workshops• Attract Chamber Of Commerce meetings• Showcase expert guest speakers• Host networking mixers • Provide innovative financial backing of small businesses//startups• Facilitate community projects.* And most significantly, The HQ team is developing an all new unique Non-profit program for Youth Entrepreneurial Development to be housed at the hub as well!!

320 North E. Street, San Bernardino, CA 92401__________________________________________________________  ____    __     _

• High-speed Wifi• Print service• Multifunctional worktables• Couch seating• A TV monitor Wall•  Keurig coffe makers• Snack/food preparation countertop space•  A full size pull down projector • Private reservable office rooms• A large conference room• Rotating Art Exhibitions

story:
The Long and Short of It 

Stunning grounds, community focused, lasting memories!  We are seeking $1.5M to purchase one of the brightest gems in Riverside, CA; Vivian Gardens.  Shelbi Walker Events is a professional event planning company with a passion for people and has been creating memorable events for over 10 years.  We want to buy this unique property so that the community will  have a beautiful space for their next wedding, party, gala, fundraiser, church retreat, community meeting or networking event.  We believe in creating elegant affairs at affordable prices. 

The Inland Empire is swiftly becoming Southern California's Napa Valley and Silicon Valley.  Wineries, major corporations, and tech companies are popping up all over the Inland Empire.  Businesses and families are moving east from Los Angeles and Orange County and landing squarely in Riverside and San Bernardino counties.  We want Vivian Gardens to become the premiere event venue for our growing population. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal...Vivian Gardens is for sale and we want to buy it!  We are seeking $1.5M to purchase and make this 2-acre property the Gold Standard as an echo friendly event venue certified by the Green Business Bureau. To achieve this goal, we want to install solar panels to power the entire property, while maintaining  the existing water well irrigation systems.  We also desire to modify the venues existing lighting system to insure compliance with Green Seal Standards and Certification.  It's located on a private street and can accommodate 200 guests for a sit-down event.  It has an Italian amphitheater, 3 pools, six themed  gardens, and two on site guest residences for overnight stays.  Shelbi Walker Events will manage the property and we will use local vendors to provide  goods and services to create amazing events. 

Our non-profit entity, Walk-A-Mile,  provides job opportunities for seniors.  This valuable workforce will assist our guests, regain work purpose, and share their knowledge to ensure lasting memories and extraordinary experiences. 

     
  • We need $1.2M to purchase the property
  • We will use the remaining funds to install solar panels, secure furnishing for events, and work toward obtaining our Green Seal. 
  • Although there is NO place in the area like Vivian Gardens, in the event that we fail to reach our goal, we will use the funds that we do receive to purchase a similar property. 

The Impact

Your contribution will change the face of the event industry in the Inland Empire as well as provide employment and support for the growing senior and youth  populations.  Your contribution will benefit a great number of people, including community based, church and civic organizations that are in need of event space that is beautiful, affordable, and operates to serve the community.  Vivian Gardens also houses a 7,000 square foot office building which will be available to our vendors to operate their businesses.  Our mission is simple; we want to bless this great community!  Your help will allow us to be a blessing!

 

Risks & Challenges

Time is of the essence.  The current property owners have been our greatest allies in this venture and want nothing more than to see Vivian Gardens flourish and become the premier event venue in Riverside County.  The current owners have a time line that we would like to meet.  (Time is of the essence).

We are excited to have the property used for this extraordinary purpose and want to be in full-swing by January 2016.  The property is hungry for activity! So here's what we are doing:

  • Creating an aggressive Crowdfunding campaign and offering extraordinary perks
  • Beginning to secure preferred vendors to provide services for the events
  • Creating marketing materials and building a venue website so that when the purchase is final, we can begin having events 
    •  

    Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Here's what you can do:

  • Pray for us. 
  • Give whatever amount you can.  The perk is knowing that you are helping make dreams come true for families, organizations, non-profits, and people who want to celebrate a milestone in their lives. 
  • Get the word out about this campaign.  Use the Indiegogo share tools to copy the link and share it with everyone you know.
  • After the campaign ends and we purchase the property, book an event at Vivian Gardens!

And that's all there is to it.

Beginning to secure preferred vendors to provide services for the events
Creating marketing materials and building a venue website so that when the purchase is final, we can begin having events

Give whatever amount you can.  The perk is knowing that you are helping make dreams come true for families, organizations, non-profits, and people who want to celebrate a milestone in their lives.  
Get the word out about this campaign.  Use the Indiegogo share tools to copy the link and share it with everyone you know. After the campaign ends and we purchase the property, book an event at Vivian Gardens!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
For the past three years Vegan Flava Cafe has been a mobile caterer in the Durham, Raleigh, Chapel Hill, Triangle area.   We are now expanding and have found a location in Durham, 4125 Durham Chapel Hill Blvd.  We are looking to make this location a triangle favorite by serving your sense of flavor with a satisfying taste of live and cooked food, smoothies, teas made with Kangen water, Kombucha on tap, vegan beer and wine, in-house food preparations/demonstrations and healthy eating classes.  You will also enjoy our poetry nights, movie nights, Sunday brunches, live music, and health & wellness seminars.

Help us make this vision a success.  We have secured our location and now we have our sign up...Yaay!  However, we have exceeded our initial startup funding and still need a little help putting some "flava" in the space.  Your funds will be used to make small repairs and renovations, establish accounts with local health food distributors, and hire additional staff.    Helping us will benefit if you select one of the perks.  They include discounts, free entrees, and personal chef services.  No contribution is too small.   $10 goes a long way!

story:
Welcome to NeverBox! The NeverBox is a monthly mystery box of Disney-themed treasure, curated by Disney fans for Disney fans! Each month, you will receive a box of Disney items selected just for you!

This campaign will help the NeverBox team fund our first month of shipments, starting late October.  

What can I expect from The NeverBox? 

  • Awesome Disney-themed merchandise, including Disney, Pixar, Marvel, and Star Wars.  Every month a surprise! 
  • A blend of items to appeal to a wide variety of fans..
  • 7 to 10 items each month 
  • $50 Average Value


During this Beta Testing phase, NeverBox is working on curating and funding our first month of boxes.  We expect to open up discounted multi-month subscriptions after our first month campaign is successfully funded.  At that time, you will have the opportunity to sign up for recurring billing on a month-to-month basis, or purchase boxes in 3-month-blocks at a discounted rate!
