story:
(Versión en Español más abajo ) 

Help Hub Oaxaca keep transforming lives! 

Support innovative business training for artisans and social entrepreneurs 

Impact Hub Oaxaca is a co-working space, event venue, and innovation lab for people and organizations who work towards social transformation. Impact Hub Oaxaca is locally owned and operated by a vibrant and talented team with diverse backgrounds.

Over the last few years, Impact Hub Oaxaca, has tried to adapt to the changing environment of the local social entrepreneurship ecosystem. However, these adaptions didn’t hit the core of the original business model of the Hub: To provide shared space and networking services for the members while recovering costs.

At the beginning of this year, we initiated a transition phase towards a new model to achieve sustainability of the project. By early March 2015 a rough model was in place and a strategic plan was defined. Over the subsequent months, Impact Hub Oaxaca has engaged in a continuous re-design process working intensely with its  newly committed staff team, along with other allies and stakeholders. Now, as the culmination of this process, it is time to launch the Incubation and Accelerator Model for Artisans and Social Entrepreneurs which the staff have designed.

Funding for investment in infrastructure and promotion of the new model will be needed for the next 4 to 6 next months.

WHAT IS IMPACT HUB OAXACA?

Our HUB Oaxaca is an organization, a location, and a community of more than 50 members and organizations who seek to improve the well-being, collaboration, and sustainability of both traditional and emerging communities in Oaxaca, Mexico.  

WE BELIEVE IN...

a world where creativity is nurtured and channeled towards a common good.  As an entrepreneurial incubator and accelerator, with deep roots in local communities, Impact Hub provides a diverse range of programming through workshops, classes, and cultural events. We link up organizations, teams and individuals with local and international resources, leading to diverse and positive transformative goals.

OUR MISSION

is to be a platform for collaboration and a catalyst for local initiatives which are dedicated to improving the well-being of Oaxaca. We are now providing connections, tools, knowledge and support in a shared space. We are implementing initiatives to create a sustainable Oaxaca. Hub Oaxaca is a home for interaction and exchange between traditional and emerging communities in Oaxaca.  

WHAT IS HAPPENING NOW AT IMPACT HUB OAXACA?

One of the key activities HUB Oaxaca has worked on in the last moths is to ​develop, test and implement alternative ways of providing services, to a wider segment of social entrepreneurs.

It has become clear that one of the biggest potential user segments among existing entrepreneurs is artisanal producers of handicrafts. For Oaxaca this group includes: weavers, wood carvers, ceramicists, mezcal producers, basket makers and others. All of them share a rich experience and mastery of their processes, but they lack the business knowledge and skills that could take them out of “survival mode”.

In the last 5 months we’ve been working to prototype a group of services and support we can provide to this special sector in Oaxaca. We have also created new membership models and their related benefits that make it easier for members to access services. Several new workshops and training sessions have been offered  some of which are now linked together to provide more coherent sequential programs, which we seek to implement this autumn.

It's time to launch this ambitious plan!

​​If we can raise at least $11,000 through Indiegogo, we could strengthen the operating structure of the Hub, enough to implement this exciting program: we will support our local artisans with incubation and acceleration programs to provide them with the tools for business planning, financial management, innovative design, competitive marketing and producer empowerment, among others.

Spread the word! Our doors have been open in the historical heart of Oaxaca for 5 years. Our membership continues to grow because we are filling a need in our community.  But, now, we need a extra support, to be able to help our local artisans.

Your donation will make the difference!

Rewards!

We have amazing rewards for our collaborators; check it out at the right! As a thank you for your donation you can receive coworking memberships, free workshops passes, free rent of our meeting rooms and palapa for your events, beautiful products created by our members and much more. Take a look and pick your perk!

All the perks descriptions are in Spanish and English 


Ayuda al Hub Oaxaca a Seguir Transformando Vidas

Apoyamos la innovación y formación en negocios de artesanos y emprendedores sociales

Impact Hub Oaxaca es un espacio de coworking y es sede de diferentes eventos, pero sobre todo es un laboratorio de innovación para personas y organizaciones que trabajan a favor de la transformación social. Impact Hub Oaxaca es posible gracias a un equipo talentoso y vibrante con diversos perfiles y orígenes.

En los últimos años, el Impact Hub Oaxaca ha intentado adaptarse a los constantes cambios del ecosistema de emprendimiento social local Oaxaqueño. Sin embargo, este proceso de adaptación no logro del todo impactar las bases de nuestro modelo de negocio original, que consistía en proporcionar un espacio de coworking así como servicios para los miembros de la red.

A principios de este año iniciamos una fase de transición hacia un nuevo modelo para lograr la sostenibilidad financiera del proyecto. En marzo de 2015 comenzamos con la implementación de un nuevo modelo y definimos un nuevo plan estratégico. En los meses posteriores, el Impact Hub Oaxaca ha visto un proceso de rediseño continuo, con el trabajo de nuestro comprometido equipo  , así como de la mano de aliados y actores afines. Ahora, para la culminación de este proceso necesitamos iniciar los procesos de incubación y el nuevo modelo de aceleradora de negocios, diseñados específicamente para artesanos y emprendedores sociales.

Para este nuevo modelo, necesitamos fondos que serán invertidos en infraestructura y promoción en los próximos 4 a 6 meses. 

¿QUÉ ES EL IMPACT HUB OAXACA?

El HUB Oaxaca es una organización, un lugar y una comunidad de más de 50 miembros y organizaciones que buscan mejorar el bienestar, la colaboración y la sostenibilidad de las comunidades tradicionales y emergentes en Oaxaca, México.

CREEMOS QUE

...Un mundo donde la creatividad es alimentada y canalizada hacia un bien común es posible. Como una incubadora para emprendedores y aceleradora de negocios con profundas raíces en las comunidades locales, Impact Hub Oaxaca proporciona una amplia gama de opciones a través de talleres, clases y eventos culturales. Vinculamos a organizaciones, equipos e individuos con recursos locales e internacionales, llevando a cabo acciones con transformadoras y de impacto social.

NUESTRA MISIÓN

Ser una plataforma para la colaboración y catalizador de iniciativas locales que se dedican a mejorar el bienestar de Oaxaca. Estamos proporcionando conexiones, herramientas, conocimientos y apoyo en un espacio compartido. Estamos implementando iniciativas para crear un Oaxaca sustentable. Hub Oaxaca es hogar para la interacción e intercambio entre las comunidades tradicionales y emergentes en Oaxaca.

¿LO QUE ESTÁ SUCEDIENDO AHORA EN EL IMPACT HUB OAXACA?

Una de las actividades clave que Hub Oaxaca ha trabajado en los últimos meses es desarrollar, probar e implementar formas alternativas de prestación de servicios, a un segmento más amplio de los emprendedores sociales.

Estamos apuntando como usuarios potenciales a los empresarios artesanales productores de artesanías. En Oaxaca este grupo incluye: tejedores, talladores de madera, ceramistas, productores de mezcal y cesteros, etc. Todos ellos comparten una gran experiencia y dominio de sus procesos, pero les falta el conocimiento del negocio y habilidades que podrían sacarlos de un "modo de supervivencia".

En los últimos 5 meses hemos estado trabajando para crear un grupo de servicios y apoyos que podemos proporcionar a este sector en Oaxaca. También hemos creado nuevos modelos de membresía con beneficios que facilitan a los usuarios a acceder a los servicios. Ofrecemos varios talleres y sesiones de entrenamiento, ligados de manera estratégica para proporcionar programas secuenciales más coherentes, que intentamos poner en práctica este otoño.

Es el momento de iniciar este ambicioso plan.

Si podemos recaudar al menos $11.000 USD a través de  Indiegogo, podríamos fortalecer nuestra estructura operativa, lo suficiente para poner en práctica este emocionante programa: vamos a apoyar a nuestros artesanos locales con programas de incubación y aceleración para brindarles las herramientas para la gestión financiera, planificación, diseño innovador, competitividad, capacitación, marketing, producción, entre otros.

¡Corre la voz! Nuestras puertas han estado abiertas en el centro histórico de Oaxaca por más de 5 años. Nuestra membresía sigue creciendo ya que cubrimos una necesidad en nuestra comunidad. Pero ahora, necesitamos un apoyo adicional, para poder ayudar a nuestros artesanos locales.

¡Tú donativo hará la diferencia!

¡Recompensas!

¡Tenemos increíbles premios para nuestros colaboradores; Échale un vistazo al menú de la derecha! Como un agradecimiento por tu donación puedes recibir membresías, pases gratis a nuestro coworking space, talleres gratis, uso de nuestras salas de reuniones, espacio para tus eventos, increíbles productos creados por nuestros miembros y mucho más. Echa un vistazo y escoge tu beneficio!
story_txt:
(Versión en Español más abajo ) Help Hub Oaxaca keep transforming lives! Support innovative business training for artisans and social entrepreneurs Impact Hub Oaxaca is a co-working space, event venue, and innovation lab for people and organizations who work towards social transformation. Impact Hub Oaxaca is locally owned and operated by a vibrant and talented team with diverse backgrounds.Over the last few years, Impact Hub Oaxaca, has tried to adapt to the changing environment of the local social entrepreneurship ecosystem. However, these adaptions didn’t hit the core of the original business model of the Hub: To provide shared space and networking services for the members while recovering costs.At the beginning of this year, we initiated a transition phase towards a new model to achieve sustainability of the project. By early March 2015 a rough model was in place and a strategic plan was defined. Over the subsequent months, Impact Hub Oaxaca has engaged in a continuous re-design process working intensely with its  newly committed staff team, along with other allies and stakeholders. Now, as the culmination of this process, it is time to launch the Incubation and Accelerator Model for Artisans and Social Entrepreneurs which the staff have designed.Funding for investment in infrastructure and promotion of the new model will be needed for the next 4 to 6 next months.WHAT IS IMPACT HUB OAXACA?Our HUB Oaxaca is an organization, a location, and a community of more than 50 members and organizations who seek to improve the well-being, collaboration, and sustainability of both traditional and emerging communities in Oaxaca, Mexico.  WE BELIEVE IN...a world where creativity is nurtured and channeled towards a common good.  As an entrepreneurial incubator and accelerator, with deep roots in local communities, Impact Hub provides a diverse range of programming through workshops, classes, and cultural events. We link up organizations, teams and individuals with local and international resources, leading to diverse and positive transformative goals.OUR MISSIONis to be a platform for collaboration and a catalyst for local initiatives which are dedicated to improving the well-being of Oaxaca. We are now providing connections, tools, knowledge and support in a shared space. We are implementing initiatives to create a sustainable Oaxaca. Hub Oaxaca is a home for interaction and exchange between traditional and emerging communities in Oaxaca.  WHAT IS HAPPENING NOW AT IMPACT HUB OAXACA?One of the key activities HUB Oaxaca has worked on in the last moths is to ​develop, test and implement alternative ways of providing services, to a wider segment of social entrepreneurs.It has become clear that one of the biggest potential user segments among existing entrepreneurs is artisanal producers of handicrafts. For Oaxaca this group includes: weavers, wood carvers, ceramicists, mezcal producers, basket makers and others. All of them share a rich experience and mastery of their processes, but they lack the business knowledge and skills that could take them out of “survival mode”.In the last 5 months we’ve been working to prototype a group of services and support we can provide to this special sector in Oaxaca. We have also created new membership models and their related benefits that make it easier for members to access services. Several new workshops and training sessions have been offered  some of which are now linked together to provide more coherent sequential programs, which we seek to implement this autumn.It's time to launch this ambitious plan!​​If we can raise at least $11,000 through Indiegogo, we could strengthen the operating structure of the Hub, enough to implement this exciting program: we will support our local artisans with incubation and acceleration programs to provide them with the tools for business planning, financial management, innovative design, competitive marketing and producer empowerment, among others.Spread the word! Our doors have been open in the historical heart of Oaxaca for 5 years. Our membership continues to grow because we are filling a need in our community.  But, now, we need a extra support, to be able to help our local artisans.Your donation will make the difference!Rewards!We have amazing rewards for our collaborators; check it out at the right! As a thank you for your donation you can receive coworking memberships, free workshops passes, free rent of our meeting rooms and palapa for your events, beautiful products created by our members and much more. Take a look and pick your perk!All the perks descriptions are in Spanish and English Ayuda al Hub Oaxaca a Seguir Transformando VidasApoyamos la innovación y formación en negocios de
artesanos y emprendedores sociales
Impact Hub Oaxaca es un espacio de coworking y es sede de diferentes eventos, pero sobre todo es un laboratorio de innovación
para personas y organizaciones que trabajan a favor de la transformación
social. Impact Hub Oaxaca es posible gracias a un equipo talentoso y vibrante
con diversos perfiles y orígenes.
En los últimos años, el Impact Hub Oaxaca ha
intentado adaptarse a los constantes cambios del ecosistema de emprendimiento
social local Oaxaqueño. Sin embargo, este proceso de adaptación no logro del todo
impactar las bases de nuestro modelo de negocio original, que consistía en proporcionar un espacio
de coworking así como servicios para los miembros de la red.
A principios de este año iniciamos una fase de
transición hacia un nuevo modelo para lograr la sostenibilidad financiera del
proyecto. En marzo de 2015 comenzamos con la implementación de un nuevo modelo y
definimos un nuevo plan estratégico. En los meses posteriores, el Impact Hub
Oaxaca ha visto un proceso de rediseño continuo, con el trabajo de nuestro comprometido
equipo  , así como de la mano de aliados
y actores afines. Ahora, para la culminación de este proceso necesitamos iniciar los procesos de incubación y el nuevo modelo de aceleradora de
negocios, diseñados específicamente para artesanos y emprendedores sociales.
Para este nuevo modelo, necesitamos fondos que serán
invertidos en infraestructura y promoción en los próximos 4 a 6 meses. 
¿QUÉ ES EL IMPACT HUB OAXACA?
El HUB Oaxaca es una organización, un lugar y
una comunidad de más de 50 miembros y organizaciones que buscan mejorar el
bienestar, la colaboración y la sostenibilidad de las comunidades tradicionales
y emergentes en Oaxaca, México.
CREEMOS QUE 
...Un mundo donde la creatividad es alimentada y
canalizada hacia un bien común es posible. Como una incubadora para emprendedores
y aceleradora de negocios con profundas raíces en las comunidades locales, Impact
Hub Oaxaca proporciona una amplia gama de opciones a través de talleres, clases
y eventos culturales. Vinculamos a organizaciones, equipos e individuos con
recursos locales e internacionales, llevando a cabo acciones con transformadoras
y de impacto social. 
NUESTRA MISIÓN
Ser una plataforma para la colaboración y
catalizador de iniciativas locales que se dedican a mejorar el bienestar de
Oaxaca. Estamos proporcionando conexiones, herramientas, conocimientos y apoyo
en un espacio compartido. Estamos implementando iniciativas para crear un Oaxaca
sustentable. Hub Oaxaca es hogar para la interacción e intercambio entre las
comunidades tradicionales y emergentes en Oaxaca.
¿LO QUE ESTÁ SUCEDIENDO AHORA EN EL IMPACT HUB OAXACA?
Una de las actividades clave que Hub Oaxaca ha
trabajado en los últimos meses es desarrollar, probar e implementar formas
alternativas de prestación de servicios, a un segmento más amplio de los emprendedores
sociales.
Estamos apuntando como usuarios potenciales a los
empresarios artesanales productores de artesanías. En Oaxaca este grupo
incluye: tejedores, talladores de madera, ceramistas, productores de mezcal y
cesteros, etc. Todos ellos comparten una gran experiencia y dominio de sus
procesos, pero les falta el conocimiento del negocio y habilidades que podrían
sacarlos de un "modo de supervivencia".
En los últimos 5 meses hemos estado trabajando
para crear un grupo de servicios y apoyos que podemos proporcionar a este
sector en Oaxaca. También hemos creado nuevos modelos de membresía con beneficios
que facilitan a los usuarios a acceder a los servicios. Ofrecemos varios
talleres y sesiones de entrenamiento, ligados de manera estratégica para
proporcionar programas secuenciales más coherentes, que intentamos poner en
práctica este otoño.
Es el momento de iniciar este ambicioso plan.
Si podemos recaudar al menos $11.000 USD a
través de  Indiegogo, podríamos
fortalecer nuestra estructura operativa, lo suficiente para poner en práctica
este emocionante programa: vamos a apoyar a nuestros artesanos locales con
programas de incubación y aceleración para brindarles las herramientas para la
gestión financiera, planificación, diseño innovador, competitividad,
capacitación, marketing, producción, entre otros.
¡Corre la voz! Nuestras puertas han estado
abiertas en el centro histórico de Oaxaca por más de 5 años. Nuestra membresía
sigue creciendo ya que cubrimos una necesidad en nuestra comunidad. Pero ahora,
necesitamos un apoyo adicional, para poder ayudar a nuestros artesanos locales.
¡Tú donativo hará la diferencia!
¡Recompensas!
¡Tenemos increíbles premios para nuestros
colaboradores; Échale un vistazo al menú de la derecha! Como un agradecimiento
por tu donación puedes recibir membresías, pases gratis a nuestro coworking
space, talleres gratis, uso de nuestras salas de reuniones, espacio para tus eventos,
increíbles productos creados por nuestros miembros y mucho más. Echa un vistazo
y escoge tu beneficio!

story:
Filtering water for these small scale irrigation systems can cost more than the irrigation kit itself and requires external power - not available!

Tens of millions of people in dry regions could grow more food if only they had access to simple and practical drip kits designed to work with any kind of water.



We know that any dripper/emitter/valve will get blocked - so we have designed our key components to be squeezable to flush out debris e.g. insect larvae, algae and in-organic matter (mud). With our new technology, small farmers can use water from any source for example from a lagoon, river, borehole etc. to grow more food.

We are overwhelmed by enquiries for our drip irrigation kits in Africa but we have to make them affordable for low income families - shipping big bulky drip kits half way round the world is prohibitively expensive and unsustainable.

  • ‘Made in Africa’ and with only local transportation needs to contend with we could reduce the kit prices by 50% making them affordable to all but the poorest families. 
  • With a local factory creating new jobs for local people AND with your support we could achieve our sustainable goal. 
  • Local manufacture also means that for the poorest families we will be able to supply many, many more drip irrigation kits through our associated charity - Grow More Food.





We have an offer of $360,000 ring-fenced for our use by the Africa Enterprise Challenge Fund (AECF) to help us to establish Liquid Lever (Kenya) Ltd, comprising a $90,000 grant and $270,000 loan, principally for Revenue Expenditure. But we need to add at least $95,000 to this for Capital Expenditure on the Hose extrusion line and ancillary equipment to make drip Hoses and then with some tweaks, co-extrude the new SMART POLYMER Liquid Lever 'moisture-responsive' kink valves.

We have a ‘full business plan’ and AECF have been very rigorous in their selection process and they will be regularly monitoring our project over the next six years.



  • AECF funding will take us nearly 80% of the way to our target provided we satisfy all of their conditions, otherwise their offer will be withdrawn
  • Because our project to help low income families to grow more food in arid African communities has no bricks and mortar assets, a bank loan is not feasible - 

This is why we are crowdfunding.


Our goal is to raise the balance of $95,000 in 40 days!


With these funds we can set up the essential Hose and Kink Valve manufacturing facility in Nairobi, Kenya and add further value to this by packing the drip kits and selling and distributing these across East Africa, through Sales Agents, independent Distributors and through our registered charity Grow More Food.



  • For trees & shrubs - our NEW! SMART POLYMER Kink Valves are moisture-activated - so that plants water themselves, up to 8 gallons per hour (30L)
  • For row & salad crops - our SqueezeMe Emitters/Drippers are adjustable - so that plants can be watered, anything up to 1/4 gallon per hour (1L)


We have developed a NEW 'SMART POLYMER' KINK VALVE to enable people to irrigate trees and shrubs on dry land with the minimum of water - no matter how dirty! Our unique Liquid Lever moisture-activated kink valve is now just one mouse click away from mass-production.




Prototype Kink Valve (1.5" long - 38 mm) showing closing operation


 

This real-time video loop shows the valve in the final seconds where it forms a kink and closes off the irrigation flow. The whole sequence from dry to wet has taken approximately 40 minutes. So the valve is able to deliver several gallons of water to the tree or shrub before closing for a few hours or even days if the conditions around the kink valve remain wet.


Our Kink Valve has featured in:

  • Our local press
  • Plastics & Rubber Weekly
  • TPI News (UKTI Publication)
  • IChemE Water Awards
  • The Shell Springboard Awards.






Winning the awards was a real boost and confirmed that many other people could identify with and share our vision.  

But for people to benefit from our new technology we had to figure out a way to make them in big numbers and with the right materials.  And design new connectors and hoses so that we could make complete irrigation kits to water plants. Our development journey is now almost complete and we are ready to go!












It is our brand name for a range of family-sized irrigation Drip Kits comprising very practical Connectors, Hoses and 'Drippers' (i.e. where the water comes out).

  • We have trialled these in Kenya over the past year, during which we were constantly asked by smallholders, "When can we have them and how much?"
  • That year was important for us as even after six years of development work in the UK we still had things to learn.
  • Then with the changes in place we promoted the kits for the first time at the Nairobi International Trade Fair, Kenya - Sep/Oct 2015.
  • Our team in Kenya were overwhelmed with over 4,000 visitors to our dirt/cabbage Drip Irrigation patch.
  • We have the opportunity now to make a real difference to people's lives, our drip kits work, and people all over Africa want them.

But we have a problem. Our sub-contractor makes our TPE Hoses in the UK and they are just too bulky and too expensive to ship to Africa. We must make hoses in Africa for Africa, and then make our new SMART POLYMER Liquid Lever Kink Valves.




We can set up a manufacturing facility in Kenya, employing local people within which we will be able to install and operate a Hose extrusion line and marry these hoses up with our connectors, which we make in the UK, then sell our Drip Irrigation Kits at locally affordable prices throughout East Africa.


But there's more:

  • We also run a charity called Grow More Food and through this we will also donate drip kits to the most needy in dry and remote regions.

We want our 'Technology Transfer' to Africa to be an empowering experience in every sense of the word. Extruding our hoses locally is the first step, but it all starts here with the customer:



Having designed all of our drip kit components to overcome the universal problems associated with small scale drip irrigation, we now want to create local jobs, cultivate skills and boost livelihoods all the way along the supply chain. Without being disruptive, we want to add value to the African economy and we believe that added value comes from within each and every one of us.

Please note:

Our Perks from $300 to $5,000 also include drip kits of various sizes which we will donate to families in Kenya through our charity Grow More Food.  As a follow up, each family will send you a photograph and a letter thanking you for your donation, showing the benefits of your life-changing support.

If you have a special request please contact us by email ‘info@liquidlever.com’.

*Colours supplied and specifications including visual appearance may vary in your ‘first off’ samples as our first priority will be to achieve consistent kink valve/emitter kinking performance.



Judging from other people's experience it takes up to a couple of months for packages to find their way to everyone around the world. We will try to improve on this and always let you know when a package is being shipped to you.

Our open door policy means that as a Founding Supporter you are welcome to visit us at any time – and your friends are welcome too. 




Where families are clustered together we have an ambition to supply a new type of float valve (an un-blockable one) which could be fitted to each irrigation water tank, enabling a number of tanks to be linked together with hoses to refill automatically from a water source.  This would do away with manual filling with buckets.  This simple step could transform many lives for the better.  We have a prototype ‘un-blockable’ float valve ready for production and are presenting it here for your consideration as our stretch target goal.

Raising an additional $50,000 would enable us to introduce this unique ‘Pinch Float Valve’. Our prototype operates with any kind of feed water - without blocking.  This is because of two things namely, (1) it has an open 1/2" through-bore and (2) it can only ever be fully open or fully closed – no jams or dribbling. These valves will enable up to 20 families to refill their irrigation water tanks automatically (giving them more time for other things) through a layout of hoses from a single water source, for example a borehole and, most importantly, a simple ‘displacement’ type water pump.

This additional invention has the potential to benefit at least 100,000 small communities in remote dry regions of Africa.



Apart from the obvious benefits of groups of families cultivating plots of land together and sharing the cost of a borehole and pump. The increase in organised leaf canopy on hitherto barren soils will be very attractive to Carbon Off-set companies seeking new projects. The world's soils store on the order of 2,500 gigatons of carbon, which is three times the amount in the atmosphere. Low Carbon soils especially, have the capacity to sequestrate large quantities of Carbon from the atmosphere.

We think that Carbon Off-setting organisations will soon be attracted to subsidize the cost of community-scale drip irrigation systems - making them even more affordable to families, benefiting remote rural communities and urban industry. Helping to both reverse climate change and counter population drift.



It's not often that such a wide audience of people are engaged in the development of new products but we think this is the perfect time for some intervention on your part as it's not just about money - you might have some ideas of your own!

Right here and now we have ‘tangible’ drip irrigation kits which on the face of it look pretty plain and ordinary, but look closer and you will see that every component is subtly different from its contemporary.  To keep the kit prices down to an affordable level we have to manufacture in volume and make best use of our combination of skills, where Mike, our Founder, is an accomplished engineer and Chryspin, our Director in Kenya is a great communicator and lobbyist with extensive experience gained from travelling throughout Africa. We also benefit from the services of our accountant, lawyer, patent attorney and local specialist manufacturers all of whom advise us from time to time over ‘issues’ that arise – mostly gained through hindsight.  We think this is a winning combination to reduce the current risk but we will never turn away some blue sky thinking on your part.  


Setting up a whole new business is not for the feint hearted, but we have a lot of support on our side and have established good working relationships with local manufacturers such that when we recruit our new employees they will be trained up by our partner organisations by working in their office and production areas under close supervision.  We want to get our work practices right from the outset so that when we lease our new premises we will be able to hit the ground running –as they say. 


Quality and maintaining morale:

When I was much younger, as an apprentice, I found myself having to do lots of repetitive work which quickly became really, really boring.  Conscious of the fact that there will be a number of operations in the production process, the warehouse and in the office which will fall into this category we will set up small teams or cells of people, each with a team leader and rotate their jobs each month on a competitive and fair basis.  Hopefully this will reduce monotony, give a sense of personal achievement and broaden each employee’s understanding of where they fit in, and fully appreciate the value of their own contribution.  The many visitors that we plan to have on a regular basis will also help to maintain a high level of interest and involvement. 

 

Product development journey:

We have spent six years developing our range of products from scratch and over the coming months, and with your help we will complete this process by mid-2016 and step up to the plate as a ‘volume manufacturer’.  

However we do ask that you afford us one caveat: Our new SMART POLYMER Liquid Lever Kink Valve is acknowledged globally as a step-change invention for the irrigation industry, and likened to the electrical industry's micro-switch.  Once the Hose extruder line is running satisfactorily and our staff are confident, we will use the weekend downtime to run the extruder, with some extra gear so that it can co-extrude our special Liquid Lever polymers.  For commercial reasons this bit is still under wraps but we promise that you will be the first to know when we have reached the end of our development journey and of course be the first to receive Liquid Lever Kink Valves from the line.  Our extruder trials are now just one step away from completion and we have already tested the co-polymers for 1,800 wet and dry cycles – equivalent to approx. six years of use in the field.  

Thank you for your patience and for being a part of this journey.



Together the Liquid Lever team have over a 100 years of combined experience in product design, collaboration and bringing products to market.







They work by gravity (zero energy) from a tank of water – any kind of water, turbid, etc.  In many cases the water tank can be stood on the ground. 

Each kit comprises connectors and hoses which are joined together (push fit) and laid out on the ground in an array to provide one dripper per plant for water to drip out onto the soil.

We have developed two unique types of dripper, one for salad & row crops and one for trees & shrubs, called the SqueezeMe and the NEW Liquid Lever respectively.  The SqueezeMe Emitter is adjustable and made from two parts, uniquely it can be pinched or squeezed to flush out trapped debris. The NEW Liquid Lever Kink Valve is based on SMART POLYMERS which respond to local moisture or the lack of it.  In practice each tree or shrub controls its own watering. 

As the plant sucks the ground dry the Liquid Lever un-kinks to allow the flow of irrigation water out onto the ground until it is re-wetted sufficiently and then it kinks closed again until the next time.



By continuous co-extrusion of the Liquid Lever Kink Valve profile and selective cutting:


Your support will fund the custom build and installation of the Co-extrusion Line which comprises the four following basic items of equipment:







Our sub-contractors in the UK manufacture all of our components using our own custom plastic injection moulding tools for the connectors, and extrusion dies for the Hoses and Liquid Lever Kink Valves. 



Our Manifold Moulding Tool LL06 running at our sub-contractor in the UK:


 

More of our moulding tools...





Are you a non-profit organisation?

  • No and Yes.  The Applicant is Liquid Lever Irrigation Ltd in the UK and the funding is to enable our new company Liquid Lever (Kenya) Ltd to manufacture and supply our range of products in Africa.  Grow More Food is our UK registered charity.

  • Grow More Food holds the Master Licence to all of the technology and has sub-licensed the manufacturing and distribution rights to LLI Ltd & LLK Ltd, in return for a 5% Royalty on sales anywhere in the world.   These royalties are used to donate drip kits to families in Africa who can’t afford them.  This is the ‘Object’ of the charity.
  • Mike the founder and inventor has licensed all of the intellectual property to Grow More Food. All the Agreements are in place now, and we can’t wait to get started.  So far it’s just been a pilot run.


How many plants can you water?

It depends on the height of the water tank.  We make drip kits from 10 Plant to 500 Plant for water tanks from 0-1 metre elevation and have successfully trialled 1,200 Plant kits with a 2 metre tank elevation.  But a number of Kenyan Farmers now are pushing the boundaries with elevated tanks (3-5 metres) and hope to operate up to 5,000 drippers at a time.  These early customers are extremely enthusiastic and will quickly find out what the practical limit is – and let us know.  There is something of a competition going on between them.


How long will the drip kits last?

Our connectors and hoses are made from polymers used in the automotive industry, their properties are well documented and they have life expectancies in excess of 10 years.


What are the benefits to African Families?

We have grown crops in Kenya very successfully using our drip kits which, when we measure the outcomes we can show a 44 week payback period just from growing cabbages.  Using local shops on the outskirts of Nairobi as price guides.

Successful drip irrigation will extend the growing season for families so that crops can be available when external supplies are dwindling and becoming more costly.  Our drip irrigation takes this to the next level as it can be kept operating even when the quality of the feed water is deteriorating for example, due to a drop in the water table.


Why Kenya?

  • Kenya is where we plan to establish ourselves first, and supply drip kits throughout East Africa.
  • In readiness we have set up our new company Liquid Lever (Kenya) Ltd in Nairobi and our new staff will be encouraged to be outgoing and outward thinking. We have an open door policy Monday to Friday and will encourage people from Africa and overseas to visit the factory and spread the word about our products and our continuing story of the people who make them.
  • We can ship our finished mouldings (connectors) from Felixstowe docks in the UK to Mombasa sea port and by lorry on to Nairobi.
  • Similarly our polymers to make Hoses and Liquid Lever Kink Valves can follow the same route.  The sea journey is 38 days.
  • For us this is the best option at this time as; (a) we love the people, (b) we love the country, (c) many people are multi-lingual (d) the commercial and legal systems are similar to ours, (e) the African Headquarters of the UN is based in Nairobi and many of the well-known NGO’s have country offices and field staff there.  This is important as a portion of our work is geared towards providing drip kits at subsidised cost to remote communities through DFID and USAID funded initiatives. 
  • However that said, we keep receiving enquiries for our drip kit technology from people in other sub-Saharan countries and Southern Africa and West Africa. So it could be that our Kenya operation will quickly reveal the perfect framework for us to repeat it in other regions of Africa.  Keeping the costs down and helping us to reach as wide an audience as possible.  
  • We are building good relations with a number of local manufacturers, distributors and commercial organisations which see us as adding value to their own enterprise as our products are complementary.
  • We have chosen Kenya as our starting point but already have enquiries to establish manufacturing elsewhere in Africa. Family needs are the same wherever you go - people need to grow more food.


Will this project help the environment if it is widely adopted?


Yes – in any arid and remote location the benefits are twofold:


  • Converting barren land to productive land with mixed plant species e.g., trees, shrubs, vines and salad crops creates micro habitats for all kinds of flora and fauna.
  • Displacement pumping irrigation water for community projects instead of pressure pumping saves approx. 85% of the energy normally associated with conventional drip irrigation. 


I have other questions that aren’t shown here – where do I go?

  • Please add your questions on the comments section of this campaign or by email to info@liquidlever.com
  • You may also find the answer that you are looking for on our websites: www.liquidlever.com www.tankfedirrigation.com & www.growmorefood.org .

This is why we are crowdfunding.



Our goal is to raise the balance of $95,000 in 40 days!

With these funds we can set up the essential Hose and Kink Valve manufacturing facility in Nairobi, Kenya and add further value to this by packing the drip kits and selling and distributing these across East Africa, through Sales Agents, independent Distributors and through our registered charity Grow More Food.










For trees & shrubs - our NEW! SMART POLYMER Kink Valves are moisture-activated - so that plants water themselves, up to 8 gallons per hour (30L)
For row & salad crops - our SqueezeMe Emitters/Drippers are adjustable - so that plants can be watered, anything up to 1/4 gallon per hour (1L)




We have developed a NEW 'SMART POLYMER' KINK VALVE to enable people to irrigate trees and shrubs on dry land with the minimum of water - no matter how dirty! Our unique Liquid Lever moisture-activated kink valve is now just one mouse click away from mass-production.















Prototype Kink Valve (1.5" long - 38 mm) showing closing operation


 


This real-time video loop shows the valve in the final seconds where it forms a kink and closes off the irrigation flow. The whole sequence from dry to wet has taken approximately 40 minutes. So the valve is able to deliver several gallons of water to the tree or shrub before closing for a few hours or even days if the conditions around the kink valve remain wet.

Our Kink Valve has featured in:






Our local press


Plastics & Rubber Weekly


TPI News (UKTI Publication)


IChemE Water Awards


The Shell Springboard Awards.




















Winning the awards was a real boost and confirmed
that many other people could identify with and share our vision.  
But for people to benefit from our new technology we had to figure out a way
to make them in big numbers and with the right materials.  And design new connectors and hoses so that we could make complete irrigation kits to water plants. Our development journey is now almost complete
and we are ready to go!










































It is our brand name for a range of family-sized irrigation Drip Kits comprising very practical Connectors, Hoses and 'Drippers' (i.e. where the water comes out).
We have trialled these in Kenya over the past year, during which we were constantly asked by smallholders, "When can we have them and how much?"
That year was important for us as even after six years of development work in the UK we still had things to learn.
Then with the changes in place we promoted the kits for the first time at the Nairobi International Trade Fair, Kenya - Sep/Oct 2015.
Our team in Kenya were overwhelmed with over 4,000 visitors to our dirt/cabbage Drip Irrigation patch.
We have the opportunity now to make a real difference to people's lives, our drip kits work, and people all over Africa want them.
But we have a problem. Our sub-contractor makes our TPE Hoses in the UK and they are just too bulky and too expensive to ship to Africa. We must make hoses in Africa for Africa, and then make our new SMART POLYMER Liquid Lever Kink Valves.






We can set up a manufacturing facility in Kenya, employing local people within which we will be able to install and operate a Hose extrusion line and marry these hoses up with our connectors, which we make in the UK, then sell our Drip Irrigation Kits at locally affordable prices throughout East Africa.


But there's more:
We also run a charity called Grow More Food and through this we will also donate drip kits to the most needy in dry and remote regions.




























We want our 'Technology Transfer' to Africa to be an empowering experience in every sense of the word. Extruding our hoses locally is the first step, but it all starts here with the customer:





Having designed all of our drip kit components to overcome the universal problems associated with small scale drip irrigation, we now want to create local jobs, cultivate skills and boost livelihoods all the way along the supply chain. Without being disruptive, we want to add value to the African economy and we believe that added value comes from within each and every one of us.




















Please
note:
Our
Perks from $300 to $5,000 also include drip kits of various sizes which we will
donate to families in Kenya through our charity Grow More Food.  As a follow up, each
family will send you a photograph and a letter thanking you for your donation, showing the benefits of your life-changing support. 

If
you have a special request please contact us by email ‘info@liquidlever.com’.
*Colours supplied and specifications including visual appearance may
vary in your ‘first off’ samples as our first priority will be to achieve consistent kink valve/emitter kinking performance.








Judging from other people's experience it takes up to a couple of months for packages to find their way to everyone around the world. We will try to improve on this and always let you know when a package is being shipped to you.
Our open door policy means that as a Founding Supporter you are welcome to visit us at any time – and your friends are welcome too. 












Where
families are clustered together we have an ambition to supply a new type of float
valve (an un-blockable one) which could be fitted to each irrigation water tank,
enabling a number of tanks to be linked together with hoses to refill
automatically from a water source.  This
would do away with manual filling with buckets. 
This simple step could transform many lives for the better.  We have a prototype ‘un-blockable’ float
valve ready for production and are presenting it here for your consideration as
our stretch target goal. 
Raising
an additional $50,000 would enable us to introduce this unique ‘Pinch
Float Valve’. Our prototype operates with any kind of feed water - without
blocking.  This is because of two things
namely, (1) it has an open 1/2" through-bore and (2) it can only ever be
fully open or fully closed – no jams or dribbling. These valves will enable up
to 20 families to refill their irrigation water tanks automatically (giving
them more time for other things) through a layout of hoses from a single water
source, for example a borehole and, most importantly, a simple ‘displacement’ type water pump.

This additional invention has the potential to benefit at least 100,000 small communities in remote dry regions of Africa.










Apart from the obvious benefits of groups of families cultivating plots of land together and sharing the cost of a borehole and pump. The increase in organised leaf canopy on hitherto barren soils will be very attractive to Carbon Off-set companies seeking new projects. The world's soils store on the order of 2,500 gigatons of carbon, which is three times the amount in the atmosphere. Low Carbon soils especially, have the capacity to sequestrate large quantities of Carbon from the atmosphere.


We think that Carbon Off-setting organisations will soon be attracted to subsidize the cost of community-scale drip irrigation systems - making them even more affordable to families, benefiting remote rural communities and urban industry. Helping to both reverse climate change and counter population drift.








It's not often that such a wide audience of people are engaged in the development of new products but we think this is the perfect time for some intervention on your part as it's not just about money - you might have some ideas of your own!


Right here and now we have ‘tangible’ drip irrigation kits
which on the face of it look pretty plain and ordinary, but look closer and you
will see that every component is subtly different from its contemporary.  To keep the kit prices down to an affordable level
we have to manufacture in volume and make best use of our combination of skills, where Mike, our Founder, is an accomplished engineer and Chryspin, our Director in Kenya is a great communicator and lobbyist with extensive experience gained from travelling throughout Africa. We also benefit from the services of our accountant, lawyer, patent attorney and local specialist
manufacturers all of whom advise us from time to time over ‘issues’ that arise
– mostly gained through hindsight.  We
think this is a winning combination to reduce the current risk but we will
never turn away some blue sky thinking on your part.  

Setting up a whole new business is not for the feint hearted, but we have a lot of support on our side and have established good working
relationships with local manufacturers such that when we recruit our new
employees they will be trained up by our partner organisations by working in
their office and production areas under close supervision.  We want to get our work practices right from
the outset so that when we lease our new premises we will be able to hit the
ground running –as they say. 




Quality and maintaining
morale:
When I was much younger, as an apprentice, I found myself
having to do lots of repetitive work which quickly became really, really
boring.  Conscious of the fact that there
will be a number of operations in the production process, the warehouse and in
the office which will fall into this category we will set up small teams or
cells of people, each with a team leader and rotate their jobs each month on a
competitive and fair basis.  Hopefully
this will reduce monotony, give a sense of personal achievement and broaden
each employee’s understanding of where they fit in, and fully appreciate the value of their own contribution.  The many visitors
that we plan to have on a regular basis will also help to maintain a high level
of interest and involvement.  
  
Product development
journey:
We have spent six years developing our range of products
from scratch and over the coming months, and with your help we will complete
this process by mid-2016 and step up to the plate as a ‘volume manufacturer’.  
However we do ask that you afford us one caveat: Our new
SMART POLYMER Liquid Lever Kink Valve is acknowledged globally as a step-change
invention for the irrigation industry, and likened to the electrical industry's micro-switch. 
Once the Hose extruder line is running satisfactorily and our staff are
confident, we will use the weekend downtime to run the extruder, with some
extra gear so that it can co-extrude our special Liquid Lever polymers.  For commercial reasons this bit is still
under wraps but we promise that you will be the first to know when we have
reached the end of our development journey and of course be the first to
receive Liquid Lever Kink Valves from the line.  Our
extruder trials are now just one step away from completion and we have already
tested the co-polymers for 1,800 wet and dry cycles – equivalent to approx. six
years of use in the field.  
Thank you for your patience and for being a part of this
journey.











Together the Liquid Lever team have over a 100 years of combined
experience in product design, collaboration and bringing products to market.


















They work by gravity (zero energy) from a tank of water – any kind of water, turbid, etc.  In many cases the water tank can be stood on the ground. 
Each kit comprises connectors and hoses which are joined together (push fit) and laid out on the ground in an array to provide one dripper per plant for water to drip out onto the soil.
We have developed two unique types of dripper, one for salad & row crops and one for trees & shrubs, called the SqueezeMe and the NEW Liquid Lever respectively.  The SqueezeMe Emitter is adjustable and made from two parts, uniquely it can be pinched or squeezed to flush out trapped debris. The NEW Liquid Lever Kink Valve is based on SMART POLYMERS which respond to local moisture or the lack of it.  In practice each tree or shrub controls its own watering. 
As the plant sucks the ground dry the Liquid Lever un-kinks to allow the flow of irrigation water out onto the ground until it is re-wetted sufficiently and then it kinks closed again until the next time.








By continuous co-extrusion of the Liquid Lever Kink Valve profile and selective cutting:



Your support will fund the custom build and installation of the Co-extrusion Line which comprises the four following basic items of equipment:

















Our sub-contractors in the UK manufacture all of our components using our own custom plastic injection moulding tools for the connectors, and extrusion dies for the Hoses and Liquid Lever Kink Valves. 



Our Manifold Moulding Tool LL06 running at our sub-contractor in the UK:

 More of our moulding tools...













Are you a non-profit organisation?


No and Yes.  The Applicant is Liquid Lever Irrigation Ltd in the UK and the funding is to enable our new company Liquid Lever (Kenya) Ltd to manufacture and supply our range of products in Africa.  Grow More Food is our UK registered charity.





Grow More Food holds the Master Licence to all of the technology and has sub-licensed the manufacturing and distribution rights to LLI Ltd & LLK Ltd, in return for a 5% Royalty on sales anywhere in the world.   These royalties are used to donate drip kits to families in Africa who can’t afford them.  This is the ‘Object’ of the charity.


Mike the founder and inventor has licensed all of the intellectual property to Grow More Food. All the Agreements are in place now, and we can’t wait to get started.  So far it’s just been a pilot run.



How many plants can you water?
It depends on the height of the water tank.  We make drip kits from 10 Plant to 500 Plant for water tanks from 0-1 metre elevation and have successfully trialled 1,200 Plant kits with a 2 metre tank elevation.  But a number of Kenyan Farmers now are pushing the boundaries with elevated tanks (3-5 metres) and hope to operate up to 5,000 drippers at a time.  These early customers are extremely enthusiastic and will quickly find out what the practical limit is – and let us know.  There is something of a competition going on between them.

How long will the drip kits last?
Our connectors and hoses are made from polymers used in the automotive industry, their properties are well documented and they have life expectancies in excess of 10 years.

What are the benefits to African Families?
We have grown crops in Kenya very successfully using our drip kits which, when we measure the outcomes we can show a 44 week payback period just from growing cabbages.  Using local shops on the outskirts of Nairobi as price guides.
Successful drip irrigation will extend the growing season for families so that crops can be available when external supplies are dwindling and becoming more costly.  Our drip irrigation takes this to the next level as it can be kept operating even when the quality of the feed water is deteriorating for example, due to a drop in the water table.

Why Kenya?



Kenya is where we plan to establish ourselves first, and supply drip kits throughout East Africa.

In readiness we have set up our new company Liquid Lever (Kenya) Ltd in Nairobi and our new staff will be encouraged to be outgoing and outward thinking. We have an open door policy Monday to Friday and will encourage people from Africa and overseas to visit the factory and spread the word about our products and our continuing story of the people who make them.

We can ship our finished mouldings (connectors) from Felixstowe docks in the UK to Mombasa sea port and by lorry on to Nairobi.


Similarly our polymers to make Hoses and Liquid Lever Kink Valves can follow the same route.  The sea journey is 38 days.


For us this is the best option at this time as; (a) we love the people, (b) we love the country, (c) many people are multi-lingual (d) the commercial and legal systems are similar to ours, (e) the African Headquarters of the UN is based in Nairobi and many of the well-known NGO’s have country offices and field staff there.  This is important as a portion of our work is geared towards providing drip kits at subsidised cost to remote communities through DFID and USAID funded initiatives. 


However that said, we keep receiving enquiries for our drip kit technology from people in other sub-Saharan countries and Southern Africa and West Africa. So it could be that our Kenya operation will quickly reveal the perfect framework for us to repeat it in other regions of Africa.  Keeping the costs down and helping us to reach as wide an audience as possible.  


We are building good relations with a number of local manufacturers, distributors and commercial organisations which see us as adding value to their own enterprise as our products are complementary.

We have chosen Kenya as our starting point but already have enquiries to establish manufacturing elsewhere in Africa. Family needs are the same wherever you go - people need to grow more food.





Will this project help
the environment if it is widely adopted?

Yes – in any arid and
remote location the benefits are twofold:




Converting barren land to productive land with
mixed plant species e.g., trees, shrubs, vines and salad crops creates micro habitats for
all kinds of flora and fauna.


Displacement pumping irrigation water for community projects instead of
pressure pumping saves approx. 85% of the energy normally associated with
conventional drip irrigation. 






I have other questions that aren’t shown here – where do I go?



Please add your questions on the comments section of this campaign or by email to info@liquidlever.com


You may also find the answer that you are looking for on our websites: www.liquidlever.com www.tankfedirrigation.com & www.growmorefood.org .

story:
Banshee Brewing Company is the dream of home brewer Nicholas Wise:  That's me!  The purpose of this crowd-funding campaign is to make that dream a reality, to turn a hobby into a career. This money will bring hand-made, craft beer to the greater Los Angeles area.

You can make this possible.

I've been brewing beer for fifteen years.  The desire to create Banshee came from my passion for great beer.  A little over six years ago I came up with a plan to start my own brewery. About three years ago, I decided to turn that dream into a reality.

Banshee Brewing is a small brewery that produces handcrafted beers.  We will provide a variety of beers to satisfy many tastes, with flavors ranging from traditional to the exotic. 

Banshee will continue to provide, a place to build community around beer. It is a place for people to congregate and share ideas and their passion for the things they love. No matter what your passion, you are welcome here. My passion is beer.  My dreams and goals are to make beer the vehicle for others to explore themselves. 

My regular tap list includes 'Wicked' a dark spiced Stout with flavors of orange, ginger, honey, cinnamon, and vanilla.  'Bramble' a blackberry honey infused Hefeweizen. 'Grandpa Grunt' a honey and Szechuan peppercorn IPA and 'Screaming Red' a red ale flavored with serrano peppers.  'The Impaler' is our seasonal hard cider made from 100% fresh pressed local organic apples, with hints of cinnamon, and brown sugar. Specialty and additional seasonal brews will also be crafted once the business is up and running.  In addition, specialty "house", beers, designed, and brewed by guests will be labeled for local taverns.

I wish I could serve you, as you sit there reading this, a pint; fill a growler for you.  My experience has been those that enjoy a pint of Banshee beer are pretty quick to join the family. If only the internet were capable....

What We Need & What You Get

To make this dream a reality we need to become a commercial brewery. The costs have outstripped my paycheck. We need to be able to produce larger amounts than the 10-gallon batches we make now.

Specifically, we need:

  • A brick and mortar location
  • Build out of brick and mortar location
  • Commercial brewing equipment
  • Permits: from the county, from the state liquor board, and from the federal government.

The $100,000 goal for this campaign will cover the list. 

For your pledge you will receive some pretty sweet Banshee swag.  Starting at a *$10 pledge you will receive a Banshee sticker. At *$25 we'll add a Koozie to the mix.  For *$50 you get a Banshee t-shirt in the size of your choice. Jump to *$100 and you get a pint glass with logo.  *$250 will get you forever immortalized in the tasting room with your name branded onto the wall of donors.  *$350 gets you an invite to the Grand Opening celebration in August 2016 and a collectable coin with the Banshee logo and seal. *$500 or more level you will receive a soft-sided cooler to keep all your favorite Banshee brews at their perfect tasting temperature. *$750 you will receive a Banshee Brewing Company pitcher and a set of 4 pint glasses.  *$1,500 We will let the lucky donator be an ASSISTANT BREWER – Come to the brewery and see firsthand how it's done. If you are unable to come to the brewery due to your location, we will substitute a Beginning Homebrew Kit and Beer Recipe Kit to get you started on brewing your own beer. *$3,000 you will create and name a seasonal brew (of your preference, subject to final governmental label approval and owner approval) If it turns out to be a crowd pleaser, we'll add it to our permanent list of seasonal releases and live on in immortality each year we brew it! *$5,000 This is the top of the line, ultimate private party at Banshee Brewing Company's Brewery & Taphouse. Includes a private party for up to 24 people, Unlimited Banshee drinks, Hors d'oeuvres and a tour of the brewery. Plus, take home a Banshee pint glass for each of your guests. (All perks are cumulative. You get the stuff from your contribution level, as well as everything below it.)

 

Risks & Challenges

The beer industry is a highly regulated industry. We must obtain numerous permits, licenses. and secure a location. This, of course, means that we are working with the government, and are at their mercy/time frame. Banshee Brewing Company has already begun the permitting process; however, unforeseen events in dealing with the government and renovations could slow our estimated timeline.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that cash isn't the only way to get where we are going; if you have any skills and extra time on your hands, we'd love to know how you may be able to help us in other ways around the brewery.  Every day there's something new going in or up and we pay handsomely in beer and pizza should you want to get your hands dirty with us!

You can also help by getting the word out about our campaign to your friends, colleagues and loved ones via social media platforms.  If everyone is able to share this campaign with just a few people, we feel confident that we can reach many, many people that may be interested in donating to the cause.

Any and all support is invaluable for our effort.

Thanks for reading, we look forward to seeing you at the brewery you helped build very soon!

story:
What makes FOXHOLE HOMES Different? Top 10 List

1.   It is a “Housing First” model, yet it is not a handout.  Veterans get a home of their own through a community of veterans that support one another.

2.  It is financially sustainable, because “Earthships” have near zero utility cost; even someone with no income can afford the month to month operational costs of the home.  In fact, if you use the grey water system to grow food, the net “cost” is actually positive.

3.  It is ecologically sustainable.  The majority of the materials in the home are repurposed items that would have been treated as trash.  This includes old tires, cardboard, bottles and cans.

4.  It is financially sustainable, because it will have rental units that can “recycle” government travel expenses from the local military base into the overhead capital for services inside the community.

5.  On-site health care providers focus on wellness, rather than palliative care.

6.  The veterans continue to serve.  This is a research community working on technology to help solve some of the world’s most pressing problems to include food, water, and shelter for those who are most in need.

7.  The model is replicable.  The community concept can be replicated near any military installation.

8.  Foxhole will foster healing to both veterans and the land through Regenerative Agriculture, this will provide  vets an opportunity to grow themselves financially, nutritionally and emotionally.   It is meaningful work that takes into account “bad days”.

9.  Once fully established the community becomes self-sufficient, generating all of the funds needed for its ongoing operation.

10.  Living in an “Earthship” forces you to be mindful of your environment and interact with it.  If you do, the home actually takes care of you rather than the other way around.  This allows even the mundane aspects of life to be filled with meaning, and allows fundamental self-sufficiency.

What we need

$500,000 will enable Foxhole to…

It will enable Foxhole to fully Develop its first “Sustainable Development Testing Site”  to include 6 Earthship inspired buildings:  Two tiny houses, a flat, a one bedroom, a two bedroom and community center.  All of this will be surrounded by a Food System designed to regenerate the land and provide long term food stability and work for veterans.

It will enable us to acquire the construction equipment we need to build for the long term. By purchasing gov’t surplus equipment we can get heavy equipment and other critical supplies at a drastically discounted rate.  We will need a Backhoe, Dump Truck, Trailers, Excavator, Roller, Water Truck, and Grader.  We will also be able to Purchase the many smaller tools needed in the construction of the homes.

It will enable us to take next steps in acquiring the land and water rights for the eventual development of our larger research community that will take care of up to 60 Veteran families, and provide long term educational programs to replicate the process elsewhere.

Impact

Bottom line this will provide  proof of concept with Homes for 6 veterans and their families and a fully functioning construction company dedicated to building affordable sustainable community for veterans to support one another.  For the long term we should be able to build a fully functioning home for a single veteran for as little as $10,000 in material costs.

Risks and Challenges

Let me start by saying the support from our community and government officials has been overwhelming.  That being said, this Sustainable development Testing Site will be a first for our region.  And while Earthships are well proven, some of the adaptations we will be testing will require some experimentation, to allow us to build more efficiently and economically.

Other ways to help

Like us on Facebook and share with your Friends!

Volunteer to build! Check out current opportunities on our facebook page.

One of our greatest needs is finding the right partners for legal advice, accounting, marketing, and engineering validation.

10. 
Living
in an “Earthship” forces you to be mindful of your environment and interact
with it.  If you do, the home actually
takes care of you rather than the
other way around.  This allows even the
mundane aspects of life to be filled with meaning, and allows fundamental
self-sufficiency.
What we need 
$500,000 will
enable Foxhole to…
It will
enable Foxhole to fully Develop its first “Sustainable Development Testing Site”  to include 6 Earthship inspired
buildings:  Two tiny houses, a flat, a
one bedroom, a two bedroom and community center.  All of this will be surrounded by a Food
System designed to regenerate the land and provide long term food stability and
work for veterans.
It will
enable us to acquire the construction equipment we need to build for the long
term. By purchasing gov’t surplus equipment we can get heavy equipment and
other critical supplies at a drastically discounted rate.  We will need a Backhoe, Dump Truck, Trailers,
Excavator, Roller, Water Truck, and Grader.  We will also be able to Purchase the many
smaller tools needed in the construction of the homes.
It will
enable us to take next steps in acquiring the land and water rights for the
eventual development of our larger research community that will take care of up
to 60 Veteran families, and provide long term educational programs to replicate
the process elsewhere.
Impact
Bottom line
this will provide  proof of concept with Homes
for 6 veterans and their families and a fully functioning construction company
dedicated to building affordable sustainable community for veterans to support
one another.  For the long term we should
be able to build a fully functioning home for a single veteran for as little as
$10,000 in material costs.
Risks and Challenges
Let me
start by saying the support from our community and government officials has
been overwhelming.  That being said, this
Sustainable development Testing Site will be a first for our region.  And while Earthships are well proven, some of
the adaptations we will be testing will require some experimentation, to allow
us to build more efficiently and economically.
Other ways to helpLike us on Facebook and share with your Friends!
Volunteer
to build! Check out current opportunities on our facebook page.
One of our
greatest needs is finding the right partners for legal advice, accounting, marketing,
and engineering validation.

story: We are starting our second juice bar in Orem Utah and hope to have it open next Wednesday.  At the new juice bar we are purchasing the X-1 juicer.  This is a single layer cold-press juicer capable of producing over a thousand 16 oz (500 ml) bottles of juice per day (40 gallons of juice an hour).  This would allow for the production of the highest quality of juice for all of our consumers.  We need help in purchasing this juicer, any contribution helps and matters.  We are also having party to celebrate our new location and your support!  If you contribute in anyway we would like to invite you as our guest.  Saturday October 17 at 6pm!  There will be live music, free samples, giveaways, and more.  Thank you so much.  We love you all!

story:
Polyamory Edmonton Association

Providing social support and information to
Edmonton’s Poly Community


What does Polyamory Edmonton Association do?

We hold regular social meetings, events, and workshops to help build community and provide support to those who identify as polyamorus


We are inclusive and welcoming to all LGBTQ persons and all forms of responsible, non-monogamy


More information is available on our Facebook group page or by emailing polyamoryedmontonassociation@gmail.com


We are fundraising to finish our website, get registered as a Non-profit group, and to continue to host monthly meet ups and information sessions on various topics that are of interest to the poly community. 

We need your support to continue with these projects.  If you are interested in attending meet-ups and discussion groups, please consider making a small donation to ensure that we can continue to organize them.

Our last successful fundraiser allowed us to start the process of becoming a non-profit group, have a booth at the 2015 Pride Festival, and rent space for several different discussion groups over this past year.  


We have more work to do!

Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Anna Kennedy, author of Business Development for Dummies and he's Jeff Cohen a successful entrepreneur, playing the role of "dummy" and a not-so-funny comedian. 

 Check out our video to find out about us and our campaign.
We have a passion for making a difference for small businesses - in the USA alone, there are 29 million small businesses and 55% of the jobs. They're the bedrock of our economy - and the word economy. When small businesses fail, it's a real loss of future jobs and growth for all of us.

What's the solution? 

We're out to shift the world economy and you can help. We need to get businesses that are stuck, unstuck, so we're developing:

It helps businesses figure out:
  • WHY they're in business
  • WHY they're stuck
  • WHAT'S MISSING that has them stuck
  • HOW to fill those gaps and then...
  • ROADMAP their way to a profitable new business that gives them...

INSPIRATION and SATISFACTION

What's the program? 

PLAN-FOR-PROFIT is a Masterclass/Self-Study/Coaching program that delivers a way out of the mire for small business owners in 42-days.

What We Need 

We're trying to raise $15,000 to

  • Offer the BETA program at a very affordable price.
  • Finish developing the self-study materials
  • Hire a designer to make the materials look good
  • Invest in the systems to deliver the best experiences
  • Train our coaches in the program

What You Get

For you, it's an opportunity to:

  • Make a real difference for small businesses that CAN make it. If you're already successful, extend a helping hand for a fun reward, or sponsor a program or nominate a friend.
  • Join the BETA program in Dec 2015 to kick your 2016 into high gear. There are 3 levels of participation  (“The Do-It-Yourselfer”, “The Questioner”, “The Full Monty”) that you can be part of. Access great coaches to help you plan for your profit. See our video with an extract from the Private Workshop.
  • Even sign up to our coach training program and become part of our growth.
Take a quick your of what it's all about:

See our rewards panel for all the exciting perks.

With partial funding, our priorities will be:

  • Finishing the materials
  • Training our coaches

That will definitely give us a jump start.

The Impact

Thousands and millions of people create small business to get out of that grim cubicle or unsatisfying job. Many of them want to make a difference in the world with what they have to offer.

Your contribution  could be the difference between a small business owner shutting up shop OR turning things around. Help them get the bounce back in their step. Maybe that's even you!

For 5 years, we've been helping small businesses grow into profit, but we want to go wider and help a lot more people. That's why we created PLAN-FOR-PROFIT.

Take a peek into our FREE Workshop that shares some tips with business oweners on how to Plan-for-Profit:


Risks & Challenges

Our challenge is time - not enough of it.  

  • We WILL run the program in December, but we need some hands on deck to help get ready so it can be a roaring success.
  • It's definitely not the first time we're overcome challenges and we have great reference clients.
  • We have the credentials to take this on.
You might be asking, why the focus on PROFIT? It's really simple - profit makes many things possible that aren't possible if you're losing money. Including fulfilling on the dream you had when you started your business.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help:

  • Maybe there's a small business owner you know who'd be interested in the program and would want to jump right in. Ask them to back us - they get a much better deal that way.
  • Share this campaign with your associates.
  • Or with other contacts who might sponsor someone or enjoy our other rewards.

Thanks!

Anna and Jeff

story:
Quality, affordable rental housing for middle to poor working families and individuals.

                                                                      

 The proportion of household budget that goes towards paying for housing plus transportation has risen dramatically over the last decade, leaving less money left over for other necessities.  Many folks are just not able to purchase a home or may not desire to own a home.  Our goal is to provide affordable rent homes that are nice, with modern upgrades.  Why should rental homes be old and outdated.  We want to provide homes with upgraded wiring, plumbing, flooring, and modern bath, kitchen features and appliances at an affordable rate.  

We are dedicated to help people feel better, get better and do better

   During a time of rising housing costs and shrinking incomes, affordable modern upgraded rental homes help to increase confidence, pride and life satisfaction. Preservation and modernizing existing homes positively impacts and helps to revitalize and stabilize neighborhoods, individual households, and the community. More economical than new construction, preservation also reuses buildings, takes advantage of existing public infrastructure, conserves green space, and reduces utility costs and greenhouse gas emissions.  


Affordable housing can help to increase the amount that families can put toward other important household needs and savings for the future. It can also contribute to increases in local purchasing power, neighborhood vitality and improved overall neighborhood quality.

Quality affordable housing can help to create stable a environment for children by reducing frequent family moves and contribute to improved educational outcomes. Frequently changing homes can have a negative effect on school performance, which could contribute to a long lasting achievement gap.  


Access to quality affordable housing can provide critical stability, and lower the risks to vulnerable families. 

Quality affordable housing can improve health by providing stability, freeing up resources for food and health care. 

Updated housing can have a positive effect on surrounding property values. 

Quality affordable housing may foster improved mental and physical health, quality of life and increase independence.

Quality affordable housing may promote better mental and physical health, improved quality of life and independence for low-income seniors.

High-cost housing may leave low-income families with little money left over, which may force them to make difficult budget trade-offs that can lead to serious negative consequences.  Affordable housing may help increase the discretionary income that low-income families have available to meet important family needs or save for the future.


  Please help us with our campaign to Provide quality affordable Rent Homes.  Your contribution or purchase will help us to get started.  The more you can help us, the more impact we can have.

                                                                                                                                               All products will be shipped to United states address only.  Our international friends may donate by contribution of a dollar amount.    

Thank you for your time and possibly your purchase, and once again, thank you SwampCart.com for processing the orders.   Your help is hugely appreciated!

Our Deepest appreciation goes out to you all!

                                                                      



Thank you for your time and possibly your contribution, and once again, thank you SwampCart.com for processing the orders.   Your help is hugely appreciated!

Our Deepest appreciation goes out to you all!



our partner

 www.SwampCart.com                                      

References:

Enterprise Community Partners 

U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development
