story:
'FromYou' Not for Profit

"Bringing Donators and Charities together" 

FromYou is a App based Point to Point Not for Profit service, based in Perth, Western Australia. We aim to make donating easier, to increase donations and bring donating to charities to a technologically savvy way where things are done by the touch of a finger! 

I see every day, charities like the Salvation army and Good Sammy’s being abused and bombarded with people dumping their trash and other unused goods where they are unable to be used or sold. It is estimated to cost over $200,000 Australian dollars every year, for every charity to clean up this mess. What a waste of money! I want that money, those resources and that energy to be dedicated to going to the charities true purpose, helping those in need! 

This is imposing huge costs to the charities, and the current “Charity bin” system in Australia looses over 40% of donations because people put their personal waste into the bins. That is 40% of clothing that could have been donated to some of the 100,000 homeless people currently in Australia. 

FromYou is a Point to Point service, that allows busy people who normally don't get the time to donate or don’t know how to donate, to be able to donate their clothes through an interactive app based program. The service includes a personalised pick up from their home and then be able to track the progress of their donation to the charity of their donation. They will also have the opportunity to donate for the service ranging from either $1 or $100 and all the proceeds will also go to charity! The entire service is designed to make donating seamless and easy for people who live face paced lifestyles.  

Our goal: 

Is to improve the way people donate and make donating easier for the donator and charities, to overall help those who are most in need in our immediate and wider communities. 


Were aiming to raise $20,000, Why?? 

Your contributions will go to developing the foundations to our organisations, every penny will be used to develop the necessary pillars to make an organisations like this work particularly; 

building an interactive useful app to make the donations easy 

Find drivers who are ready and prepared to pick up and drop off the goods 

Raising awareness of the issue and to get people in Perth to start donating

Developing and incorporating FromYou into the community 


Taking a sneak peak at your perks! 

Not only will you feel great knowing your donation is going to a good cause, you will receive for donating; 

$1 a personalised Thank you note from us showing you just how grateful even the smallest contribution counts.

$5 FromYou Wristband, receive a wristband to wear out and about and a Thank you letter from us! 

$25 FromYou Tote bag, the perfect tote bag for all your grocery needs. This tote bag is our gift to you because your awesome for donating to our cause! 

$50 FromYou T-shirt, this personalised T-shirt will get people talking and you looking like a hero! Because to us, you are our hero! Thanks for the donation and we hope you enjoy your T-shirt! 

$150 FromYou GiftPack, this includes a the T-shirt, tote bag, wristband, a thank you note and another surprise gift for your incredible contribution! Thank you! 

$500 Feature on our app! Wow, your contribution is incredible! To show just how much we appreciate your donation we will feature you on our app, send us your photo and a little about yourself and become apart of our interactive app! 

You will also receive the FromYou gift pack!



Your contributions are essential to kick starting this program! We require funds to help market and promote this campaign and get people talking about FromYou, help us make FromYou known! 


Looking beyond Perth… 

- We hope that within the next 3 years to have expanded nationally into all other major Australian cities

- Set up permanent distribution channels and allocation factories 

- & to exponentially increase the number of donations Australia wide 


A bit about me....  

Hey! I'm Stephanie, a 20year old University student from Perth, Western Australia. I have seen a problem while working and living in the community and want to make a positive change for the future of my city and those who live and enjoy this beautiful country. The idea for FromYou first came about while I was volunteering at the Salvation Army and I noticed the sheer pressure and overbearing nature that some of the donations have on the people that work there. With the help of my supporters and the tools at University I have been able to put into practice my dream. 

Please help us create the noise we desire by following us on Facebook and Instagram! 

Get people talking about FromYou and track our journey via social media! 

Watch our video above and we will continue to tell you about all the great things our charity does ^^^^

Instagram: Fromyou.notforprofit

www.fromyou.org

#Fromyou and get talking!

story:
ENGLISH
PORTUGUESE
ITALIANO

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Short Summary

We are the Boavista Official Group (from Humana Skala company) and we promote the official brand of the island, but in this case we are just some people who love this island and their inhabitants.

After the passage of hurricane FRED (31 ago 2015), every person on the island was damaged directly or indirectly. Many people have lost their homes or their job opportunity.

What We Need

The authorities of Bovista and national authorities of Cape Verde were not prepared in a similar event as the archipelago is not a place of hurricanes.

Although there were no victims, we believe that this wonderful island need your help.

If you've been here, you will have noticed the simplicity of these people and we ask ourselves this question: they deserve our help?

$ 400,000 are not the full costs they will face to rebuild, but it's a start in which you can put back the pre-hurricane conditions.

Boavista, the wonderful island, it needs the support of all.

The Impact

If every tourist who visited Boavista last year donates $10, we may collect 3 million in a few days. You can pay with your Credit Card, Bank Account or Paypal.
We work closely with the local authorities and national and we turn especially to:

- All tourists have visited Boavista

- All Cape Verdean citizens who can help

- All the authorities of the countries linked to Cape Verde

- All people who care about the future of this little paradise

Risks & Challenges

To evaluate the seriousness of the campaign, you can visit the website of the Municipality of Boavista (www.municipiodaboavista.cv) and verify its reliability.

Also, you can visit the official website of the island (www.boavistaofficial.com) and have further feedback or check this magazine ASEMANA (http://asemana.sapo.cv/spip.php?article112722&a...)

One difficult side of the fundraising regards the final destination of the money raised: within 2 months will be listed on the official websites and on FB all the works to which to allocate the funds.

Search for "BoavistaOfficial" on FB and follow the campaign day by day.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not give anything, you can still help out by sharing this Facebook campaign and encouraging your friends to make a difference.

On behalf of the population of Boavista, thanks and we hope you will find an island more beautiful than it was before.


Boavista Official Group - Humana Skala - Camara Municipal da Boavista

------------------------------------------------------------------------
Resumo

Após a passagem da tempestade tropical FRED (31 agosto 2015), a ilha da Boa Vista, em muitas localidades diretamente e indiretamente, ficou danificada. Muitas pessoas tiveram suas casas destruídas e, estruturas históricas na ilha foram destruídas.

O grupo Boavista Official (empresa Humana Skala) que é o Grupo que promove a imagem oficial da ilha da Boa Vista juntamente com algumas pessoas que amam essa ilha, criaram esta Campanha de fundraising com o objectivo de angariação de fundos para ajudar com os danos causados pelo FRED.

O que nós precisamos

Por não haver episodios climáticos similares, as autoridades locais e centrais municipais e nacionais não detêm de estratégias proativas e reativas para situações do género.

O objectivo da Campanha é posicionado em $ 400,000 USD (quatrocentos mil dolares). Mas este valor não é a totalidade dos custos que serão necessários para reconstruir a ilha mas, é significativo para trazer de volta a fantástica paisagem boavistense pré-furacão.

Embora não houve vítimas fatais, esta maravilhosa ilha precisa de Ajuda!

O Impacto

Se cada turista que visitou a Boa Vista, no ano passado, doasse $10 USD, poderíamos arrecadar 3 milhões em poucos dias.

A Ajuda pode ser efectuada através de Cartão de Crédito, Conta Bancária ou Paypal.

Pretendemos envolver:

- Todos os turistas que já visitaram a Boa Vista;

- Todos os cidadãos cabo-verdianos;

- Todas as autoridades dos países ligados a Cabo Verde;

- Todas as pessoas que se preocupam com o futuro deste pequeno paraíso.

Riscos e Desafios

Informações sobre a Campanha, estarão disponíveis no site da Câmara Municipal da Boavista (www.municipiodaboavista.cv) e no site oficial da Ilha (www.boavistaofficial.com).

Siga o dia-a-dia, da Campanha, nas páginas do Facebook: “CamaraMunicipalDaBoavista” e “BoavistaOfficial"

Um lado difícil de uma Campanha de angariação de fundos é o destino final do valor arrecadado.

Num período de 2 meses, será publicado nos sites e páginas do Facebook, acima citados, todas as Obras que serão abrangidas pelo fundo arrecadado.

Outras maneiras de ajudar

Compartilhe esta Campanha no seu Facebook e incentive os seus amigos a fazer a diferença.

Em nome da Ilha da Boavista, obrigado!


Boavista Official Group - Humana Skala - Camara Municipal da Boavista

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Breve riepilogo

Noi siamo il gruppo Boavista Official (parte della società Humana Skala) e promuoviamo l'immagine ufficiale dell'isola, ma in questo caso siamo solo alcune persone che amano quest'isola e i suoi abitanti.

Dopo il passaggio dell'uragano FRED (31 Agosto 2015), ogni persona sull'isola è stata danneggiata direttamente o indirettamente. Molte persone hanno perso la casa e la loro opportunità di lavoro.

Quello che ci serve

Le autorità comunali e nazionali non erano preparate a un evento simile perchè l'arcipelago non è abitualmente un luogo di uragani (l'ultimo risale al 1892).

Anche se non ci sono state vittime, crediamo che questa meravigliosa isola abbia bisogno del nostro aiuto.

Se siete stati qui, avrete notato la semplicità di queste persone e vogliamo porci questa domanda: si meritano il nostro aiuto?

$ 400,000 non sono la totalità dei costi che dovranno affrontare per la ricostruzione, ma è un inizio con cui si possono ritrovare le condizioni pre-uragano.

Boavista, l'isola meravigliosa, ha bisogno del sostegno di tutti.

L'Impatto

Se ogni turista che ha visitato Boavista lo scorso anno donasse $10, potremmo raccogliere 3 milioni in pochi giorni. Si può donare con carta di credito, conto bancario o Paypal.

Lavoriamo a stretto contatto con le autorità locali e nazionali e ci rivolgiamo in particolare a:

- Tutti i turisti hanno visitato Boavista

- Tutti i cittadini di Capo Verde che possono aiutare

- Tutte le autorità dei paesi legati a Capo Verde

- Tutte le persone che hanno a cuore il futuro di questo piccolo paradiso

Rischi e Sfide

Per valutare l'importanza della campagna, è possibile visitare il sito web del Comune di Boavista (www.municipiodaboavista.cv) e verificare la sua affidabilità.

Inoltre, è possibile visitare il sito ufficiale dell'isola (www.boavistaofficial.com) e avere un'ulteriore conferma o controllare le notizie sul giornale locale ASEMANA (http://asemana.sapo.cv/spip.php?article112722&a...)

Il lato difficile della campagna di raccolta fondi riguarda la destinazione finale dei soldi raccolti: entro 2 mesi saranno elencate sui siti ufficiali e su FB tutte le opere a cui verranno destinati i fondi.

Cerca "BoavistaOfficial" su FB e segui la campagna di giorno in giorno.

Altri modi in cui si può aiutare

Se non si può dare nulla, è possibile aiutare condividendo questa campagna su Facebook e incoraggiare i tuoi amici a fare la differenza.

A nome della popolazione di Boavista, grazie e speriamo di farvi trovare un'isola più bello di quanto non fosse prima.


Boavista Official Group - Humana Skala - Camara Municipal da Boavista
story_txt:
ENGLISHPORTUGUESEITALIANO
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Short Summary
We are the Boavista Official Group (from Humana Skala company) and we promote the official brand of the island, but in this case we are just some people who love this island and their inhabitants.
After the passage of hurricane FRED (31 ago 2015), every person on the island was damaged directly or indirectly. Many people have lost their homes or their job opportunity.   What We Need 
The authorities of Bovista and national authorities of Cape Verde were not prepared in a similar event as the archipelago is not a place of hurricanes.
Although there were no victims, we believe that this wonderful island need your help.
If you've been here, you will have noticed the simplicity of these people and we ask ourselves this question: they deserve our help?
$ 400,000 are not the full costs they will face to rebuild, but it's a start in which you can put back the pre-hurricane conditions.
Boavista, the wonderful island, it needs the support of all.   The Impact 
If every tourist who visited Boavista last year donates $10, we may collect 3 million in a few days. You can pay with your Credit Card, Bank Account or Paypal.We work closely with the local authorities and national and we turn especially to:
- All tourists have visited Boavista
- All Cape Verdean citizens who can help
- All the authorities of the countries linked to Cape Verde
- All people who care about the future of this little paradise   Risks & Challenges  
To evaluate the seriousness of the campaign, you can visit the website of the Municipality of Boavista (www.municipiodaboavista.cv) and verify its reliability.
Also, you can visit the official website of the island (www.boavistaofficial.com) and have further feedback or check this magazine ASEMANA (http://asemana.sapo.cv/spip.php?article112722&a...)
One difficult side of the fundraising regards the final destination of the money raised: within 2 months will be listed on the official websites and on FB all the works to which to allocate the funds.
Search for "BoavistaOfficial" on FB and follow the campaign day by day.   Other Ways You Can Help 
If you can not give anything, you can still help out by sharing this Facebook campaign and encouraging your friends to make a difference.On behalf of the population of Boavista, thanks and we hope you will find an island more beautiful than it was before.Boavista Official Group - Humana Skala - Camara Municipal da Boavista------------------------------------------------------------------------ResumoApós a passagem da

story:
Sollet Soft Solutions Pvt Ltd, a Hyderabad, India based innovative company currently extending Social Commerce & Social Inclusion through it's B2B(Agent network) and B2C(www.peponz.com) spaces. We want to expand our internally developed IM, sBuzz(www.solletbuzz.com) enabled through our B2B & B2C spaces whereby Small & Micro Service Providers like Electricians, Plumbers, Carpenters etc get hooked/subscribe and get more businesses just by installing sBuzz on their Mobiles. Our approach is very unique and accessible to all educated and uneducated through their mobiles having immense potential of penetration. This will bring in a unique and disruptive model helping the under served & unexplored socieites across Rural & Urban India. Once it is implemented in India, we will have plans to take it to other developing countries.

Sollet's sBuzz product is already in the market but now will be enabled for Small & Micro Service Providers to subscribe with very low costs through Sollet's planned 100,000 Agent network across India and through Sollet's B2C portal www.peponz.com

This initiative has immense potential in bringing a very low cost organized approach for Service Providers wherein end Customers having sBuzz on their mobile can reach the Service Providers having sBuzz on their mobiles. This will bring in a greater social impact involving a very big Eco systems having all stake holders in it.

Potentially empowering millions of Service Providers across India in serving hundred of millions of end Customers across all demographics.

You can see details about us @ www.solletsoft.com www.sollet.co.in www.solletbuzz.com and www.peponz.com

Please make a wish to Sollet and your contribution and spread of this initiative in your circle will immensely help and empower Sollet to bring in major social impact. Sollet will be able to take this initiative to other developing countries thereafter.

Thank you for your valuable contributions and interest shown in reading this initiative.

story:
Who hasn't dreamt of pedaling slowly down the road while having a few drinks with friends as you hop from one bar to the next?  Okay, maybe only like a few people have really dreamt that.  But I'm one of those people, and I hope you are too!

The Party Bike trend is heating up all over the world and I want to bring this green industry to the Bay Area! (Can you believe they don't already have these bikes AT LEAST in Berkeley?)  It really is a fiesta on wheels! This is a great outing for bachelorette/ bachelor parties, birthday parties, corporate parties, party parties, and meeting new people parties!  See what I mean?  Andrew W.K. would eat this thing up!


*this guy knows about partying. (just a music video)


The Bike

Party Bike seats 15 with 12 pedaling and one driving (that's me!). There will be speakers so you can rock your own party music, a small television so as to watch the big game, or cartoons, or really anything...it's a TV, and even a tap for, you know, soda and such. ;-) The bikes alone are very expensive ($50,000+) before we factor in the trailer and insurance, so in order to start the pedals turning (totally intended) I'm reaching out to all of you to be my chain (again).  Sure my fundraising goal is high, but if I shoot for the Moon and hit the International Space Station, well, free astronaut ice cream, right?


*may be served on Party Bike


About Me
I'm a first-time entrepreneur who wants to offer a unique, zero-carbon, fun-filled, character-friendly attraction to the Bay Area in California.  I'm a teacher, so funds do not come easily to me and since the bike would be rented in the evenings I would likely continue teaching and run the business at the same time, perhaps incorporating it into my lesson plans.  I believe that the main purpose in life is to live well and enjoy yourself, so this sort of business jibes with my ideology.  Oh yeah, I also have a pretty sweet beard that feels like velvet when I cut it short, but I am going to grow it out until I reach my goal (and I will post regular pictures).  Please don't make me turn into Grizzly Adams!

*because Grizzly doesn't party.


How will we serve others?
While our business pales in comparison to more important and life-changing fundraisers such as medical needs or charities, it is my intention to "pay it forward" by donating 10% of annual profits to charitable causes such as the Cancer Research Institute (www.cancerresearch.org), in honor of my late mother, once we are up and pedaling.  Further, as we expand, I plan on hiring young adults and college students from the neighborhood to fill a number of positions and give them a sense of worth and community pride. 

*That's me in the hat hangin' with my party people.


If you've seen or ridden a Party Bike in other cities and understand how much fun they are, please consider floating us a few bucks to bring one to the Bay Area!

*contributors, not investors


Thank you for your time and anticipated donation!  Please don't forget to share our campaign on your favorite social media!

story:
Support for the Baumhocker Ohana

We are a new family beginning our first big leap into parenthood! (WOAH!) That being said, we're learning to ask for help in everything that goes into welcoming a new being into this world! 

Our History: 

Tom and Jordan (That's us) will celebrate their one year anniversary with a freshly born child. Our first kiss was shared on Thanksgiving at the end of a rainbow and that's the truth. If you do the math, it didn't take the universe a long time to bestow us with the news that we had reproduced, but luckily, we had been on the same page when it came to being parents: HOW FLIPPING COOL/TERRIFYING!!! We've been juggling our personal work, learning to get along, communicate, love each other unconditionally, wrapping our minds around parenting, stepping up to the challenge and doing a pretty good job. (Can we get a witness?!) 

We're asking for around $6,000 to set our family up on this final sprint before the baby gets here. (End of October/Early November) Our funding needs include: 

  • $3,300 for the birth itself (our midwife is one of the best on the island) 
  • $1,400 takes care of the cost of our Maternity and Paternity leave for one month.  
  • $1,300 can break down like this:
    - A Washer and Dryer for our home
    - Any additional baby things that we have to buy outright. (We're thrifty and the rate of hand-me-downs on Maui is pretty good)
    - Possible nest egg to save for a second car (One that has temperature control and a smoother ride. Something newer than a 91 Subaru Loyale Station Wagon, perhaps?)

The perks of donating to our family are: 

  • $10 donation - You'll be on our mailing list for our family Christmas card and we'll personally say "Thank you!" via some form of social media! 
  • $20 donation - You'll receive a bundle of hot dog postcards designed by the infamous Thomas Baum and a spot on our Christmas Card mailing list!
  • $50 donation - Your choice of either a framed custom typewritten piece of poetry written by Jordan Ashley Hocker OR a framed piece of hot-dog themed artwork made by Thomas Baum 
  • $100 donation - You'll receive all of the above mentioned perks AND a handwritten "Thank you" note from our child
  • $500 donation - Tom and Jordan will write a rap song about YOU and film a music video for said song here on Maui. 
  • $1000 donation - We will dress our child up as your favorite animal and film an education nature documentary for you. (All manner of beasts, insects, mythical creatures encouraged)
  • Donations over $1000 - You'll get everything offered above and Jordan will probably cry. (She does that a lot)

Why your support matters 

Well to put it frankly, we couldn't do it without you. Your support is just another piece of the puzzle that makes life so rich! We want to instill that type of belief into the children we are bringing into this world. The next generation is tasked with one heck of a world and why not teach by example that anything is possible? That you don't have to sacrifice who you are to live in this world. It might be cheesy, but unfailing optimism never seems to fail, does it? 

You can support us by sharing this campaign, even if you yourself cannot give to it. We also have a plain ole' baby registry via Amazon. Just go to this web address: https://www.amazon.com/baby-reg/homepage and search "Jordan Hocker"

Thanks for reading and considering our family!

story:
Hydra Beer Company is looking to raise $25,000 to help build a Taphouse & Brewery in Sioux Falls, South Dakota. 

THE HYDRA STORY
How did we get to this point?

Hydra Beer Company began over two years ago when owners Chad Petit and Nick Murphy started planning the concept, vision and direction. We knew we would have to approach the launch of Hydra much different than the conventional method. We had many of the fundamental foundation pieces to the company in place; solid vision, incredible branding, unique direction and previous success in entrepreneurial ventures. Only one thing was missing...funds.

Coming from the grassroots DIY music scene, Nick and Chad were very accustomed to building from nothing and using whatever means to do so. As opposed to letting this hold us back, we explored an alternative method and used it to it's potential. We searched out one of the top breweries in the Midwest and worked with them to refine our recipes to large batch and went directly into packaging and retail distribution. This is something most beer companies attempt after establishing their brewery, taproom and brand. We pushed our products hard locally, hit the the regional craft beer events, handed out a million samples and gained incredible support from beer lovers throughout the region.

Hydra offers something unique, image and beer that the craft beer circle can respect and love as well as be relatable to those outside the circle. We take an incredibly aggressive approach in image, branding, appearance and attitude that sets us apart, keep us honest and true, and puts Hydra on a level that welcomes in beer lovers from all backgrounds. 

Hydra has seen overwhelming acceptance and love from our local community and we intend to continue our growth and connection to the Sioux Falls area by opening the Hydra Brewery & Taphouse right here...in your city. The process is already underway and the wheels are in motion. We have secured our location and remodel has begun. This will be a two stage process starting with the taphouse opening the end of December 2015. The on site brewery will begin construction at the same time and should be fully operational in the months following. The brewery will consist of a 10 barrel brewhouse with a total of 54 barrels of fermentable space. This will give us the ability to bring all brewing in house for both the taphouse and for our retail distribution. 

Not only are we expanding our operations, we are expanding the Hydra team. We have added two of the regions most reputable brewers, Bud Molyneux and Derek Soukup.  These two bring unmatched tag team skills to the Hydra family. 

The taphouse will feature a 24 tap system that will feature our year round beers, seasonals as well as our experimental lines. On top of our own beer, we will feature local craft beer from around the area. We will takes things a step further by offering our own personal twist on gourmet soda and cold brewed coffee. We will also be opening up our space for takeout or any to-go order food you wish to bring. This means you can order food, have it delivered and eat your favorite meals while enjoying the best Hydra has to offer in an environment that is distinctly...HYDRA BEER COMPANY

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

The wheels are already in motion. We have our location, the remodel is under way, and the ordering of brewery equipment has begun. We are not looking to fund our entire venture, as that would be silly and very short sighted. However, we are looking for our communities support to make it everything it can and should be...as well as make it their own. By contributing to our campaign you are directly making a new home for yourself away from home. Hydra Brewery & Taphouse will not be a 'stop in for 1 and see you next month' type of joint. We welcome you and want you to be a part of the Hydra family so we are offering some pretty insane packages for your contribution. Many are only available by contributing to our campaign. We want to EARN your support, quench your thirst, and keep you in the Hydra family through time. 

HELP SPREAD THE WORD

Not everyone has a wad of cash to throw at someone else's dream...and we get that. But just know that every little bit helps...and the perks & rewards are pretty rad to boot.

Even if you can't financially help, you can help us by spreading the word!!

Please post/share on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Forums or just comment on it to keep it on the top of threads to help spread the word. 

www.indiegogo.com/HydraBeerCompany

Tell all your friends and family about Hydra! Email this link to friends, family, business owners, beer lovers and anyone who may have a spark of interest in having an awesome new Brewery & Taphouse in their city!

Again, thank you for your support and we look forward to having a beer with you at the new Hydra Beer Company Brewery & Taphouse!!!

story: We are working to open up a tabletop gaming cafe with a full breakfast, lunch, and dinner menu to fuel all of those extended gaming sessions. With all the coffee options you would expect from a great cafe', Italian sodas, and a huge selection of root beers Coffee Quest is a great place to play all of your favorite tabletop, card, ans miniature games!  Our guests will have use of our custom gaming tables and have access to an extensive selection of game masters on staff! Coffee Quest also has a stage area and will be hosting many local performers ranging from musicians to local artists.

story:
WE'RE SO CLOSE, BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP!

MILK+T is a boba truck that will be traveling around Southern California bringing tea enthusiasts a unique experience. What makes us unique is that we are the world's first self-serve tea truck. That's right, self-serve!  Customers will have the opportunity to mix and match whatever toppings they please-- from boba to chia seeds. 

But what else makes us unique? Aside from the self-serve concept, our team believes that healthy eating is a vital part of life. Because of this, our drinks are made using no high fructose corn syrup. We hand-make every single one of our fruit syrups using nothing but the fruit and cane sugar. 

With your help, we'll be able to get MILK+T on the road. 

BUT FIRST, A LITTLE BIT ABOUT US

Hi there! I'm Stacey. For the past 6 years, I've been dreaming about opening up my own shop-- and now, the time has finally come! Okay, it's a shop on wheels, but I feel like that makes us a bit more unique than the other guys. The San Gabriel Valley is a saturated area for tea houses, so I thought going mobile would be the solution. 

I'm here with my business partner Beyah, and we're incredibly excited to be bringing our concept to you. Thank you for helping us out on our journey!
We've been so lucky to have all of our friends and family supporting us through this. They've been absolutely wonderful and have been a huge part to making this dream a reality. But they can only provide so much. Every single donation helps, and every dollar gets us closer to a successful launch.

We are very close to opening, but we do still need quite a few things...

BUT WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO?

If we exceed our goal of $5,400, the remaining funds will go towards a ventless fryer so we can serve up some delicious fried goodies!

WHAT YOU GET

Every donation amount will receive a hand-written thank you card that doubles as a FREE COUPON and a sticker. ($10 donation minimum)


How our beautiful t-shirts look like!

DON'T HAVE MONEY? NOT A PROBLEM.

If you can't donate any money to our campaign-- we understand. All we ask is that you share this page with your friends, family, pets, and maybe even lovers. :) 

THE MILK+TEAM THANKS YOU!

From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign and read our story. We are infinitely grateful for your help and support. We could not do this without you. THANK YOU!!

story:
RES RUSTICA is the first collaborative micro-farms brand platform

A 92 BCE edict of the censors in Rome, as reported by Gaius Suetonius Tranquillus, reads: “All new that is done contrary to the usage and the customs of our ancestors, seems not to be right".  If that was believed to be wise in 92 BCE, we could not agree more in 2015 CE. 

The food industry today is in fact interested in selling one consistent average variety everywhere, to everybody. Go bananas: more than 1.000 varieties still exists in the world but merely one, the Cavendish, is produced intensively to be exported globally. According to FAO, 95% of all calories consumed globally come just from 30 species. You can appreciate how far we’ve gone into destroying our biodiverse heritage.

In Latin, RES RUSTICA means "things of the field" or simply "agriculture". That's where we reckon food should belong to. Not to disquieting laboratories nor glossy supermarkets. Unfortunately, markets are today dominated by big industrial players and most consumers baffled by disorienting labels. 

We therefore decided to set up this collaborative brand in order to bring farming, harvesting, producing and marketing biodiverse produce back to square one, to the local communities that own this precious heritage we all need to treasure.

Our goal is in fact to curate, support and market local cultivars working only with micro-farmers who are already growing them. RES RUSTICA is a unique platform that will also deliver content to make the whole journey a revealing, transparent experience. From planting to packaging.

When you buy RES RUSTICA you buy in fact a hyper-local product and a personal farming story, different each time, brought to a larger scale by the power of the collaborative branding platform.

EXTRA-VIRGIN OLIVE OIL: the most underrated super-food and the staple of any healthy diet

These days, scandals of all sorts are sadly surfacing regarding the King of the Mediterranean cuisine: whether is about illegally blending low quality oils passed off as pure Extra Virgin or mixing non-European, dubious oils and sold it with a Made in Italy tag on. 

Local producers struggle to deliver decent communication to consumers regarding why they should pay more for a healthy, premium quality, artisanal product whilst some greedy so-called entrepreneurs are cheating everybody with no respect for public health nor commercial decency. 

This is rubbish and it's time for a radical change in food culture, which involves everyone to be aware of what's going on in the fields. 

Most micro-farms around the world managed to create an eco-friendly subsistence production. "Food is your medicine", they may tell you: their only goal is the presence of nutrients and the absence of anything else. It's that simple, really.

We'll be starting from the archetypical staple of human diet, the most underrated amongst super foods, the green gold:  a supreme Extra-Virgin Olive Oil from Ceglie Messapica, Salento, Italia. A gift from the heart by us founders, Guido Mercati and Jodie Whileman, and backed up by a second batch produced by Dr. Angelo Giordano and Valerio Tanzarella, followed by many other micro-farmers from the same area.

All the Ceglie Messapica collections will be analysed to validate their nutritional values: with the Mercati collection from Contrada Fedele Grande, for example, we've reached an astonishing 309 mg/kg of Tocopherols, the most absorbable form of Vitamin E for the human body. Together with beautiful green tomatoes and freshly-cut grass aromas replenishing your taste buds.

What you see is what you get

  • We aim to help local farmers and agricultural entrepreneurs to find the soft spot between traditional rural methodologies and new technologies, between heritage and innovation. And what better beta-testing platform than to create the best Extra Virgin Olive Oil possibile: super-low in acidity and ultra rich in ω3, polyphenols and antioxidants and with a fragrant bouquet of aromas. All our products will be nutrient-rich and rubbish-free and exclusively from local, forgotten and rare cultivars.
  • We'll be harvesting and milling the finest Extra Virgin Olive Oil, replicating what our grandparents would have done half a century ago: no chemicals whatsoever, manual and semi-manual methods, olives crop brought daily to the oil press, controlled and accurate cold milling (less than 25 ºC/77 ºF). This is an olive nectar, a fruit juice as was meant to be.
  • If you buy our product you will be with us all throughout the process, watching a documentary in five parts  where harvesting, pressing and funnelling will unfold in front of your eyes. For the very first time maybe, you will be fully aware of what you are buying. This will always be RES RUSTICA modus operandi.
  • Our agronomist Dr. Angelo Giordano, will explain and reveal to the general public myths, misconceptions, secrets and benefits of Extra-Virgin Olive Oil, dwelling on the organoleptic properties this marvel of nature provides us.

The impact


  • This Campaign will change radically the perception on what #EVOO and local cultivars are and what their immense heritage represent for mankind. Without biodiversity are ecosystem will collapse very soon.
  • The more you buy, the more the local communities who grow this produce will benefit from our platform: we will be able to select and welcome new farmers aboard, making this vintage a success story to kick-start our micro-farms revolution around the world.
  • We will be able to implement our total quality protocols to convert starving farmers that now are forced to sell non-organic produce to the food industry or large supermarket chain into local and rare cultivar and biodynamic methods.
  • www.resrustica.uk will start recruiting micro-farmers around the world, to deliver you an ever growing variety of products, helping protecting the biodiverse landscapes in your area as well.
  • Our educational programme could eventually start and we could influence local administrators and Governments into putting in place more stringent legislation regarding protection of local ecotypes, banning cancer-causing pesticides and other poison and devising more stringent policies about OGM labelling.
  • Our promise is to redistribute profits as much as possible with micro-farmers and their local communities: if younger generations are not attracted by this new wave of agriculture, the rest of our work is utterly pointless. 

Possible delays 

  • We want this process to be honest and transparent as much as we can. In the meanwhile, we're trying to produce the best Extra-Virgin Olive Oil possible so please, bear with us if updates don't show up as regularly as you think. 

Other Ways You Can Help Us

  • Buying our product is the best way to support us. Nevertheless we appreciate immensely your contribution spreading the word out on your favourite Social Media channels and make some noise about RES RUSTICA, Extra-Virgin Olive Oil as it supposed to be.
  • Use all the Indiegogo tools to do so, and let the world enjoy our video and images.

story:
About Us

Who are we? Well, we are a very determined and maybe a little nutty, family.  For years we have had the dream of starting an 8 acre vegetable and perennial farm in Southern Maine.  In 2013 the dream began.  In 2014, Lilac Lane Farm was incorporated and started growing the first 8500 perennials from seed.  Perennials such as Shasta Daisies, Columbine, Foxglove, Oriental poppies and more.  But here is the “thing”.  It all started in the 14x70 mobile home we are living in, 2 adults, a five year old, a one year old, three cats and 8500 seedlings.  Special racks were designed and built to minimize the space needed and to take full advantage of the sun coming in the large living room windows.  But that was the easy part.  The real challenge came in transplanting the seedlings and growing them to a marketable size.  But we did it!  We figured that even tough things may not be just as we want them, we needed to figure out how to work with what we had at that moment.  Well, we did and Lilac lane Farm was born.



So, now we have a system to grow the perennials from seed that we know works and works well.  Ok, so that got the farm started but now Lilac Lane Farm needed the land and a larger home for the family and farm.  This past summer, 2015, I was looking through Craigslist and there was this beautiful, charming, antique cape and barn for sale at a very reasonable price.  The catch, well, it needed to be dismantled and move relatively quickly.  So, of course, I answered the ad.  After seeing this antique cape, I gleefully informed the rest of the family that they were going to have that big house and barn a bit sooner than anticipated.  Isabella and Callan were ecstatic with the prospect.  Cliff however, was a bit terrified by the thought and wanted to know how on earth two people were going to take down a 200+ year old house and barn in a matter of months.  Well, despite the challenges that presented themselves along the way, we did it!  And we now have a beautiful antique cape with attached barn  packed safely away for the winter in a 40 foot mobile storage container ready to be rebuilt in the spring.  We at Lilac Lane Farm, know we can accomplish anything we put our minds to and we embrace the hard work it takes to do so.

                  

             



What You Get & What We Need

   

                                      "The Wedding" Original painting 20" x 32"


                                                                 "The Basket Lady"                                                       "The Garden"  

 

We at Lilac Lane Farm are grateful for your support and we want you to have something special.  We have a selection of prints, artist proofs and original paintings all done by Adrianne Gibson, our farm manager.  We hope you will enjoy this artwork as much as we do.  And we hope that the beautiful, vibrant colors bring a smile to your face each and everyday. We hope that this artwork reminds you of our story and determination. It is also our hope that this artwork reminds you that anything is possible and that through your kindness you are making a difference in the world.                                                                                                                


In order to get things growing this year, here are some of the items that we will need.  We have the farm house and barn for Lilac Lane Farm we just have to put it back together..........  For that we will need a septic system, well, and footings.  Our foundation will be stone slip form and we have already collected tons of stone for the foundation, fireplace and chimney.   For the farm house we will also need some materials for the plumbing, heating, electrical, etc. but the bulk of the materials we have already.  Although in the future we would like to transition to a horse and plow, in the interest of time we will need a tractor to prepare the soil and to plow the snow in the winter.  For the five mobile hoop houses we need materials such as pipe, plastic and hardware.  And of course, we will need vegetable and perennial seeds.  This may seem like a enormous task for two people but we truly enjoy working hard.    

If in three months we moved an entire house and barn board by board imagine what we could accomplish in three years.   

 

                                                                 

In the event that we do not reach our Indiegogo funding goal we will use the funds that were raised to continue our project one small step at a time.  Starting with the farm house rebuild.  We will need year around housing on site to farm "four seasons", so that's were we will start.  Then we will prepare the soil and get growing. 



The Impact

By following Elliot Coleman’s model of the “four season" farm in Harborside Maine we strive to provide our family, our community and those in need with fresh vegetables year around.  Yes, year around in Maine!  We will do this as Elliot Coleman does using Deep-Organic techniques and “cold houses”, unheated greenhouses.  This method, not requiring fossil fuels, is more labor intensive but it helps keep costs down over the winter months, minimizes our carbon footprint and produces vegetables that are sweeter, more tender and more flavorful. 

Part of our goal is to help fuel the growth of "four season" farms in the U.S. especially in colder climates.  It is not only possible but profitable.  In growing vegetables year around especially in winter, without heat,  we not only minimize our dependency on foreign markets for the vegetables but also for fuel.   We will create jobs, minimize our carbon footprint and feed our community.   

We also feel that it is necessary to provide our community with a “mobile” food pantry that provides all local food pantries with fresh, healthy vegetables year around.  Years ago while leaving a crisis situation one of us found it necessary to go to the local food pantry.  Although grateful for the food, the vegetables in particular were near expiration.  With that experience it was realized that there was a substantial need to supply our local food pantries with lots of fresh vegetables.  People meet with unexpected circumstances everyday for one reason or another.  It’s hard enough to accept the fact that you are hungry and need to go to a food pantry for help.  Walking through that door is hard and humbling.  We at Lilac Lane farm understand and are committed to see that those in need are treated to nothing less than beautiful, fresh, healthy vegetables.  Fresh vegetables are good for the body and mind and who needs that more than those in crisis.



Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges associated with farming are many.  Weather, soil health, pests, mechanical failure, long physically taxing hours, just to name a few.  Similar were the risks and challenges involved in two people dismantling a 200+ year old farm house and attached barn and packing it into a 40 foot mobile storage container in three months.  We proudly accomplished that goal despite the perception of most that we were crazy to even try.  With careful planning we can minimize the risks and we know we will overcome any challenges that may present themselves,  because we have before.  Sometimes it just takes a little extra persistence, creativity and "out of the box" thinking to come up with solutions to the challenges.   There is always a solution its just a matter of finding it.  

Please visit us on https://www.facebook.com/lilaclanefarmme to watch the farm house dismantle and see how we work. 

                           


Other Ways You Can Help

There are lots of ways to help.  You might like to volunteer to help with our "mobile" food pantry.  Or, if you have a couple of hours to spare, and you want to join in the fun, you might like to help rebuild the 200+ year old timber frame farm house.  Or, if you would simply spread the word about Lilac Lane Farm, that would be awesome! 

We thank you so very much for your support! 



Stay In Touch 

As we grow we will  have plenty of volunteer opportunities available.  So, please sign up for our mailing list if you are interested in hearing more.
Please stay in touch and follow our progress.
 https://www.facebook.com/lilaclanefarmme
story_txt:
About Us

Who are we? Well, we are a very determined and maybe a
little nutty, family.  For years we have
had the dream of starting an 8 acre vegetable and perennial farm in Southern
Maine.  In 2013 the dream began.  In 2014, Lilac Lane Farm was incorporated and
started growing the first 8500 perennials from seed.  Perennials such as Shasta Daisies, Columbine,
Foxglove, Oriental poppies and more.  But
here is the “thing”.  It all started in
the 14x70 mobile home we are living in, 2 adults, a five year old, a one year
old, three cats and 8500 seedlings. 
Special racks were designed and built to minimize the space needed and
to take full advantage of the sun coming in the large living room windows.  But that was the easy part.  The real challenge came in transplanting the
seedlings and growing them to a marketable size.  But we did it! 
We figured that even tough things may not be just as we want them, we
needed to figure out how to work with what we had at that moment.  Well, we did and Lilac lane Farm was born.



So, now we have a system to grow the perennials from seed
that we know works and works well.  Ok,
so that got the farm started but now Lilac Lane Farm needed the land and a
larger home for the family and farm. 
This past summer, 2015, I was looking through Craigslist and there was
this beautiful, charming, antique cape and barn for sale at a very reasonable
price.  The catch, well, it needed to be
dismantled and move relatively quickly.  So,
of course, I answered the ad. 
After seeing this antique cape, I gleefully informed the rest of the
family that they were going to have that big house and barn a bit sooner than
anticipated.  Isabella and Callan were ecstatic
with the prospect.  Cliff however, was a
bit terrified by the thought and wanted to know how on earth two people were
going to take down a 200+ year old house and barn in a matter of months.  Well, despite the challenges that presented
themselves along the way, we did it!  And we now have a beautiful antique cape with attached barn  packed safely away for the
winter in a 40 foot mobile storage container ready to be rebuilt in the
spring.  We at Lilac Lane Farm, know we can accomplish
anything we put our minds to and we embrace the hard work it takes to do so.


                  
             



What You Get & What We Need

   

                                      "The Wedding" Original painting 20" x 32"

                                                                 "The Basket Lady"                                                       "The Garden"  
 
We at Lilac Lane Farm are grateful for your support and we want you to have something special.  We have a selection of prints, artist proofs and original paintings all done by Adrianne Gibson, our farm manager.  We hope you will enjoy this artwork as much as we do.  And we hope that the beautiful, vibrant colors bring a smile to your face each and everyday. We hope that this artwork reminds you of our story and determination. It is also our hope that this artwork reminds you that anything is possible and that through your kindness you are making a difference in the world.                                                                                                                



In order to get things growing this year, here are some of the items that we will need.  We have the farm house and barn for Lilac Lane Farm we just have to put it back together..........  For that we will need a septic system, well, and footings.  Our foundation will be stone slip form and we have already collected tons of stone for the foundation, fireplace and chimney.   For the farm house we will also need some materials for the plumbing, heating, electrical, etc. but the bulk of the materials we have already.  Although in the future we would like to transition to a horse and plow, in the interest of time we will need a tractor to prepare the soil and to plow the snow in the winter.  For the five mobile hoop houses we need materials such as pipe, plastic and hardware.  And of course, we will need vegetable and perennial seeds.  This may seem like a enormous task for two people but we truly enjoy working hard.    
If in three months we moved an entire house and barn board by board imagine what we could accomplish in three years.   
 
                                                                 
In the event that we do not reach our Indiegogo funding goal we will use the funds that were raised to continue our project one small step at a time.  Starting with the farm house rebuild.  We will need year around housing on site to farm "four seasons", so that's were we will start.  Then we will prepare the soil and get growing. 


The Impact

need with fresh vegetables year around.  Yes, year around in Maine!  We

method, not requiring fossil fuels, is more labor intensive but it helps keep
costs down over the winter months, minimizes our carbon footprint and produces vegetables
that are sweeter, more tender and more flavorful.

We also feel that it is necessary to provide our community
with a “mobile” food pantry that provides all local food pantries with fresh,
healthy vegetables year around.  Years
ago while leaving a crisis situation one of us found it necessary to go to the
local food pantry.  Although grateful for
the food, the vegetables in particular were near expiration.  With that experience it was realized that
there was a substantial need to supply our local food pantries with lots of
fresh vegetables.  People meet with
unexpected circumstances everyday for one reason or another.  It’s hard enough to accept the fact that you
are hungry and need to go to a food pantry for help.  Walking through that door is hard and
humbling.  We at Lilac Lane farm
understand and are committed to see that those in need are
treated to nothing less than beautiful, fresh, healthy vegetables.  Fresh vegetables are good for the body and
mind and who needs that more than those in crisis.

We thank you so very much for your support! 



Stay In Touch 


As we grow we will  have plenty of volunteer opportunities available.  So, please sign up for our mailing list if you are interested in hearing more.

Please stay in touch and follow our progress.
 https://www.facebook.com/lilaclanefarmme

story:
OUR STORY

I would like to introduce ourselves. We are Red Toad Tacos! 

We (Brandon Green and David Rupp  have been in the culinary industry for a combined 30 years.  We started a catering company a few years back and it has grown and changed directions over the last 3 years.  We then purchased a food truck and started a taco concept based on authentic Mexican street food.  NOW, it is time to open a store front and continue to share our yummy Mexican food . 

It goes without saying that we are passionate about food and we enjoy sharing our passion with others.  In short, food lets us be part of so many other peoples' lives.

To that end, we would like to bring a part of where Brandon grew up (California) to Lancaster PA.  And, that is authentic and fresh Mexican food! 

Having been transplanted to Southern California at the age to 14, Brandon quickly fell in love with the beach, surfing and (most importantly!) Mexican food.  Coming from an eclectic family, Brandon also had the opportunity to learn his family members' recipes from Mexico that have become part of my family's traditions. 

This IndieGoGo Fundraising Campaign is very close to our hearts for several reasons: (1) With our upbringing, we want people to understand what REAL Mexican food tastes like; (2) We want to share our joint passion for fresh and flavorful food with those who deserve it; and (3) We want to help our community by creating jobs and using local suppliers while also making and providing amazing food!

As a contributor you will help us to create a place that friends and family's will come to enjoy great food, and conversation. you will also help fund local artists. We plan to commission them to create limited addition prints on a monthly bases and give them to customers. We will also have local artist show case their talents on the walls of our restaurant.  

What We Need & What You Get


We are asking for $35,000 to move from our food truck to a store-front location.  Your funding will help us with the following: We have looked at few locations in the city of Lancaster, Ideally we are looking for a space that has a Kitchen built and hood in place. If that is not possible we will have to purchase equipment i.e. a range, refrigeration, fryers. We will also need to build out the kitchen. This will consist of tile for the floor and stainless steel or tile for the walls, we will need tables, chairs and fixtures,  as well as kitchen utensils and a small point of Sale system.

Our perks will  be a single sticker with our logo for a small donation to , pendents, and  limited addition prints with a Dia de Los Muertos theme for a larger donation to this project.

 Prints will be made monthly and be created by  local artists; showcasing a new artist every month. 


The Impact

Your contribution will help Red Toad Tacos become a Reality. You will help us make the last three years of hard work bare fruit. Your contribution will help us to create great environment where will be able to share our love of great freshly made food, with the community, and create new friends. Lastly your contribution will help us add to the richness of the city of Lancaster and it's community.
Risks & Challenges
There are always risks and challenges with any new business. the challenges that we will face are many. We may have to build the kitchen from scratch, and with any construction there are always unforeseen challenges that may delay or increase the cost of opening the restaurant. We will have to get construction permits, the kitchen will need to pass a health certification,  We will be required to obtain the proper licensure from the city. 
We feel that all of these challenges can be meet and over come. As for the risks that we face there are many; from a lack of interest where we make it but it never really takes off; to the flat out failure of the concept, but we have been in business for 3 years starting our catering company out of three plastic tubs, and taking that and making it into a food truck business and now we would like to make it into a store front with your help.  Our plan is to have the Funding in place, secure the licences needed, so we can have the work begin. We have the contractors in place for any part of this we will not be able to handle. As for the Risks we face we are going to be involved in the community and market with current establish business with in the city.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that everyone will not be able to make a contribution to our project and we understand that completely, if you could give a single dollar all of it will help us out. If that is not possible  simply tell a friend a; family member; a classmate, post it on Facebook, twitter feeds or your Instagram account. Help us get the word out to as many folks as we can. We would like to thank you in advance for you donation and Helping us open the first Location of Red Toad Tacos.

We would like to thank you in advance for you donation and Helping us open the first Location of Red Toad Tacos.

story:
What's this all about?

Spoken Word Spartanburg is a South Carolina non-profit organization dedicated to using the art of the spoken word to heal people and communities. While not currently a 501(c)3 organization, it is registered with the State of South Carolina. It's members consist of spoken word poets, artists, professionals, and community citizens.  One of the very important projects hosted by Spoken Word Spartanburg is Speaking Down Barriers.

This campaign is to aid in the current funding received from the Highlander Center's We Shall Overcome Fund for conducting the Speaking Down Barriers "On the Road" project across South Carolina.  Through this project, we will develop a curriculum/toolkit, conduct community facilitator trainings, co-lead initial sessions, and providing ongoing group & one-on-one support for new facilitators to instill the Speaking Down Barriers model in other cities.  

Your support of this project will allow us to install successful and meaningful community gatherings on social justice issues throughout South Carolina!

We understand that this is a low amount for the amount of work that will take place. The goal here is for the training project to be sustainable, do it's job, and be accessible to individuals who may not have access for financial reasons. 
If we do not reach the entire goal, Speaking Down Barriers On the Road Project will still take place! Simply, because it is needed.  However, we will not be able to roll it out across the entire state.  We would have to focus on the Upstate region.
Your support could earn YOU any the following perks:
  • A smiling heart from a grassroots soul
  • Free entry into spoken word events offered by Spoken Word Spartanburg
  • Spoken Word Spartanburg Swag
  • A spoken word CD
  • A spoken word showcase for you, friends, family, or your organization

The Impact

  • We have facilitated successful Speaking Down Barriers sessions locally since November 2013
  • The participants are diverse in age, race, gender, and class--in the same room there has been a multi-millionaire and an ex-convict discussing very difficult topics
  • The conversation is married with spoken word poetry and provides an amazing foundation for powerful community dialogue
  • Some of the feedback from participants has been earth shattering:

Since starting Speaking Down Barriers, our organization has been brought into other settings to hold race-related community conversations, including: 
  • Partnership with the Spartanburg County Historical Association to hold Freedom Speaks, a reading of ex-slave narratives and response poetry
  • Partnership with the Hub City Writers Project to hold a community panel discussion related to Claudia Rankine's book "Citizen: An American Lyric", a book of poetry and prose on blackness and whiteness in America
  • Facilitation of a Community Speak-Out at a human rights conference and a Juneteenth celebration
  • Participation in a Community Roundtable discussion on race held at the Church of the Advent in Spartanburg

Risks & Challenges

  • Some individuals believe that speaking about race-related issues perpetuates racism
  • Some individuals believe that discussing White privilege or White supremacy is racist in and of itself
  • Some individuals carry emotional trauma and wounds associated with race and racism
We welcome all of these individuals to the conversation.  We do not believe that the goal of us meeting is to agree or to quickly eradicate the social structure of racism. We believe that all people can come together and listen, share, and rethink. We have seen the healing that happens in doing so.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, we still need you:

  • Share via social media: Twitter, Facebook, E-mail, Blog
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to assist you
  • Use your mouth.  Your voice matters.  Tell people what we are doing.
  • Attend a local session of Speaking Down Barrers! We are there every 1st Monday at 6:00 PM.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Esprezzo Café – the expansion plan

"Life is so busy these days and what little time we do have for ourselves, for friends, for family has to be quality.

So when the chance comes to connect with friends, colleagues or to simply take time out for yourself, embrace it."

                                          


Embrace Esprezzo

About 7 years ago, Jason and Brianna Robinson took over a suburban mall coffee shop with a vision to share their love of wholesome food and invigorating coffee.

Today, they offer the freshest and most innovative whole and superfood café menus to an eclectic mix of both faithful and uninitiated customers from near and far.  Established locals proudly lay claim to Esprezzo patronage dating back to when Jase and Bri revolutionised the northern suburbs café experience.  Those newer to the area or just passing through are wowed by the array of goodness, customer service and attention to detail.

No matter who you are, you’ll be wowed… by how hard it is to get a table, to move around, to reach the salt and pepper shakers.

Too… crowded! Must… get… crowd-funding

So popular has Café Esprezzo become that this suburban icon, known in café culture magazines and foodie blogs alike has outgrown its birthplace at the eastern entrance of Noranda Shopping Centre. 



The good news is that plans have been drawn up that will see Esprezzo blossom into the spacious, multifunctional house of goodness it always promised to be.

Imagine settling into a comfy chair in the cosy traditional café corner, or grabbing a seat with a mate at the coffee bench or even joining workmates in front of the pastries on one of two huge dining tables.  The possibilities are all there on paper and the Esprezzo crew need you to help make it a reality.

At the end of the day we could focus on the intricate details, details you’ll love by the way:

·  the dedicated juice section for smoothies,

·  barista classes from Esprezzo’s award-winning team

·  Wi-fi for those that want proof that awards have been won

·  the recyclable coffee ground bins for environmental sustainability,

·  A dedicated coffee connoisseurs’ retreat

·  the easy access for Mums with prams and strollers with a dedicated “kids’ corner”.

·  The business corner for established companies and school-aged entrepreneurs alike to display their products and services

…but the nett effect will be a happier, healthier community. It’s all there. 


                     



Esprezzo is taking it upon themselves to help advance your community as a whole.

Help us and serve you better

But for Esprezzo to make a real difference to the community, we need real funding support… and we’re prepared to reward you for it with more than just a smile and a thank you.

The Esprezzo team is asking you to pledge one or more of the amounts from the support schedule/perk-o-latte list and in return you could be enjoying anything from free coffee to priority seating to complimentary coffee courses.  We’re prepared to go that far because this is something we believe in and we’re asking you to embrace the challenge, embrace the journey and embrace Esprezzo!


Esprezzo

Embrace it, Taste it, Share it

                                      


Finally a word from…

Bri – “The reason we are aiming so high is that this community has supported us for 7 years with their passion, loyalty and encouragement.   As a result we’ve doubled our seating capacity over the years… and tripled our patronage.  It’s getting to be a tight squeeze!  We’ll never forget that and that’s why we are aiming to exceed your wildest expectations by joining with you to invest $50,000 to create a lifetime of healthy experiences, valuable meet-ups, beautiful smiles and a place for your friends, family, children, mates to get to know you and come to understand the real meaning of community… and awesome coffee.”

Jase – “I know what it is to love good food, superior coffee and beautiful people.  I know what it takes to build an environment where you can learn the same.  Let’s build Esprezzo… together.”
story_txt:
Esprezzo
Café – the expansion plan
"Life is so busy these days and what little time we do
have for ourselves, for friends, for family has to be quality.
So when the chance comes to connect with friends,
colleagues or to simply take time out for yourself, embrace it."                                          
Embrace
Esprezzo
About 7 years ago, Jason and Brianna Robinson took over a
suburban mall coffee shop with a vision to share their love of wholesome food and invigorating coffee.
Today, they offer the freshest and most innovative whole
and superfood café menus to an eclectic mix of both faithful and uninitiated
customers from near and far.  Established
locals proudly lay claim to Esprezzo patronage dating back to when Jase and Bri
revolutionised the northern suburbs café experience.  Those newer to the area or just passing
through are wowed by the array of goodness, customer service and attention to
detail.
No matter who you are, you’ll be wowed… by how hard it is
to get a table, to move around, to reach the salt and pepper shakers.
Too…
crowded! Must… get… crowd-funding
So popular has Café Esprezzo become that this suburban
icon, known in café culture magazines and foodie blogs alike has outgrown its
birthplace at the eastern entrance of Noranda Shopping Centre. 
The
good news is that plans have been drawn up that will see Esprezzo
blossom into the spacious, multifunctional house of goodness it always promised
to be.
Imagine settling into a comfy chair in the cosy
traditional café corner, or grabbing a seat with a mate at the coffee bench or
even joining workmates in front of the pastries on one of two huge dining
tables.  The possibilities are all there
on paper and the Esprezzo crew need you to help
make it a reality.
At the end of the day we could focus on the intricate
details, details you’ll love by the way: 
· 
the dedicated juice section for smoothies, 
· 
barista classes from Esprezzo’s award-winning
team
· 
Wi-fi for those that want proof that awards
have been won
· 
the recyclable coffee ground bins for
environmental sustainability, 
· 
A dedicated coffee connoisseurs’ retreat
· 
the easy access for Mums with prams and
strollers with a dedicated “kids’ corner”.
· 
The business corner for established companies
and school-aged entrepreneurs alike to display their products and services
…but the nett effect will be a happier, healthier
community. It’s all there.                       
Esprezzo is taking it upon themselves to help advance your community as a whole.
Help
us and serve you better
But for Esprezzo to make
a real difference to the community, we need real funding support… and we’re
prepared to reward you for it with more than just a smile and a thank you.
The Esprezzo team is asking you to pledge one or more of
the amounts from the support schedule/perk-o-latte list and in return you could
be enjoying anything from free coffee
to priority seating to complimentary coffee courses.  We’re prepared to go that far because this is
something we believe in and we’re asking you to embrace the challenge, embrace
the journey and embrace Esprezzo!
Esprezzo
Embrace
it, Taste it, Share it                                      
Finally
a word from…
Bri –
“The reason we are aiming so high is that this community has supported us for
7 years with their passion, loyalty and encouragement.   As a
result we’ve doubled our seating capacity over the years… and tripled our
patronage.  It’s getting to be a tight
squeeze!  We’ll never forget that and
that’s why we are aiming to exceed your wildest expectations by joining with
you to invest $50,000 to create a lifetime of healthy experiences, valuable
meet-ups, beautiful smiles and a place for your friends, family, children,
mates to get to know you and come to understand the real meaning of community… and awesome coffee.”
Jase –
“I know what it is to love good food, superior coffee and beautiful
people.  I know what it takes to build an
environment where you can learn the same. 
Let’s build Esprezzo… together.”

story:
Access to clean drinking water, rich farming soil, and educational opportunities have been serious challenges in Jeremie, Haiti.  In partnership with the University of the Nouvelle Grand'Anse (UNOGA), our UI student team aims to develop two projects to enhance the educational capability of UNOGA while addressing local water and agricultural issues. We will develop a business model to sustainably supply clean water through biosand filter implementation. In addition, we will establish a soil lab for UNOGA students to conduct soil research that will help local farmers. We will also create a recycling project utilizing plastic bottles to build greenhouses.

Successful biosand filter implementation requires rigorous training and careful business planning. To achieve this goal, we will partner with an established NGO, Clean Water for Haiti, whose technical expertise has been repeatedly proven by their installation of more than 20,000 filters since 2001. Clean Water for Haiti will implement a comprehensive training course for an UNOGA student leader and staff member. In addition, we will develop an income-generating business plan to support the biosand filter operations and educational programs at UNOGA. We will collaborate with UNOGA students to provide clean water and training materials for St. Pierre, a local primary school, and the broader community.

The soil lab will provide tools to map out and trace the ecological impact of soil erosion. UNOGA will share the testing results through its extensive local network to guide farmers’ agricultural practices, improving crop yields and reducing soil degradation. These projects will enhance UNOGA’s agricultural and business curriculum and benefit the local community.

The recycling project with alleviate the rampart littering problem around UNOGA while providing the students with a new place to study agriculture. We also hope to push the recycling project forward to other parts of Haiti with the help of UNOGA students and faculties. 

Here's what we need from you in order to complete the projects. We would greatly appreciate your monetary aid and help in spreading our voice.

Total Cost Breakdown
Cost Per Unit Units Total Cost  
Biosand Filter Mold 450 1 450  
Biosand Class 250 1 250  
Transportation 0 0 0  
Materials 50 1 50  
Completed Filters 100 2 200  
Soil Lab Materials 445 1 445  
Greenhouse construction Materials 105 1 105  
Total:   1500  
For a more detailed review of the cost breakdown for the soil kit, you can visit this link: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/16N-ZHga...

story:
As an Army Vet, I had a difficult time trying to figure out and balance my personal and professional life, following my early medical discharge due to an injury. This challenging season continued even once I finished college. After hearing the saying, “Your passion will lead you to your destiny”, I started doing some soul searching and self-evaluation. I pinpointed that my passion is to serve, train and assist others. My thought was, what better way to use this passion than to create a business to serve those who serve other the most. In my opinion, these individuals are women and more specifically women in the military community.

Hello my name is Shemmyla Green and I'm the owner of The Empowerment Firm. I am currently developing a pilot program for service women, women vets and military wives, called the Balanced Empowerment Program. The premise is to assist women in their personal and profession lives to find a balance, with all the hats they wear.

Women in the military community are increasing and under served.

According to the Department of Veteran Affairs, the number of women Veterans is growing rapidly. As of January 2015, the population of women Veterans numbered 2,020,077 and 54,221 are in Arizona. Women also represent nearly 15% of today’s active duty military and 18% of guard and reserve forces. It would be a privilege and pleasure to assist these amazing women in creating balance in their lives.

http://www.va.gov/WOMENVET/docs/WomenVeteransPopulationFactSheet.pdf

http://www.womenshealth.va.gov/WOMENSHEALTH/docs/ProfileSheet_073113_508c.pdf

My goal is to raise $55,000. These funds will go toward the following:

  •  20 Scholarships for this program
  •  Website Development
  •  Contracted Staff
  •  Building Rental
  •  Operation/Administrative Cost

Additionally, I want the foundation of my company to be established on giving back. So a portion of the monies earned will go to Operation Underground Railroad (https://ourrescue.org/), to assist in the fight against and help the victims of sex trafficking and sexual violence. 

I know that everyone may not have the means to give, but may have the desire to do something. I completely understand and would greatly appreciate it if you would SHARE this information. Thank you! 

Shemmyla Green
