story:
For all the contentious issues in the world, we’re happy to be rallying behind a cause that we all can get behind: good food!

Want more farm-to-table options? Besides dining in, we'll also offer meals for pick up and for delivery. We want to make real food, using local ingredients -- fast for you, and easy for you or your family. Since we know how it is to be on a budget, we'll also have affordable options.  

     

HerBlends of Plenty's Mission: To nurture community & connection with nature's plenty; for a more vital, resilient people, and a more verdant future.

Embedded in the very core of our business is community.  We’re excited to be partnering with the Avenue Cafe not only because it’s a great location, but also because the Avenue has been a great space to meet with people, and to organize in the community.  With HerBlends of Plenty’s input, we will have it open for longer hours and we will engage with the community to host even more community events. 

We will work to find as many ways as possible to support our local economy, purchasing locally and creating partnerships with other local businesses and organizations.   We are invested in Lansing and in Michigan, and we will work hard to make it a  difference in our community.

Our plans for the space at the Avenue Cafe, excerpted from our blog post (read the rest of this blog for more info!):  

"First, we'll transition the kitchen, focusing on creating farm-to-table friendly dine-in options -- we're thinking this will be around the end of May.  We suspect either the implementation of the fresh market, or the launch of the CSK (community supported kitchen) will come next.  The teahouse will come last, in July at the latest. Besides the challenge inherent in extending hours of operation -- which we will be doing -- we want to hold off on the teahouse until we're certain we have all of the herbs we will need to get rolling.  

We'll continue to create our own herbal tea blends, using local, sustainably grown ingredients, and we'll have those for sale at the teahouse."

From our blog, more details:  

  • "A Sneak Peak at our Press Release" (overview of our project)   
  • " . . .Our Kitchen Ambitions"   
  • information about the "Community Supported Kitchen" 
  • information about how we will make these food options accessible/affordable, "Who will the Community Supported Kitchen (CSK) serve?"  

We now have a space, and we've built >>an awesome team>> to support the evolution of our business.   We do, however, need your support in helping launch this endeavor.  We're crowdfunding to get capital for the following:

  • Equipment for processing teas, and for the kitchen
  • To pay our executive chef and staff
  • To source ingredients from local farmers

We're still a startup business, so access to capital is tricky.  Some restaurant businesses fail before they even get started.  We don't wish to suffer a similar fate, so if we have a bit of working capital, and have some built in demand, we know we will succeed!  Your support makes this possible.  Even if you are unable to contribute financially to this campaign, your support in sharing our campaign is greatly appreciated, and a huge step toward a successful campaign. 


FAQs:

Will the Avenue Cafe still have craft beers and function as a venue for live music and other sweet events?  Yes!  The front of house at The Avenue Cafe will still be as it is, with the same crew you know and love.  There will still be craft beers and there will still be live music.

Will you still fulfill perks to backers if you don't reach your goal?   Yes!  Our campaign goal is the number we think will be achievable and will give us the capacity for a most successful launch.  We will launch regardless, but without reaching our goal there will be more struggles, and all of the pieces may come together more slowly (e.g.: opening the teahouse, expanding hours). 

I see that you've already reached your goal (we're hopeful!), should I still contribute?   Yes!  Some of our perks may be a one time offering, so you should act fast.  Also, the more funds we raise, the easier this launch will become and our chances of long-term success increase.

I don't live near Lansing, but I still want to contribute.  How will you figure out shipping fees for my perks?   For our perks that are available for shipping (e.g.:  herbal teas, Tea-shirts, etc), we will follow up with you post-campaign, and determine the fee for shipping your particular perk to you.  We will try to keep costs to a minimum, unless you want us to ship it express mail.  We will then make payment options available to you for the fulfillment of your perk.

Why will it take until August to ship a bag of herbal tea?  The delivery date will be variable, depending on what herbal ingredients are used.  Some may not be harvestable until July/August.  However, we may well be able to ship out your bag of tea sooner, and we will let you know based on what tea/s you are interested in pre-ordering.

Where and when do I tell you what size and items I want (and other fulfillment details)?  I didn't see it in checkout.  We will contact you and get your preferences once our campaign has come to a close.

What challenges will you have for this project?  We have a lot of work to do over the next year.  Not everything will happen at once. We'll be figuring some things out as we go, from the evolution of our menu and how we'll coordinate delivery options, to how the space will evolve to fit our needs.  Fortunately, we have a great team of creative thinkers and go-getters, and we will continue to engage with the community to ensure we will be serving your needs while building a sustainable business.

Can you tell me more about the CSK.  What is a community supported kitchen?  Great question. Here's an excerpt from our press release:   "HerBlends of Plenty will be offering community supported kitchen (CSK) shares starting in the summer, allowing customers to sign on as “members” of the kitchen, paying in advance for a set number of seasonal meals per week.  In return, they will receive meals at a more economical rate, and have the option of take-out, delivery or dine-in."  


                                       

Perks:

Herbal Teas:  See our webpage for our complete list, and this will be changing as we add more blends to the list.  Keep your eye on it. We will be having more blends and options when we open the teahouse (including "just peppermint" tea) and teas from other local producers. 

Fundraiser banquet, opening night, private parties:  These events will showcase farm-to-table food made by our Executive Chef, and herbal teas made by the HerBlends of Plenty team.  Furthermore, we will have a cash bar during these events.  All of these events will probably fall on a Sunday, but we haven't decided on the opening night, and the private parties may be negotiable to work out a different day.  But the pickier you are on the day, the longer it may take to fit the Avenue's schedule.

The Mug Club:  In addition to the locally made mug and steeper keeper, you will get $1 off your teas for a year at the teahouse.  Additionally, we will have other perks available throughout the year, such as discounts on the menu and for special events, possibly even special events just for the Mug Club.

CSK pre-order:  This will simply lock you in for a CSK share, in case we need to cap the number we offer at first.  The money will be applied towards your CSK share total price.  For more details about the CSK, read our blog and/or see the 2nd to last question on our campaign FAQs.

Wall of supporters:  The wall of supporters will be a piece of art that will incorporate the names of contributors -- or their organization, or a memorial -- and will be hanging at the Avenue Cafe to show our appreciation for our community of supporters.  

Money towards food or tea ($100, $250 and $500 levels):  This will essentially be a gift card, so this will be good toward some good food & tea at "Abundance."  This can not, however, be applied toward alcohol.

"You're Invested:"  This is a perk that will allow you to work with our team in creating a tea blend and other marketing details.  You can help determine the kinds of herbs to go in, and the artwork that will be on the bag.  We have final say, but want you to be happy.  (We only use locally sourced herbs, nothing tropical.)  You will get 1% of all the revenue from bags of that herbal tea blend sold.  Which means, at $7 a bag, that when 2000 bags have sold, (anywhere: out of the Avenue, farmers markets or at local stores; maybe we'll be carried at Whole Foods in the future, who knows), $1400 will have come your way, and more revenue is to come, assuming the tea blend is still selling.  We will determine how often a check is cut to you, but it will not be more than quarterly -- probably once a year to start.  

"Dig iT:" Patti and I are urban farmers, and will happily create a garden in your name, the name of an organization or as a memorial garden.  Obviously, we have the right to refusal: no Monsanto gardens, or hate groups will be promoted.  I doubt anyone would consider it, but we want to cover our bases.   We will work with you in coming up with the details of the garden.  Love lavender?  We can grow a bunch of it at the garden! Additionally, this perk comes with a CSA share (22 weeks of local produce), which is only really applicable for locals, since it won't be delivered.  However, if you're not local, you can have the CSA share donated.
story_txt:
For all the contentious issues in the world, we’re happy to be rallying behind a cause that we all can get behind: good food!Want more farm-to-table options? Besides dining in, we'll also offer meals for pick up and for delivery. We want to make real food, using local ingredients -- fast for you, and easy for you or your family. Since we know how it is to be on a budget, we'll also have affordable options.       HerBlends of Plenty's Mission: To nurture community & connection with nature's plenty; for a more vital, resilient people, and a more verdant future.Embedded in the very core of our business is community.  We’re excited to be partnering with the Avenue Cafe not only because it’s a great location, but also because the Avenue has been a great space to meet with people, and to organize in the community.  With HerBlends of Plenty’s input, we will have it open for longer hours and we will engage with the community to host even more community events. We will work to find as many ways as possible to support our local economy, purchasing locally and creating partnerships with other local businesses and organizations.   We are invested in Lansing and in Michigan, and we will work hard to make it a  difference in our community.Our plans for the space at the Avenue Cafe, excerpted from our blog post (read the rest of this blog for more info!):  "First, we'll transition the kitchen, focusing on creating farm-to-table friendly dine-in options -- we're thinking this will be around the end of May.  We suspect either the implementation of the fresh market, or the launch of the CSK (community supported kitchen) will come next.  The teahouse will come last, in July at the latest. Besides the challenge inherent in extending hours of operation -- which we will be doing -- we want to hold off on the teahouse until we're certain we have all of the herbs we will need to get rolling.  
We'll continue to create our own herbal tea blends, using local, sustainably grown ingredients, and we'll have those for sale at the teahouse."From our blog, more details:  

"A Sneak Peak at our Press Release" (overview of our project)   


" . . .Our Kitchen Ambitions"   


information about the "Community Supported Kitchen" 


information about how we will make these food options accessible/affordable, "Who will the Community Supported Kitchen (CSK) serve?"  

We now have a space, and we've built >>an awesome team>> to support the evolution of our business.   We do, however, need your support in helping launch this endeavor.  We're crowdfunding to get capital for the following:
Equipment for processing teas, and for the kitchen
To pay our executive chef and staff
To source ingredients from local farmers
We're still a startup business, so access to capital is tricky.  Some restaurant businesses fail before they even get started.  We don't wish to suffer a similar fate, so if we have a bit of working capital, and have some built in demand, we know we will succeed!  Your support makes this possible.  Even if you are unable to contribute financially to this campaign, your support in sharing our campaign is greatly appreciated, and a huge step toward a successful campaign. FAQs:Will the Avenue Cafe still have craft beers and function as a venue for live music and other sweet events?  Yes!  The front of house at The Avenue Cafe will still be as it is, with the same crew you know and love.  There will still be craft beers and there will still be live music.Will you still fulfill perks to backers if you don't reach your goal?   Yes!  Our campaign goal is the number we think will be achievable and will give us the capacity for a most successful launch.  We will launch regardless, but without reaching our goal there will be more struggles, and all of the pieces may come together more slowly (e.g.: opening the teahouse, expanding hours). I see that you've already reached your goal (we're hopeful!), should I still contribute?   Yes!  Some of our perks may be a one time offering, so you should act fast.  Also, the more funds we raise, the easier this launch will become and our chances of long-term success increase.I don't live near Lansing, but I still want to contribute.  How will you figure out shipping fees for my perks?   For our perks that are available for shipping (e.g.:  herbal teas, Tea-shirts, etc), we will follow up with you post-campaign, and determine the fee for shipping your particular perk to you.  We will try to keep costs to a minimum, unless you want us to ship it express mail.  We will then make payment options available to you for the fulfillment of your perk.Why will it take until August to ship a bag of herbal tea?  The delivery date will be variable, depending on what herbal ingredients are used.  Some may not be harvestable until July/August.  However, we may well be able to ship out your bag of tea sooner, and we will let you know based on what tea/s you are interested in pre-ordering.Where and when do I tell you what size and items I want (and other fulfillment details)?  I didn't see it in checkout.  We will contact you and get your preferences once our campaign has come to a close.What challenges will you have for this project?  We have a lot of work to do over the next year.  Not everything will happen at once. We'll be figuring some things out as we go, from the evolution of our menu and how we'll coordinate delivery options, to how the space will evolve to fit our needs.  Fortunately, we have a great team of creative thinkers and go-getters, and we will continue to engage with the community to ensure we will be serving your needs while building a sustainable business.Can you tell me more about the CSK.  What is a community supported kitchen?  Great question. Here's an excerpt from our press release:   "HerBlends of Plenty will be offering community supported kitchen (CSK) shares starting in the summer, allowing customers to sign on as “members” of the kitchen, paying in advance for a set number of seasonal meals per week.  In return, they will receive meals at a more economical rate, and have the option of take-out, delivery or dine-in."                                         Perks:Herbal Teas:  See our webpage for our complete list, and this will be changing as we add more blends to the list.  Keep your eye on it. We will be having more blends and options when we open the teahouse (including "just peppermint" tea) and teas from other local producers. 
Fundraiser banquet, opening night, private parties:  These events will showcase farm-to-table food made by our Executive Chef, and herbal teas made by the HerBlends of Plenty team.  Furthermore, we will have a cash bar during these events.  All of these events will probably fall on a Sunday, but we haven't decided on the opening night, and the private parties may be negotiable to work out a different day.  But the pickier you are on the day, the longer it may take to fit the Avenue's schedule.
The Mug Club:  In addition to the locally made mug and steeper keeper, you will get $1 off your teas for a year at the teahouse.  Additionally, we will have other perks available throughout the year, such as discounts on the menu and for special events, possibly even special events just for the Mug Club.
CSK pre-order:  This will simply lock you in for a CSK share, in case we need to cap the number we offer at first.  The money will be applied towards your CSK share total price.  For more details about the CSK, read our blog and/or see the 2nd to last question on our campaign FAQs.
Wall of supporters:  The wall of supporters will be a piece of art that will incorporate the names of contributors -- or their organization, or a memorial -- and will be hanging at the Avenue Cafe to show our appreciation for our community of supporters.  
Money towards food or tea ($100, $250 and $500 levels):  This will essentially be a gift card, so this will be good toward some good food & tea at "Abundance."  This can not, however, be applied toward alcohol.
"You're Invested:"  This is a perk that will allow you to work with our team in creating a tea blend and other marketing details.  You can help determine the kinds of herbs to go in, and the artwork that will be on the bag.  We have final say, but want you to be happy.  (We only use locally sourced herbs, nothing tropical.)  You will get 1% of all the revenue from bags of that herbal tea blend sold.  Which means, at $7 a bag, that when 2000 bags have sold, (anywhere: out of the Avenue, farmers markets or at local stores; maybe we'll be carried at Whole Foods in the future, who knows), $1400 will have come your way, and more revenue is to come, assuming the tea blend is still selling.  We will determine how often a check is cut to you, but it will not be more than quarterly -- probably once a year to start.  
"Dig iT:" Patti and I are urban farmers, and will happily create a garden in your name, the name of an organization or as a memorial garden.  Obviously, we have the right to refusal: no Monsanto gardens, or hate groups will be promoted.  I doubt anyone would consider it, but we want to cover our bases.   We will work with you in coming up with the details of the garden.  Love lavender?  We can grow a bunch of it at the garden! Additionally, this perk comes with a CSA share (22 weeks of local produce), which is only really applicable for locals, since it won't be delivered.  However, if you're not local, you can have the CSA share donated.

story:
Let us bring you a beautifully crafted cup of coffee. From the roasting to the brewing, our goal is to bring happiness by the cupful. 


Hi! 
My name is Zaid, I am a 26 year old Latino entrepreneur in Kansas City. Over the past few years I have ridden the high seas through squalls and recently arrived at my destination, Pirate's Bone. This indiegogo and shop could not be possible without the help of my friends, the Crew. The Crew consist of friends like Lydia, Nadia, Emily, Christina, my brother Bogart and sister Ambar.  We can't forget about the rest; the Chai Shai crew and all of the great neighbors that believe in us everyday. In that note, I love you all. 
Pirate's Bone is a small neighborhood coffee shop,  where with the spirit of Pirates we would like to sail the shop to success using creativity, passion, and craftsmanship. The community has been extremely supportive and in return we would like to repay them with more awesome coffee beans, tea and crazy mixed drinks.

What we need your support with...

We need really good hearted and cool people like you!!! I swear!!! Mainly because you made it thus far, and we need the support from the community to acquire a commercial espresso machine, a coffee roaster, and some other nicknacks. We also need the money to fix up our back patio, which with your help shall be the nicest place to drink a great cup of coffee. With the funds we raise we will be able to purchase the CBR 1200 Coffee Roaster, that means we get to roast in house! Currently we have an espresso machine that we use for our day to day basis, but it's not meant to be used in a commercial setting. The new espresso machine doesn't have to be the Cadillac of espresso machines, we would definitely settle for a FIAT. 


Kidding, but really; even a used "commercial" espresso machine for this place would be amazing! We wouldn't be able to afford a new machine with our goal, but we are beggars, not choosers.  An espresso machine with character, that is exactly what we are wanting for this space.  We could really keep on doing coffee the way we started, but everyone here deserves more! All of you have given so much support that we would like to contribute back with our skills. Giving you fresh roasted coffee, whether as beans or drip coffee. The same idea goes to having a commercial espresso machine; better service and appreciation. 



 Our Green Promise 


We want to pledge to everyone our commitment to strive for better. Therefore, we will pinky promise to provide people with recycled and recyclable cups and lids. We've recently found out that most coffee cups out there, including ours, cannot be recycled. It's a bummer and we need to change that!  Our Pour-Over/Tea/Drip filters will also be switched to more environmentally friendly filters. We already recycle, but I feel the responsibility to strive for more and help other coffee shops see how it can be done. 



Green Thumbs Up  
...Try to picture this, as you pass through the back door you will be happily greeted with beautiful green vines wrapped around a long lived wooden trellis. The patio will be designed with a rustic harbor aesthetic. Wooden spools will be used as coffee tables accompanied by black metal chairs donated by Chai Shai and a handmade plush rustic bench. Once our indiegogo is successful, we will be able to make the back patio come to life.  In the evenings, our idea is to make the soft glow of mood lights hanging under the clear night sky allow you to fall even deeper in love with our space. 


What is the impact you say? .... You ask, we shall explain.

Lets change the way we look at coffee shops. Lets make Pirate's Bone a place to get to know people, enjoy the company of other humans. Sounds so weird, right?  Lets not get caught up on anything in particular, but focus on what could make things better. We will continue to showcase local artists for free and with open arms. Because we all need a warm hug from local shops. Artists suffer! I used to be one, its hard to showcase your work. Some people don't care, or are simply just interested in showcasing well known artists. So, "Second Fridays" at Pirate's Bone will keep sailing! As always, we will showcase two Artists of any medium, one Musician or band, and one new Food-Truck every month. How awesome is that? REALLY AWESOME! We know. You have to see it to believe it. You'll understand the question about how many Pirates fit on a Pirate's Ship once you make it to a Second Friday event. 


Salvador (Multi-media Artist) 

Susan Odium Art 

-PlantainDistrict

The SUPER awesome -PieHoles


Risks & Challenges

Risk ONE: We suck at making coffee drinks overnight, I guess it could happen; but not likely. Pirate's Bone will keep the same standard day to day. :)
Risk TWO: We end up being really bad at roasting on the new machine! That actually could happen, so keep your fingers crossed!!! Just kidding, we're pretty smart and like a challenge. The new machine will have problems keeping up with us! That's right. 
 Risk THREE: Indiegogo stated "be transparent".  What worries me is that I'm already transparent, maybe too much. 

Challenge ONE: We may pull more than 12 hour shifts, that would stink. They do say even the greatest get to suffer sometimes, so Pirates shall work. 
Challenge TWO: Getting more people from the community to know about us. Because we are a community coffee shop, we need to cater to all of Brookside/Morning Side/49-63rd. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you an artist? Musician? Food truck? Lets talk and book a date for you to be here with us! 

Use the Indiegogo share tools! Help us get this funded. As this will not be the only way we want to contribute to the community with FOOD! COFFEE! and ART!

Thanks for reading! We know it was long, but if it makes you feel any better; I (Zaid) wrote most of it, along with a bunch of help from all of my friends.


Thank you for your time and support. 

Come join me for a cup of coffee soon,


Zaid C.S. 

Pirate's Bone

 Risk THREE: Indiegogo stated "be transparent".  What worries me is that I'm already transparent, maybe too much.

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you an artist? Musician? Food truck? Lets talk and book a date for you to be here with us! 
Use the Indiegogo share tools! Help us get this funded. As this will not be the only way we want to contribute to the community with FOOD! COFFEE! and ART!
Thanks for reading! We know it was long, but if it makes you feel any better; I (Zaid) wrote most of it, along with a bunch of help from all of my friends.

Pirate's Bone

story:
TRACKITO – PROTECT YOUR PROPERTY

Trackito – what is it?
Trackito is a small-sized module capable of tracking and signalling the movements of items in which it is located, and subsequently ensure their monitoring. The module communicates via a mobile application available for Android, iOS and Windows Phone or via a web interface. It functions on the basis of transmitting data using a smart global M2M SIM card, for one price.

3D model:



Operation via mobile app:



Trackito – what can it be used for?
The use of Trackito is very extensive. It can be used for monitoring and protection of bicycles, mopeds, motorcycles, cars and trucks, trailers, semi-trailers, snowmobiles, transported freight, construction and agricultural machinery, prams, luggage and a number of other equipment.
Example: 1 – you are riding your bike or scooter and want to stop somewhere for lunch. You place your bike in front of the restaurant and can rest assured, as the application immediately alerts you if the bicycle is moved. In the event of theft simply turn on the tracking (location detection) and contact, for example, the police with information on its location.
Example: 2 – Trackito is placed in a location within your car and the car is parked unattended. In the event that somebody moves your car, you will instantly know it. In the case of theft simply turn the tracking on (location detection) and contact, for example, the police with information on its location.




Trackito – how does it function?
After purchasing Trackito the module is paired via the mobile application. You can have multiple modules (e.g. for a bicycle and car) and can share modules with other users in one application. The basic functions are module locking and unlocking. When the module is locked and the equipment with the module moves, the application signals an alarm. You can either turn it off or start the tracking function and see where the module (bicycle, car, lorry, motorcycle, snowmobile, etc.) moves.

See the principle on a prototype:


Trackito – why is it unique?
The device includes its own long-life battery, smart SIM card optimised for minimum data consumption, global functionality for an unrivalled price, accelerometer, GSM module and other necessary components.
Moreover, when the signal is lost the GPS position is relocated very quickly (within 3 seconds). The accelerometer can be set to the required sensitivity for specific use. The module size is minimised to 150 x 22 mm. When used in locations where the GPS signal does not reach the tracking equipment, the external antenna can easily be extended by simply snapping the Trackito module. Recharging the battery is simple using a USB cable connected to your computer.




Main advantages of Trackito:

  • Low purchase price for the device (GBP 85)
  • Contains a global smart SIM card with the first year of data operation free of charge
  • The annual price for data is then set at GBP 19
  • It functions for the same price throughout the world (no matter if you are in the USA or in Europe)
  • Extremely long battery life with simple recharging (about 1 year under normal use)
  • The battery condition signaling is included in the application
  • Data for the first year (included in the price of Trackito) is activated upon the first use
  • Extensive possibilities for use
  • Small size which can be stored almost anywhere


Trackito – how was it developed?
We have completely developed and programmed Trackito ourselves. The development of the hardware and software, including the mobile application, was undertaken by leading experts for each specific issue. All of the components were carefully selected and tested, and algorithms with an emphasis on minimal battery consumption and transmitted data size were utilised.

See older and new prototypes:



What do we need?
We have already finished development and testing. We are sure about our product. Our next step is to manufacture injection mold for production. Then we can start production and distribution. Our goal is to produce and sell Trackito worldwide, to build up a distribution network, to find business partners and to let the general public know about Trackito.

story:
Who Is Standing Promises? What is the I AM Conference?

 The mission of Standing Promises Ministries is "helping women find their identity in Christ through love, counsel, and resources." We are a brand new ministry seeking to impact the women of the McAlester area by investing in their lives and offering support as they learn who they are in Christ.
 The I Am Conference is an opportunity for us to bring hope and healing to the women of our community through the testimonies of women in our community. The conference will begin with an evening of praise and worship on Friday and continue with a day filled with worship, powerful teaching from local women on Saturday, access to resources and materials to help grow in a relationship with Christ, and opportunities to connect with other women from the area. 

What We Need

As a brand new ministry, we need help to make this conference happen. We are asking for $50,000 to make this event spectacular. The money will be used to fund a known Christian artist for the Friday evening event, speakers, and a local worship band for the Saturday event. It will also be used to fund all of the up-front costs for promoting the event, merchandise, and conference materials.

The Impact

 James 5:16 says, " Confess your sins to each other and pray for each other so that you may be healed..." By sharing our struggles and our triumphs over them, we are healed and we bring healing to those around us.  At Standing Promises, we believe that when women come together to love and encourage one another and share our stories, God will move in our lives to bring hope and healing.

How You Can Help

 We need YOU to help us by making a financial contribution to our campaign. Consider giving at one of these levels:

     *Donated Ticket-$20

     *Topaz-$50

      *Pearl-$100

      *Ruby-$500

      *Emerald-$1,000

      *Sapphire-$1,500

Other Ways You Can Help

Pray for God's blessing on our ministry and on the I AM Conference.

Spread the word! Tell your family and friends about our campaign and share the link on all your social media sites! Help us reach as many people as possible and make this conference come to life!
story_txt:
Who Is Standing Promises? What is the I AM Conference? The mission of Standing Promises Ministries is "helping women find their identity in Christ through love, counsel, and resources." We are a brand new ministry seeking to impact the women of the McAlester area by investing in their lives and offering support as they learn who they are in Christ. The I Am Conference is an opportunity for us to bring hope and healing to the women of our community through the testimonies of women in our community. The conference will begin with an evening of praise and worship on Friday and continue with a day filled with worship, powerful teaching from local women on Saturday, access to resources and materials to help grow in a relationship with Christ, and opportunities to connect with other women from the area.   What We Need
As a brand new ministry, we need help to make this conference happen. We are asking for $50,000 to make this event spectacular. The money will be used to fund a known Christian artist for the Friday evening event, speakers, and a local worship band for the Saturday event. It will also be used to fund all of the up-front costs for promoting the event, merchandise, and conference materials.
  The Impact James 5:16 says, " Confess your sins to each other and pray for each other so that you may be healed..." By sharing our struggles and our triumphs over them, we are healed and we bring healing to those around us.  At Standing Promises, we believe that when women come together to love and encourage one another and share our stories, God will move in our lives to bring hope and healing.   How You Can Help  We need YOU to help us by making a financial contribution to our campaign. Consider giving at one of these levels:
     *Donated Ticket-$20
     *Topaz-$50
      *Pearl-$100
      *Ruby-$500
      *Emerald-$1,000
      *Sapphire-$1,500   Other Ways You Can Help Pray for God's blessing on our ministry and on the I AM Conference.
Spread the word! Tell your family and friends about our campaign and share the link on all your social media sites! Help us reach as many people as possible and make this conference come to life!

story:
What is "THE RISHI MAZE?"

The Rishi Maze is a new retail business venture that aims to begin operations on May 4th, 2015. The business is what we lovingly refer to as a “Geek Emporium,” a retail outlet that aims to create a community hub for connoisseurs of the geek culture, collectors of higher-end cultural paraphernalia, art, apparel and specialty items that can be manufactured in-house for “cosplayers,” performance artists in which participants wear costumes and fashion accessories to represent a specific character or idea. As the culture promotes equality (or as we call it, "Geekuality") among the genders,

Our mission is to create a community hub for those that enjoy what society refers to as “Geek Culture,” those that are fanatical about science-fiction, fantasy, costume play (“cosplay”), collectibles, video games, and much more. We aim to offer from the highest quality of collectibles to the vintage ones you loved as a kid, the finest and most unique cosplay items, and introduce out own line of costume play items and accessories.


What is "Girl Empowerment?"

From the strong ladies who dress up in full regalia for the conventions, to the quiet ones who wear their favorite hero symbols on their t-shirts and jewelry, and all those in between; From the ladies who wear the revealing variations of their favorite characters to the ones who sport painstakingly intricate and detailed full body armor. The Rishi Maze wants to support and endorse your powerful place in the culture. (After all, females are nearly half the fan-base of the sci-fi/fantasy genres)

As such, we will also carry a line of "stylish, fashion-forward merchandise for female sci-fi fans," as well as cosplay items, apparel and paraphernalia focused to the women that enjoy the richness and diversity of the culture.


The objectives for The Rishi Maze are as follows:

1. To provide Red Deer and the Central Alberta area with quality science-fiction and fantasy-themed collectibles, apparel and artworks;

2. To provide an outlet that manufactures and distributes our own line of personalized 3D-printed toys, collectibles and more, as well as 3D printing services;

3. Give back to the arts community through donations to artistic educational programs;

4. Increase awareness of our business through involvement in community events, conventions and gatherings;

5. To offer specialty gift items for the “geek(s)” in your family;

6. To offer knowledge as well as superior customer service to fans of science-fiction/fantasy;

7. To create an environment, as well as inspire a community, that embraces, supports and promotes equality of not only the genders, but of all lifestyles

Stretch Goal - Monthly Community Events


We already have the basics in place. All funds generated here are going straight back out to collect stock and inventory. Part of our stretch goals (attaining $30,000 or more) will help us in our plan to have monthly community events, designed to bring together the fan base in a variety of functions. Will next month be a gaming tournament? A cosplay gathering? A LAN party? Every month will be a unique event to bring the fans and community together in fun and exciting ways!

What We Need & What You Get in Return!

All funds received will go to further establishing our inventory, most of which will need to be ordered from big name vendors from outside of our borders.

As part of our perks package, some of the perks that we are offering to our contributors:
  • Great "XP Bonus" options, which can be used to accumulate "XP" to be used towards retail purchases;
  • Customized action figures of those who contribute, to show the world what HEROES they are;
  • Fully battle/dueling-ready lightsabers from some of the world's biggest-name vendors!

The Impact on Central Alberta

The Rishi Maze has a vision: To unite the immense fan-bases within Central Alberta, and even the world, through community, events, and our shared love of all things sci-fi and fantasy, cosplay and collectibles.  Having established arrangements with some of the more difficult to attain collectible vendors, we hope to get the items that the fans in the community want!


    Other Ways You Can Help!

    If you can't contribute yourself, then we ask you to please, spread the word about The Rishi Maze! Share this campaign page! Let other fans in our community, and the world, know about what we hope to accomplish! Help us to create the community hub that Central Alberta NEEDS and WANTS!

story:
WHAT IS #MARY2ELLEN?

IT'S AN ADVENTURE! IT'S A JOURNEY! IT'S MAKING THE IMPOSSIBLE, POSSIBLE! IT'S EMPOWERING MILLIONS, BUT NOT WITHOUT YOU!

In order to live my word that anything’s possible and show the power of community, author, Mary Todd (me) is creating an exciting never-been-done-before live sequel to her book, eMolecule: Harnessing Your Entrepreneurial Spirit, by taking an epic tour across the United States with the aim of being a guest on The Ellen Degeneres Show April 6-10, 2015 AND I have partnered with the Africa Yoga Project, so that along the way I can raise awareness and money for this amazing organization. (more on them in a minute...)

[instagram] [pinterest]

HOW IT WORKS

So here's the skinny on me, the campaign, the tour, and why it's so important to me. 

ME = Mary Todd 

I am an author, entrepreneur, speaker, yoga teacher, attorney, and adventurer. Some even say that "[I am] a true visionary that will lead the next generation of thought leaders and action takers," which is pretty cool. I've founded countless businesses, but am most proud of mywork inspiring and educating entrepreneurs--which is what I am doing right now :)

The #mary2ellen Tour

Over the last several months, I have been listening to you, my readers, asking me "What comes next?" Well, my friends and readers, this is what comes next. The future. But we must create it, so why not paint it awesome! 

My work inspiring others is my purpose and my passion, but I realized that writing a book just isn't enough to spread the word and create the impact that I was looking for. It needed to be BIGGER. More importantly, I needed to MEET the people whose lives I am changing through my book and learn more about the people who want change, but are afraid to take that first step. This tour is all about just that. Meeting new faces, making new friends, touching more lives, building a community.

But then I thought, no. This still isn't big enough. There's lots of us out here in the world and We can do better. So I called my friends in Kenya at the Africa Yoga Project and asked how can I and my new community (that's you, in case you were wondering) make a BIG difference?

THIS is what we came up with. I am traveling across this great nation of ours teaching workshops, speaking at universities and big companies, sitting in discussion circles at local coffee shops, and chatting at community book stores for free to raise awareness and money for the Africa Yoga Project. So that together, we build a community of action takers and world changers--to find out what is possible when we unite--oh, and to have fun too! This is life that we're talking about after all! 

WHAT WE NEED + WHAT YOU GET 

So this is what I ask from you: 
  1. Donate $1 or more if you like
  2. Tell your friends and family about this
  3. Share your story with me 
And for you naysayers that are wondering what kind of difference $1 will make, well, they say a picture is worth 1,000 words. I'm no math whiz, but I think it means that a picture made up of words is priceless. Don't you think?

And just in case all of that isn't enough, we have lots of fun and wacky bonuses and gifts to give out to those of you who want want to share more. So check those out too! (and keep checking back because we'll be adding more along the way!)

Oh! and big P.S. all of the apparel that is available through the perks is exclusive to the campaign. These are all one time offers. None of them will ever be printed again in this way, so don't live with regret.


THE AFRICA YOGA PROJECT

 The Africa Yoga Project (AYP for those in the know) is using yoga in a big way to create change in the lives of thousands by creating a culture of empowerment, entrepreneurship, independence, and peace as well as creating economic stability for thousands of youth in Kenya through education and leadership by providing tools to make them employable. 

Through their operation of the Shine Center in Kenya, they empower, educate, and touch over 6,000 people per week! The AYP also provides food and fresh drinking water to those people as well. This is BIG guys! It gives me goosebumps. breathe, Mary. 

Check out the video below to learn more about what they are up to or head over to their website.


INDIEGOGO GOALS

We’re asking for a minimum of $10,000 (USD) which will guarantee that 20 Kenyan young adults will get the training needed to change their lives and empower thousands others through the Africa Yoga Project. This also offsets some of our expenses along our 50-day journey. Additional funds have already been committed to this project making it even more fun to follow along! 

Just to help put it in perspective a little bit:

  • $1 provides fresh water for 8 kids
  • $30  sponsors one sign language interpreter to empower 20 deaf children through yoga
  • $50 buys 20 yoga mats for one of our free outreach classes
  • $125 funds a month salary of one Africa Yoga Project teacher to empower others and create economic stability for their community
  • $250 pays for one Kenyan youth to participate in a comprehensive and transformational week long yoga teacher training


Oh yeah. I guess we should mention that any spillover means we get to give more to the AYP. [PSSST: $50,000 means we can build a whole new Shine Center, expanding the AYP's current reach from Kenya to Uganda!!!]


THE IMPACT

By taking part in this social experiment you yourself are taking charge and being part of a community of change-makers and action-takers. Basically, one strong we cannot affect much change, but when we stand together, well, that's when we can start to change the world. So here's to you, world-changer!

You are putting faith in me to come through and show you that anything is really possible. And like I've said before, I have gone in alone and made it work, but is so much better when we do it together. I've met a lot of really cool people in my life, but have I met you? Have you shared your story with me? Well, now you can. 

Here's to making it happen $1 at a time!


OTHER WAYS TO GET ON BOARD

Okay, so I get it. Sometimes, you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't pitch in too!

  • Hit the pavement (not literally) like me & spread the word in your community
  • Give a shout out on social media--I'd love to hear from you, and I bet others would too

And that's all there is to it. Can't wait to have you along for the ride, too!


FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

What if you don’t reach the campaign goal?
We are committed to making this adventure happen no matter what or how much is raised. This is flexible funding campaign, which means that even if we don't make our goal, whatever is raised will first be used for perk fulfillment and donated to the Africa Yoga Project. After all, the show must go on!


Why did we choose to use Flexible Funding?

We are using flexible funding for two reasons. (1) Because this epic journey is happening no matter what and (2) Because we want to make sure the Africa Yoga Project gets funding even if we don't make the goal.


I'm a vlogger, blogger, podcaster, or just super cool! How can I be in your videos or write ups from the road?

If you are any of the aforementioned and want to be involved in this project, please email me at mary2ellenTour(at)gmail(dot)com with your details (name, age, location, YouTube channel/blog/website/podcast, other info, etc) and we’ll be in touch.

If you want to interview me or have me as your vlog, blog, or podcast guest, please send your requests to Maria at bookings(at)eMaryTodd(dot)com with the pertinent details and we'll get something calendared.


Where and when will the tour be taking place?
Right now we have events scheduled in the following places, with more to come:

  • Normal, IL
  • Milwaukee, WI
  • Chicago, IL
  • Cleveland, OH
  • Columbus, OH
  • Morgantown, WV
  • Richmond, VA
  • Charlotte, NC
  • Atlanta, GA
  • St. Louis, MO
  • Denver, CO
  • Salt Lake City, UT
  • Las Vegas, NV
  • Los Angeles, CA

and more to be announced along the way...

Get the most detailed and up to date information on my Tour Page.

story:
Peace and Smiles is more than just a small business

                  It's a Movement

Rebecca is a poet, photographer, philosopher, and empathy builder.  She knew, when she wrote her first poetic short story for her Grandfather, that she wanted to devote her time to bringing empathy to more people through her short stories.

Peace and Smiles is somewhat like Childrens' books ~ short, whimsical stories to brighten your day. Only they're meant for adults, and they can be personalized.

  • Ready for production is a General Peace &Smiles short story for someone to read to their loved one who is in a nursing home or hospice.
  • The Peace and Smiles campaign is important to her, because there is an entire community of elderly people being forgotten. 
  • Peace and Smiles begins with our wonderful elderly community, and it has the potential to expand much further, spreading empathetic connection to many people.  
  • We can help write vows, toasts, eulogies, dedications, etc.

What We Need

We need help spreading Peace and Smiles.

  • We need a dynamic Web Designer
  • Technology Systems Upgrades
  • Transportation needs 
  • Printed books of the General version to give to Hospices and Nursing Homes

What you will get: Perks

  • We've included several different perks from photographs to short stories to show our appreciation! 

The Impact

  1. In a world where we find much conflict and unease, Peace and Smiles creates connection by building bridges of empathy. 
  • I met a woman for only a moment, whom I stayed in touch with via email. I wrote a Peace and Smiles short story for her to read to her husband who developed cancer. She told me "he has a new will to live." 
  • "The Important LITTLE things in life can be seen more clearly when we close our eyes and open our hearts." ~~ Rebecca Koos

 **Support, Feedback, Sharing, Getting this 'Out There' are also huge contributions!

  • Please help us get the word out and spread our campaign on social websites.
  • LIKE & SHARE us on facebook.
  • Share our campaign with your friends and family !
  • Give us your constructive comments/suggestions/praises to help us thrive.
  • You can support Rebecca if you know a Publisher interested in her General Peace and Smiles book or her Contemplative Images book.
  • When you see a person cleaning a store or building, please go up to them and say, "You make this place look beautiful!."  It is a way to connect and very personal to Rebecca. 

Thank you for your support,

Team Peace and Smiles

When you see a person cleaning a store or building, please go up to them and say, "You make this place look beautiful!."  It is a way to connect and very personal to Rebecca.    Thank you for your support,Team Peace and Smiles

story:
**Please disregard all references to Primal Kitchen in the video, we have been asked to stop using that name and logo.  Please help us create a new name, Thank you!!

We have (formally Primal Kitchen in Ithaca NY) created a meal plan and cafe around the paleo diet. Our goal is to focus on preparing food that is delicious, paleo-inspired, and 100% gluten-free.

We will focus first and foremost on offering the subscrition meal options that we started with, throughout the week.  In the beginning we will offer a lunch subscription option and a dinner subscription option, which we will deliver to a location in Ithaca.  As we grow we will look to include lunch and dinner ala carte options throughout the week from our store front.  Light breakfast options on the weekends will also offer a variation of Bullet Proof Coffee, protein enriched smoothies and fresh juices.

Our establishment will be based on providing healthful, nutritious foods and on providing customers with or without gluten intolerance a satisfying and easy choice for their next meal.  These meals will be delivered to select locations throughout Ithaca and ideally locations in the surrounding areas.

Just because it's gluten free, doesn't mean it has to taste that way!!

We aim to provide a comfortable eatery where people with gluten intolerance, sensitivity or restrictions don't have to ask if the food can be specially prepared.

Phase one of our goal has been in the works for about 4 months now. We have been offering meal subscriptions of four meals a week and have provided our customers with the best produce available; packaged in reusable containers. We currently rent refrigeration at our "commissary" kitchen The Lincoln St. Diner (Thank you Chris for letting us use your kitchen!). Soon we hope to install a small refrigerator at our original pick up location Crossfit Pallas (Thank you Tim & Eamon!) and ideally at an additional pick up at the Nutritional Wellness Center.

We will use the funds from this crowd funding campaign to help us start furnish and renovate the commercial location we have located.  As well as purchase tools and untensils, equipment, hot boxes and coolers for transportation, and also to invest in marketing our products.

With funds from this crowd funding offering and the help of a few local investors, our ultimate goal is to make (formally Primal Kitchen)a reality.

We have been offering meals at the Ithaca Farmer's Market and have been using this venue as a way to introduce our food to a wide audience in the Ithaca area.  There has been a great deal of intrest in our food and offers, with a common question of a permenant location.

With everyones help, we are striving to get a location and plan on bringing Paleo inspired Gluten free meals to you very soon.

Due to our most recent set back with our name and logo, we have lost a few weeks for our campaigne, we are trying to come up with a new name that already isn't taken.  We would really appreciate any support you can provide, the funds will help us with start up costs and now logo and name restructuring.

Thank you!

**Please disregard all references to Primal Kitchen in the video, we have been asked to stop using that name and logo.  Please help us create a new name, Thank you!!

story:
About Sharing the Harvest Community Farm

Sharing the Harvest Community Farm is a non-profit, volunteer-driven farm at the Dartmouth YMCA that grows and donates produce to help fight hunger in our community. All the vegetables grown at Sharing the Harvest are donated, and the farm's overall mission is to reduce hunger, create volunteer stewardship, and provide agricultural education.

As we approach the end of our tenth growing season, we are still battling hunger on the south coast of Massachusetts. Both New Bedford and Fall River are listed among cities with the highest concentrations of hunger in the state, with 1 in 3 children experiencing hunger insecurity (nearly double the Bristol County average of 1 in 5).

As of August 2015 we’ve donated over 63,000 lbs of fresh vegetables this year and with the fall harvest we expect to have more than 100,000 lbs total. That’s 400,000 servings of healthy vegetables that will go to emergency hunger relief efforts in our community. 

What We Need 

Water is critical to our operation throughout the year, from watering seedlings to washing vegetables for donation. As we expand and get better at providing food for our community our need for water also increases, and our current well is not strong enough to keep up with the increased demand. 

As it stands we are able to irrigate or fertilize about 6 rows of vegetables at a time out of the 200+ rows that might need it at any given time. For most of the year we are able to work with this limitation but it significantly limits us early in the season when the plants are young and first getting settled in the field, and on particularly hot days when multiple rows might need water to keep the plants alive and healthy. 

We are looking to you - our friends, family, and community to help raise the funds for an additional well that will provide the water needed to keep our plants healthy. We hope to raise the funds this fall, so that next spring our new crops will be able to thrive and provide food to those in need.

About our perks

For this campaign we’ve chosen not to offer material perks. Instead, our fundraising levels reflect the servings of food your donation will help us grow for people in our community. 

  

If you’d like a T-shirt or other Sharing the Harvest gear we encourage you to come out to the farm to volunteer and talk with us about the project! 

The Impact

We know that we aren't able to feed everyone who is hungry in the South Coast communities of Fall River, Wareham, and New Bedford. In our area there are limited sources of food, and Sharing the Harvest is the primary source of free, fresh produce. Increasing our efficiency through this project will help us to:

  • Improve the overall health of our plants and quality of our vegetables
  • Keep plants alive and well during extreme weather events
  • Allow for the flexibility we need in order to get all plants in the field safely
  • Provide more produce to our community in need on the South Coast

    


Risks & Challenges

Sharing the Harvest has a successful track record of managing volunteers and increasing their engagement every year. We are actively recruiting more volunteers every season, with over 2,000 volunteer visits and 5,000 total hours of service already in 2015. 

Early in the spring our volunteers put in a lot of hours planting in the field. Their hard work pays off for the most part, but it’s often a challenge to make sure that all the young transplants get enough water and a new well would go a long way towards helping the new plants get a good foothold in the soil. Our volunteers put in so much effort to seeding, planting, harvesting, and donating the vegetables and it’s incredibly important for us to do the best we can to care for the plants and keep them healthy. 

Even if we aren’t able to raise all the funds for the new well we will continue to improve our systems and find new ways to get things done effectively on the farm, 

 

As our donations have increased every year our budget has only increased a relatively small amount. We can continue to find ways to make our limited resources work, but investing in a new well will make a huge difference in what we're able to do! Either way - we're excited to share our story and Sharing the Harvest with the community and get the word out about how everyone can help fight hunger on the South Coast!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone is able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  1. Get the word out and make some noise about Sharing the Harvest by sharing our campaign
  2. Volunteer! We’re open for volunteering through November and we'd love to have you help us out
  3. For more information on upcoming opportunities with the farm like us on Facebook – we post regularly to keep our volunteers and friends updated

story:
Here's the 411

We are Kirsten and Quincey, owners of Wanderlust Cafe in Bloomsburg, PA. Our cafe is a vegan, plant-based cafe serving healthy, delicious eats to locals, college students and travelers alike. Wanderlust Cafe is nearly two years old and we aspire to take convenience to the next level. We currently take time to prepare almost everything per each order in a cafe format. With so many people pressed for time but desperately wanting healthy options, we have decided to take many of our items to grab & go status rather than full-service seating. Our vision is to revolutionize the mini mart! Oh yes!

This will involve a slight rebranding:  Wanderlust For Life

Nourishment no matter what direction you're heading.

Where healthy food=NO wait 

With help from our tribe (that's all of you), we envision optimal healthy options for our patrons and a more manageable workload for us. We do EVERYTHING ourselves. This whole venture has been a DIY project and we would like to be able to take some vacations from time to time, being the nature-loving, treehugging wanderlust addicted misfit toys that we are. Our complex recipes and time intensive preparation has prevented us from being able to step away...and if we do, we must close for that to happen. This changes everything!

We will continue making our legendary smoothies fresh at the time of order and have soups hot and ready! We will also make sure that all of the sandwiches and other items on the menu that our customers love can be made using our creations. We don't want anyone to be lost without our Gyspy spread, after all! From our hummus selection, homemade pizza/spaghetti sauce and unique tofeta, to our juices and non-dairy mylks, it will all be available! Oh, and the kale chips.  The kale chips!

What else will we have?

Don't worry, we didn't forget about the Spring rolls! We'll also be adding pre-made salads like lovely massaged kale salads, potato salad, fresh greens salads and more. We've got ya covered with the sweet stuff too, the chia pudding and vagabond bars...plus more new creations! Speaking of new creations:  can we just say vegan sushi rolls!?!

The bottom line is this:

Farm to our kitchen to your destination!

There's no room for additives and unnatural ingredients in our creations. They're too naturally flavorful for all that nonsense! Whole foods for the win!
We are passionate about real food. Food that hasn't been modified or sprayed. Food with the nutrients that our bodies so deeply crave! And we sure know our way around the kitchen!
We haven't always been this way. Both of us have consumed that sad, standard American diet for most of our lives. Then we made gradual changes. Then huge shifts. Our goal is to help others do the same, assist with healthy travels (whether it is one mile or a thousand) and educate at the same time.

Your contributions will be key in that big picture! The only way to change the World is to BE that change you wish to see.  Even better to do it together as a community!

So...where will your money go?

This change means we need to bring on some additional help and purchase display refrigerators, more dehydrators, another high-speed blender, another juicer, huge stocks of ingredient inventory, labels, to-go containers and glass jars and lids for our juices, mylks, teas, infused waters, etc...
We already use compostable takeout containers and will continue to do the best that we possibly can with sustainable business practices. This is of utmost importance to us!
The funds we receive will cover all of our needs and if we aren't fully funded with our $11,111 goal, our intention is to use what we get to proceed with the plan but with some adaptations and gradual inventory purchases rather than massive ones.

Our perks are simply amazing! Did we mention that Kirsten is also an author??? Take a look at them and know that our dream is to do well while doing good. We hope you can find it in your heart to help us in this passionate endeavor!

Of course, there will be challenges!
The one big thing about challenges, though:  WE LOVE THEM! We built this business. We don't know the meaning of "can't" and we never walk away defeated! The thing about life is that it is meant to be an ever-evolving lesson and we dig every single breath we take! Obstacles are meant to be crushed...much like our juicer crushes apples!

Don't have extra funds but really wanna help?

You know what? We understand that. We've been there. A lot!

You can still be a huge part of this!  How?

Use Indiegogo's share tools and help us make some noise about our campaign. Help us go viral. Get it out there. Facebook. Twitter. Instagram. Whatever platforms you use...share the heck out of it every day. Your consistent efforts are SO appreciated!

Our sincere gratitude goes out to every single Being that helps us with this journey.  Much love.  Bless up!

story:
Sometimes small with a big      
     heart succeeds

And sometimes, you’ve just got to grow to compete

We’re one of the original handcrafted bakeries in Brooklyn, New York—and we’re having a tough time. 

We want to preserve the old way of baking—handcrafted, authentic… 

Help us get our café up and running.

The renovation of our retail café at the bakery is almost done!

We’ve installed the electrical work, a new storefront window, front door, a ceiling fan—but we need your help with the last details— a good espresso machine is our main expense—the best cookies you can find need great coffee to go with it.  

"Amy's Cookies was the official Unofficial Cookie of Law & Order and Law &      Order Criminal Intent. Our crew loved them - and film/TV crews are notoriously finicky. Amy even delivered cookies to our picket line during the Writer's Strike in 2008!"
       Rene Balcer - Executive Producer of Law & Order, Law & Order Criminal Intent


WHO WE ARE

Amy’s Cookies is a made-from-scratch artisanal bakery specializing in handcrafted baked goods you can find at some of the top gourmet food stores including Dean & Deluca, Grace’s Marketplace, Butterfield Market, Battery Place Market and more. We want to reach more customers directly. 

No transfats, preservatives or artificial flavoring in Amy’s Cookies.

We specialize in small cookies with a variety of doughs and fillings, using the finest ingredients we can source.  Our doughs are made from scratch in small batches with pure creamery butter, King Arthur flours, Cocoa Barry, Valrhona and Callebaut chocolate, Clearbrook Farms preserves, Nielsen Massey pure vanilla extract, and Boyajian natural oils. 

The very first cookie I sold to Dean & DeLuca was the Raspberry Thumbprint 25 years ago! 

Some of our most popular cookies are Almond Crescents, Key Lime Butter Cream Sandwich, Amy-O – our version of an Oreo made with French chocolate and filled with coffee liqueur butter cream. 
Our newest additions are Salted Caramel Chocolate Sandwich, Salted Caramel Brownies, Cheesecake Brownies, Raspberry Bars. And, according to CBS online, we have the best Gingerbread in NYC!

We’ve got tons of ideas for new cookies, cakes, cupcakes, plated desserts, and more. 

We've been here for 25 years, going strong. 

Amy's Cookies employs 5 talented bakers and 1 bakery assistant. With your help we can keep everyone fully employed, hire more to run the cafe and grow! 


Thank you for reading about Amy’s Cookies and helping us achieve our dream.

story:
Business Overview

·  A proprietary online staffing platform that caters to the temporary staffing needs of small, medium, and large sized firms

·  Innovative freelance job placement site with international growth potential

·  Platform available through the web and dedicated mobile app

·  Sourcing of a world-wide pool of highly skilled professionals

·  Initial focus on high demand IT temporary staffing market, with near term plans to expand to other industries

The proprietary staffing platform will facilitate billing, talent vetting, and background checks. Within the online framework, contingent talent and buyers will establish a marketplace and participate in a process of bidding and interaction using the Company’s services which will include: identity and profile management, skills searching, resume matching, talent ratings and references, and payment terms or negotiations. The platform will derive revenue from businesses seeking the services of the Company’s highly skilled talent pool, and business clients will be charged the competitive rate of 5% of the negotiated service price. 

To facilitate rapid market penetration, the Company will initially target the niche IT temporary staffing sector, which is forecasted to outpace other segments in the next five years due to high average salaries and a shortage of qualified candidates. The Company will incrementally integrate other market sectors (home health care, child care) as specific growth benchmarks are achieved. 

Online Staffing Platform Market Drivers

·  Business clients are realizing that using an online staffing platform saves both time and money. Instead of scheduling appointments to meet with workers face-to-face, they become acquainted with potential candidates online.

·  The freelance work force is growing because professionals can easily upload their credentials and have their profile viewed by a variety of clients from all over the world. They’re also paid faster since the Company verifies the business client’s account and handles payment arrangement.

·  The lower cost, improved performance, and user satisfaction of the online staffing model is actually expanding the use of contingent workers as more organizations can afford to access them and more workers are willing to offer their talent through online media.

A.  Market Opportunity

Demand for this online platform will be driven by the ever increasing size of the freelance labor economy. Due to its variable cost structure and access to a progressively diverse pool of highly skilled talent, demand for freelance workers is growing among companies of all sizes. There are currently 17 million independent workers -- a number that is projected to grow to 24 million by 2020, at which point 50% of the labor force will have worked as a freelancer at some point in their careers.

Strengths

Weaknesses

·  Profitable Business Model: End-to-end integrated automation will keep operation costs minimal.

·  Competitive Pricing: The Company will be able to maintain high gross margins while staying competitively priced in the market.

·  Business Strategy: Focusing on the high growth niche IT staffing market will bolster initial revenues.

·  Establishing Market Reputation: Gaining market traction could be challenging due to the concentration of the current market.

·  Platform Development Time: The platform may take several months for complete development before it can be launched to the public.

·  Strong Existing Market Competition: Elance-Odesk and Freelancer.com.

Opportunities

Threats

·  Shifting Business Landscape: Businesses spent $941 million hiring online via Elance.com and oDesk.com in 2014 and are increasingly relying on building teams of distributed professionals and hiring flexibly as part of their strategy.

·  Market Expansion: Into other industries.

·  High Growth Market: According to SIA, the total value of online staffing annual spend is forecasted to rise form $2Billion in 2014 to between $15 Billion and $47 Billion by 2020.

·  Low Barriers to Entry: Online staffing platforms grew from 10 in 2005 to 150 in 2013. Competition in the industry will likely continue among start up players.

·  Technological Changes: Innovation in platform development will contine to occur. rapidly as the industry evolves over the next few years.

·  Industry Mergers: As with Elance-Odesk, other key industry players could merge to claim greater shares of the market.

The company is a newly founded corporation and is hoping to raise enough capital to complete the platform and put it into action.

The company will be run by the president and vice president which both have over 15 years experience in the industry.

Currently about 30% of the needed cost has been raised and 75k has been put towards the platform development which is designed. The modules have been built and it is in the design phase. We are hoping to raise around 80k to complete this phase and get this platform live.

Even if you cannot help financially, just helping to get the word out there about this campaign will be a great help in it being successful.

Thank you for the time you spent looking at this campaign.

Business Overview
· 
A proprietary online
staffing platform that caters to the temporary staffing needs of small, medium,
and large sized firms
· 
Innovative freelance job placement site with
international growth potential
· 
Platform available through the web and dedicated
mobile app
· 
Sourcing of a world-wide pool of highly skilled
professionals
· 
Initial focus on high demand IT temporary
staffing market, with near term plans to expand to other industriesThe proprietary staffing platform will facilitate billing, talent
vetting, and background checks. Within the online framework, contingent talent
and buyers will establish a marketplace and participate in a process of bidding
and interaction using the Company’s services which will include: identity and
profile management, skills searching, resume matching, talent ratings and
references, and payment terms or negotiations. The platform will derive revenue from businesses seeking the
services of the Company’s highly skilled talent pool, and business clients will
be charged the competitive rate of 5% of the negotiated service price. To facilitate rapid market penetration, the Company will
initially target the niche IT temporary staffing sector, which is forecasted to
outpace other segments in the next five years due to high average salaries and
a shortage of qualified candidates. The Company will incrementally integrate
other market sectors (home health care, child care) as specific growth benchmarks
are achieved. Online Staffing Platform Market Drivers
· 
Business clients are realizing that using an
online staffing platform saves both time and money. Instead of scheduling
appointments to meet with workers face-to-face, they become acquainted with potential
candidates online.
· 
The freelance work force is growing because
professionals can easily upload their credentials and have their profile viewed
by a variety of clients from all over the world. They’re also paid faster since
the Company verifies the business client’s account and handles payment
arrangement.
· 
The lower cost,
improved performance, and user satisfaction of the online staffing model is
actually expanding the use of contingent workers as more organizations can
afford to access them and more workers are willing to offer their talent
through online media.A.  Market
Opportunity
Demand for this online platform will be driven by the ever increasing size of the
freelance labor economy. Due to its variable cost structure and access to a
progressively diverse pool of highly skilled talent, demand for freelance
workers is growing among companies of all sizes. There are currently 17 million
independent workers -- a number that is projected to grow to 24 million by
2020, at which point 50% of the labor force will have worked as a freelancer at
some point in their careers.



Strengths


Weaknesses




· 
  Profitable
  Business Model: End-to-end integrated automation will keep operation
  costs minimal.
· 
  Competitive
  Pricing: The Company will be able to maintain high gross margins while
  staying competitively priced in the market.
· 
  Business
  Strategy: Focusing on the high growth niche IT staffing market will
  bolster initial revenues.


· 
  Establishing
  Market Reputation: Gaining market traction could be challenging due to
  the concentration of the current market.
· 
  Platform
  Development Time: The platform may take several months for complete
  development before it can be launched to the public.
· 
  Strong
  Existing Market Competition: Elance-Odesk and Freelancer.com.

story:
The Fleeting Arms down Gillygate, a brand new pop-up bar/arts venue, has been up and running a month. Originally Monroes Showbar, the landlords abandoned it when it wasn’t making any money, and under the guidance of Brian Furey from The Gillygate pub and Alex Wright from The Flanagan Collective, the interior was transformed by a dedicated team of volunteers painting the walls, scraping carpet glue from the floors and donating furniture. Eventually, Punch Taverns will turn it into a backpackers hostel, but whilst planning permission goes through, it is being run by a collective of creatives keen to make it a successful venture.


Serving coffees, craft beers and unique cocktails, the artistic vibe, pool table and chilled out tunes make it a great place to go for a drink. However, the key incentive of the space is to offer free workshop, rehearsal, exhibition and performance space to whoever would like to use it. All that we ask in return is that drinks are brought over the bar and a donation is made to the running costs of the building.

We at The Fleeting Arms believe that a creative community thrives when it has open access to free space. Removing or reducing the financial risk for artists, musicians and performers can help foster creative risk, boldness of expression and innovation of ideas. 

In return for using the space, we ask that every company, group, or artist donates a cash sum in return. The person who makes the booking takes responsibility for making this donation. We don't set out fixed fees as we feel that this could become discriminatory, and we understand that each project, group or artist will be operating under completely different financial circumstances according to many differing factors. There is one rule: Please Be As Generous As You Can. Look into your hearts and give what makes you feel good. The venue will only continue to be a success if we as a community pull together and all get behind it, and continue to put in as much as we take out of its resources.

Your donation can be given in two ways:

·         Pay a donation online here.

·         Pay a cash amount over the bar on the day of your rehearsal, performance, or workshop booking.

The donations we receive will go into covering the running costs of the building, and help us keep this project going for the creative community of York and will help us to nurture the vast wealth of talent and creativity in our city. Thank you!

story:
What is it?

ComicsCafe.ro is a Comics and Scifi shop located in Transylvania. It currently is an online store collecting funds in order to make the its next step and become a brick and motor comic shop and cafe. 

Meeting the Desires of Romania.

When we talk to friends here in Romania about Comic and Scifi culture we here same thing over and over again. “I wish we could get those things here in Romania”. We at ComicsCafe.ro will make sure that they can obtain the items they are wanting so dearly. Super Hero, Scifi, Fantasy, or whatever pop culture excitement is going on, we want to meet the Romanian public with it. Items form Romania, America, Japan, France and all over the world will made available to our customers in Brasov, Romania.

Why Brasov, Romania?

Focusing on Brasov city is a good place to start for ComicsCafe.ro. Many come to visit the city as a charming vacation spot. As a popular tourist destination, outsiders and Romanians alike gravitate to this city for the history, tradition, sites, winter skiing, hiking, night life, and music events.

Brasov also is the home of many universities, full of excited to students looking for the verity of pop culture curiosities and wonders which the brick and mortar ComicsCafe.ro be housing. 

Why Crowdfunding?

It’s a social thing. We would love to involve you and as many people and companies in our shop’s growth and the growth of Romania’s pop culture scene as possible.  As there are charities built around defending the comic book industry, why not make a way to assist in building on a completely new young, developing comic book culture here in the country of Romania? That’s why we want to meet you hear on Indiegogo.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That doesn't mean you can't help us make a great shop:

  • Inside Romania the best way to help us is to order from our online store at www.comicscafe.ro
  • Have friends in Romania? Items form ComicsCafe.ro make great gifts!
  • Spread the word that ComicsCafe.ro is in Romania and can use their help.

Bring something good to Romania.
