story:
To continue with the local tradition, which stopped in early nineties, the public institution for culture, youth and sport from Litija, Slovenia is preparing the innovative community running event. 

We started in 2013, continued in 2014, now we will organize it for the third year in a row. We learnt that the local environment needs more than just a running event. We need a story!  We broadened the idea and started developing the  new concept which will connect local public institutions, NGOs, companies and the people.There will be two main parts:

- the running event and

- festival of the community.

The running event will promote a healthy lifestyle. The festival of the community will give the opportunity to different stakeholders in the local community (e.g.: NGO's, companies, schools...) to share what they are working on and what they believe in.  The main point of the festival is bringing together the community and establishing  a place for talking, meeting friends, and getting to know new things about the town, spending time together as citizens of Litija.

The event will happen on the 13thof June, 2015. At the same time our town is celebrating its holiday.

We only have the money for the basic programme of the event. The purpose of our campaign here is to raise additional funds to organize a “SUPERTRUPER” event. For us that means:

- fun park for kids,

- music programme,

- eductional part of the event (professional photography lessons).

With 1000€ we’ll make excellent additional activities. With 2000€ we will make a SUPERTRUPER event. With more than 2000€ we will make the best celebration in the history of our town.

We respect the tradition, believe in the community and will promote a healthy lifestyle. With connecting these points we are creating the innovative celebration of our fest.  We believe the community deserves it, we believe we can make it, we can’t wait to make it happen!

story:
Kick off Female Entrepreneurship in Indonesia

Indonesia is the 4th largest population in the world, and also one of the poorest. In this country of 252 million people, half of all households are clustered around the national poverty line of US$24.40 / month. 9 million of those households are also headed by single women.

Wobe Wonder Women aims to give them a fighting chance at earning income, accessing financial services and improving financial literacy.

With Wobe, our women agents can:

  • Earn $5/day by selling phone airtime, internet packages and other prepaid products
  • Function as the 'human ATM or convenience store' for virtual prepaid products in their community
  • Learn tips on financial literacy

Single women who lead households solely are among the most vulnerable of the poor. We target to train 1000 women in such situations and provide them with the tools they need to carry out basic micro-entrepreneurship so as to give their families a fighting chance.

* Recently, we won second place in Dusan Stojanovic's female entrepreneurship competition, which was conducted globally.  Over 150 female-led startups participated, and we came in second out of 12 finalists, earning a donation of 12 000 USD 

This crowdfunding campaign is launched to match this donation so that we can scale up the impact of our work. 

We are a Singaporean and Indonesian company.


What We Need

$25 000 helps us carry out training programs, expand to new cities in Indonesia and also provide additional support such as free mobile internet for our women. We work through local women's NGOs so as to identify the women most in need.

  • We conduct a workshop, provide training materials, and follow up support
  • Most of them don't have smartphones or internet. We source for these through our strategic partners, which are telcos and NGOs and handset manufacturers
$10 000 goes to workshops
$10 000 goes to business credit for women attending our workshops (each $1 in our app credit lets them sell $1 worth of products and services, letting them net around $0.20 profit per sale)
$5000 goes to handset and mobile internet sim card subsidies for the lowest income of our women

The Impact

With 1000 women running a small business from their mobile phones, we expect the following impact.

  • 25% of 1000 to be super agents, making around US$10/day on just 3 key products: phone airtime, electricity vouchers
  • 50% of 1000 to be median level agents, making around $2-5 / day 
  • The rest of the agents to be sporadic, or not familiar with technology, using the app only from time to time
We aim to provide at least $200 000 in total additional income to this group of 1000 women.

Background

  • What does 'prepaid' mean? In Indonesia, everybody uses what would be known in the US as a 'burner phone'
  • Most people have more than one mobile number. It's the ultimate life hack: one sim card for cheap data, another for SMS, another for voice calls
  • Electricity and water also operates on the same principle as a 'burner'. It's all prepaid. Example: you buy $10 worth of electricity for your generator. You key in the account number. With $1 left in the generator, the generator starts beeping and you have to go to 7-Eleven to get a reload
  • Or you are talking to your girlfriend who maybe lives in another city, and your prepaid burner phone runs out of credit. You would also have to go to a 7-Eleven to get a reload
  • Or you could walk to your neighbour's house! If she's a Wobe Wonder Woman, she can send you a reload over-the-air, and you hand her cash
  • Our Wonder Woman makes a little off each transaction. With 10-20 transactions per day she could make $5 daily, which would nudge her family away from the poverty line and towards 'minimum wage'
  • (In the future we will be introducing additional services for them to earn more and learn more)

Risks & Challenges

Travel costs. Indonesia is a huge country.

  • We would need to assume that we get venue rentals at free or very low costs, because of what we do. We try to work with village leaders to get access to village / town halls
  • Our impact could be minimal depending on how much we raise. Our impact is limited to key islands like Java and Sumatra. Anything else would cost thousands of dollars in travel costs.
  • We focus on the key cities and townships of Java and Sumatra for now to gauge further impact

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell people about this campaign!

  • If you work with women's issues in SE Asia, we would love to talk to you
  • If you have other ideas on how you can help, we would love to hear from you

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nicole. I am retired from the Wisconsin Army National Guard after 20-1/2 years of honorable service, a disabled Veteran, a full time student at Concordia University seeking a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Management, unemployed, and a single mother of three wonderful children. I served in a combat zone during Operation Iraqi Freedom from 2009-2010.

My dream to open a coffee shop began while serving soldiers and contractors specialty coffee and drinks through the Chaplain’s ministry during my tour on Camp Taji, Iraq in 2009. I volunteered approximately 240 hours after duty hours for the Chaplain’s Ministry coffee house.

The coffee shop on Camp Taji was a place of respite for many.  It was a home away from home; a place to relax and let your hair down after a long, hot day of work. People of different ages, faiths, and backgrounds gathered to converse, play, and unwind.  Ever since I have left Camp Taji, I have been on a quest to recreate that type of coffee house atmosphere here in the U.S.

Recently, I shared my vision with my friend Dennis. Dennis is this funny, compassionate, single father with a dream of becoming a business owner one day. After listening to the plans, he believed in me, in the vision, and decided he would like to form a partnership to make my dream come true.


What We Need & What You Get

We have a location. The building is located in an industrial area on a busy street off the expressway. It is big enough to accommodate all of the activities we can offer: volleyball court, horseshoe pit, video gaming area, movie viewing area, study area, outdoor lounging areas, and Wi-Fi. We would offer a simple food menu and other beverages besides coffee. The living space attached, along with the coffee shop, would be available for rent.

Currently we are in the process of forming partnerships with people to offer their one-of-kind products and services through our business. The logo is being designed. We are in the process of registering our business name. We will begin to roast coffee and make merchandise with the company name and logo available late summer for purchase.

This is where we need your help. Our goal is to raise $190,000 for the purchase of the building. We are seeking 190,000 people to volunteer a minimum donation of $1. In return, we will offer an incentive program for your help and donation. These are the following incentives:

Incentive #1- All donors will have their name displayed on the premise as a way to recognize the people   who made the opening of the coffee house happen PLUS receive regular updates as how the coffee house is progressing.

Incentive #2- All donors who give $1-$100 will receive ½ off their first purchase of any food, beverage, or merchandise in store or online.

Incentive #3-All donors who give $101-$400 will receive ½ off their first purchase of any food, beverage, or merchandise in store or online PLUS a 5% discount on all additional purchases thereafter.

Incentive #4- All donors who give $401-$1000 will receive ½ off their first purchase of any food, beverage, or merchandise in store or online PLUS a 10% discount on all additional purchases thereafter.

Incentive #5-All donors who give $1001 and up will receive ½ off their first purchase of any food, beverage, or merchandise in store or online PLUS a 15% discount on all additional purchases thereafter.

The Impact

We are excited for the chance for our business to make an impact in communities and on people in the City of Milwaukee. 

We want to create jobs for the most vulnerable; jump start other people's dreams and visions for business ownership and opportunities; and help under-served  children and parents with  resources to help ease situations (example: buy clothes, shoes, school supplies, hats, mittens, books for inner city children, etc.).

We want to take a "pay it forward" approach in our business along with providing an alcohol free, fun, and comfortable environment for every age.

Risks & Challenges

Currently our challenges are going to be remodeling and setting ourselves apart from other businesses such as McDonald's, Dunkin Donuts, and  Starbucks.

Our goal is to provide healthier and less expensive products than competitors in the area. Our customers will love the customer service and environment that we will create. Making it comfortable and economical is our main goal

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to our campaign, we will totally understand. I am an unemployed Veteran and a full time student so I understand how tight finances can be. What you can do for us is spread the word and share our campaign with your friends and families. That would be most appreciated!

We are humbled and honored for even considering a donation that will help our dream to own a coffee house come to fruition. 

Thank you!

Nicole Hyke and Dennis Hebbe
story_txt:
Short Summary 

My name is Nicole. I am retired from the Wisconsin Army
National Guard after 20-1/2 years of honorable service, a disabled Veteran, a
full time student at Concordia University seeking a Bachelor’s Degree in
Business Management, unemployed, and a single mother of three wonderful children.
I served in a combat zone during Operation Iraqi Freedom from 2009-2010. 
My dream to open a coffee shop began while serving soldiers
and contractors specialty coffee and drinks through the Chaplain’s ministry during
my tour on Camp Taji, Iraq in 2009. I volunteered approximately 240 hours after
duty hours for the Chaplain’s Ministry coffee house.
The coffee shop on Camp Taji was a place of respite for
many.  It was a home away from home; a
place to relax and let your hair down after a long, hot day of work. People of
different ages, faiths, and backgrounds gathered to converse, play, and
unwind.  Ever since I have left Camp
Taji, I have been on a quest to recreate that type of coffee house atmosphere
here in the U.S.
Recently, I shared my vision with my friend Dennis. Dennis
is this funny, compassionate, single father with a dream of becoming a business
owner one day. After listening to the plans, he believed in me, in the vision, and
decided he would like to form a partnership to make my dream come true.
   What We Need & What You Get 
We have a location. The building is located in an industrial
area on a busy street off the expressway. It is big enough to accommodate all
of the activities we can offer: volleyball court, horseshoe pit, video gaming
area, movie viewing area, study area, outdoor lounging areas, and Wi-Fi. We
would offer a simple food menu and other beverages besides coffee. The living
space attached, along with the coffee shop, would be available for rent.
Currently we are in the process of forming partnerships with
people to offer their one-of-kind products and services through our business. The
logo is being designed. We are in the process of registering our business name.
We will begin to roast coffee and make merchandise with the company name and
logo available late summer for purchase.
This is where we need your help. Our goal is to raise
$190,000 for the purchase of the building. We are seeking 190,000 people to volunteer
a minimum donation of $1. In return, we will offer an incentive program for
your help and donation. These are the following incentives:
Incentive #1- All donors will have their name
displayed on the premise as a way to recognize the people   who
made the opening of the coffee house happen PLUS receive regular updates as how the coffee house is
progressing. 
Incentive #2- All donors who give $1-$100 will receive
½ off their first purchase of any food, beverage, or merchandise in store or
online.
Incentive #3-All donors who give $101-$400 will receive
½ off their first purchase of any food, beverage, or merchandise in store or
online PLUS a 5% discount on all
additional purchases thereafter.
Incentive #4- All donors who give $401-$1000 will receive
½ off their first purchase of any food, beverage, or merchandise in store or
online PLUS a 10% discount on all
additional purchases thereafter.
Incentive #5-All donors who give $1001 and up will receive
½ off their first purchase of any food, beverage, or merchandise in store or
online PLUS a 15% discount on all
additional purchases thereafter.

The Impact We are excited for the chance for our business to make an impact in communities and on people in the City of Milwaukee. 
We want to create jobs for the most vulnerable; jump start other people's dreams and visions for business ownership and opportunities; and help under-served  children and parents with  resources to help ease situations (example: buy clothes, shoes, school supplies, hats, mittens, books for inner city children, etc.).
We want to take a "pay it forward" approach in our business along with providing an alcohol free, fun, and comfortable environment for every age.
    Risks & Challenges Currently our challenges are going to be remodeling and setting ourselves apart from other businesses such as McDonald's, Dunkin Donuts, and  Starbucks.
Our goal is to provide healthier and less expensive products than competitors in the area. Our customers will love the customer service and environment that we will create. Making it comfortable and economical is our main goal
    Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot contribute to our campaign, we will totally understand. I am an unemployed Veteran and a full time student so I understand how tight finances can be. What you can do for us is spread the word and share our campaign with your friends and families. That would be most appreciated!

We are humbled and honored for even considering a donation
that will help our dream to own a coffee house come to fruition. 
Thank you!
Nicole Hyke and Dennis Hebbe

story:
We are raising funds to build a totally solar powered  house in Jamaica. The cost of electricity in Jamaica is approximately 38 US cents per kWh. This is one of the highest rates in the world. Many of the electricity generating plants in Jamaica are old, outdated and inefficient. They still use diesel fuel to generate electricity, which is not very environmentally friendly.

We designed this house to accommodate solar panels on the roof. The environment is very important to us. We want this house to be our contribution to saving the environment and as an example to other home builders to build for the environment, to be more environmentally  friendly.

CONSTRUCTION
Homes in Jamaica are constructed of rebar and reinforce concrete. This construction as proven to be very effected against hurricane and earthquakes, which Jamaica is very prone to.


LOCATION


This is the community and the lot where the house will be constructed. It is a  middle class community name Greendale in the Parish of St. Catherine, 30 minutes outside of Jamaica's capital, Kingston.

ESTIMATE FOR SOLAR PANELS

         

 You will be looking at J$1.5-$2M battery system that would still have JPS as your back and offset 90%-100% of your usage possibly. The banks will lend up to $2m on green loans based on collateral if you were not purchasing cash.
 Estimate courtesy of Solar Buzz.
Solar Buzz Jamaic ; twitter.com/solarbuzzja

facebook.com/solarbuzz; facebook.com/xdcaribbean

c: +1.876.875.9542 ; o: +1.876.906.4693

story:
Hey Card Collectors! This one's for you! From sports cards to gaming cards to movie/TV cards and more...

Hi folks. I'm Steve Aldridge, your humble inventor. I'm currently seeking funds to get a patent. What I'm after is a Provisional Patent. It's not like a regular patent in that I can't sue anyone who makes it without my permission. What a Provisional Patent does is says that I'm the one who invented it so no one else can patent it. The Provisional Patent gives me a year to file for a regular patent.

So what's the invention? Well, since revealing it would make this exercise futile, I'll just say that for anyone who collects cards, they'll want it. I'm very confident in my invention.

So what will I do with the funds? All of the money goes directly to my Patent Attorney. As soon as he receives the check, he'll go to work.

What's my ultimate goal? Once I receive the Provisional Patent, I will begin negotiations with major trading card manufacturers. Seeing as how I cannot produce it on my own, they are the essential part in bringing it to market.

How will I do this? My attorney has much experience in negotiating licensing. I'm confident we can come to an arrangement that gets my product out to the millions of collectable card fans out there. 

How can you help? Well, money for one. lol Every little bit helps. However, if you spread the news, that's helpful as well. The more people know about this, the greater my chances for success.

So what are the perks? For the highest contributor, if I'm successful, it's a dinner out in NYC! Just tell me what kind of food you like, meet me there, and we'll enjoy a meal together. I'll explain my process of invention and the ins and outs of getting a patent.

Thank you all in advance.

So with that...let's make a dream come true!

story:
Summary

My name is Anar Hasanov, I am 26 years old, I'm an entrepreneur who lives in Istanbul, Turkey. I have graduated from European University in Switzerland with a BBA in Business Administration and MBA in International Business. 

I am trying my best to develop my first personal project. I have been living here for 3 years now and I have developed a broad network of influential friends. I also have some support from my family.

My idea is to develop a snake farm for venom extraction, with my company being Venomach™. The global demand for snake venom currently exceeds the supply available, primarily because there is a constantly growing need for anti-venom and research. This market is still growing and flourishing.

However, it is not an easy task to accomplish as there are several strict legislations, regulations, risks and conditions that have to be met/overcome in order to successfully establish such a facility.

Most sincerely and honestly, I currently don't have any funds at my disposal for such a project and the project is at its earliest stage of being simply an idea. However I do not want to miss such an opportunity as I know I have the required network of contacts that can assist me and can grant me the necessary authorisations and general support.

Your contribution is the only source of financial support at the moment and would allow me to at least start the project promptly and seriously.

What I Need

The capital needed for such a project is unfortunately not small, preferably minimum $200,000 USD. If I won't be able to reach my target, whatever I can accumulate will be spent on starting, or if possible, completing some of the essential requirements step by step. These steps include some of the following:

  • Acquisition and purchase of all licenses
  • Company setup/registration costs
  • Land rent for the location of the facility
  • Light construction to create an indoor facility with heating and lighting which is essential to create the appropriate environment for the snakes
  • Equipments; terrariums, lab tools, fridges, protective gears, emergency equipment, security equipment, etc.
  • Hiring a team of minimum 4 staff
  • Finding and hiring the right experts to train the staff
  • Searching for a supplier of snakes in Africa or Asia, then purchasing and importing the snakes
It is very important to create the right conditions and environment for animals such as snakes as they are sensitive to temperature changes and captive conditions. One of the major goals of the company will be to make sure that the environment is both comfortable and safe for both the animals and the staff, hence the reason why the above points are essential and costly.

There are obviously other extra expenses in between and during some of these objectives, but I don't think it is necessary to explain every detail as it would take too long, I hope these few points make it as clear as possible.

The major advantage that I have is having a close cousin who is familiar with this business as he has some experience. I also have a close friend/business associate who has a construction company therefore the costs for the facility will be as low as possible. Considering that the project is going to be in Turkey, it makes it easier to negotiate and bargain with everyone (even the authorities) since it is a cultural aspect of daily life and thus also in business.

Rewards

Good cause and ethics ought to be the key factors in developing and driving every project into existence. This is the work philosophy I believe in and try to practice. There is no doubt that I intend on doing this project not as a charity but as a potentially profit generating business, however I do believe it is something that contributes to a greater cause. 

There is great potential in researching snake venom and even other forms of venom from different species. Already certain medications and substances require the production and constant supply of snake venom and more is needed for research.

Your contribution would be most appreciated. If I can reach my goals and the company starts to supply venom and generate income, I hope to create a magazine for Venomach. Donors will get the first edition posted to them exclusively before anyone else, along with a surprise gift (don't worry, no live snakes or venom) for those who can afford to donate more. Please make sure you provide an address.

Risks & Challenges

I am confident that I can overcome the bureaucratic challenges, which is potentially the only major obstacle (other than financial) that could cause delays. 
Firstly, I have a very clean record as an individual and as a businessman, I also have sufficient business acumen and experiences (7-9 years). Like I mentioned previously, I also have a strong network of contacts and influential people in related fields.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, then please try spreading the word or sharing the post. Thank you very much.

Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or advise you would like to give, it would also be much appreciated.

story:
What are we?

Bears on Board, Inc. is a non-profit founded by Jim and Paul Pietro in 2002. Bears on Board provides teddy bears to police officers, fire fighters, rescue personnel and social workers to give to children in times of crisis. The program has donated over 15,000 bears to the Worcester and various other police and fire departments and several thousand to the Department of Children and Families. Employees volunteer their time to fundraise, “bear-raise”, plan special events such as the Teddy Bear Picnic and bag each bear for its journey to help a child in need.

What We Need

We have had increasing support for our cause and are attempting to make a big leap forward this year. We want to expand our reach past just central Massachusetts and eventually attempt to provide for the whole country. We have given emergency response organizations over 10,000 bears so far in the central massacdusettes area alone, and they always need more. With the 15,000 we hope to raise, we could expand our reach out of Massachusetts to the surrounding states and then even farther.

The Impact

The feedback received has been tremendous.  The Bears on Board Program has eased the stress that police and fire personnel experience and at the same time reduced the trauma for children who experience very scary and unsure
times when a stranger must take them away for whatever reason.

A Worcester Police lieutenant told the story of a mother with four young children who showed up at the police department with nothing but the clothes on their backs.  They were running from an abusive husband.  While getting the family into a safe house, the police officer gave each of the children a teddy bear.  The officer said, “I wish you could see the faces of the children.  It’s a good thing you’re doing.”

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate at the moment, there are plenty of other ways you can help. Simply send in your new teddy's to 93 Stafford street, Worcester MA 01603 or if you are in the area volunteer your time! Our organization is completely made up of volunteers so we always need the help. 


For more information visit www.bearsonboard.org

story:
Short Summary

  •  Hello, my name is John Schlobach and worked in manufacturing for over 39 years.
  • I want to get Buddycup in the hands of everyone who likes to shop while pushing a cart and enjoy their beverage stress free.
  • With you help, Buddycup will become a household name. Beverage Kiosks in Grocery and Department stores will also benefit.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

  • The $25,000 will help get the mold created and to get started with manufacturing 1,000 units. Money needs to fund an art department for the packaging layout. Also, to get my website established.
  • What about a personal To-Go cup with the Buddycup logo? Tee shirts are also to be available.
  • If the goal is not met the funds received will go to the mold and manufacturing.

The Impact

  • Buddycup will get more consumers on board to enjoy a to-go cup beverage while shopping with a cart.
  • I have an armful of completed surveys from people I don't even know praising Buddycup and cannot wait until it is available.
  • This project took under two years to evolve. I constantly went out testing all kinds of shopping carts with my models and going back to the shop to make it better. You will not be disappointed when using Buddycup.

Risks & Challenges

  • Of course starting up manufacturing can be a bumpy road. Samples must be measured and tested.Quality Control will be ongoing.
  • Visiting the manufacturer and being hands on with the development is key to success.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, no problem, please, I ask you to spread the word to all you friends and relatives. Together we can revolutionize our shopping habits.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out. How convenient is that?

story:
Short Summary

 

Archangel Armory LLC is a family owned and operated company, run by my wife and I. Our goal is to create affordable quality ammunition using state of the art methods and only the finest quality components.  All of our products will be 100% made in the USA using components sourced from US companies.

Funding will go to the purchasing the presses, dies, additional equipment, start up inventory of components, advertising, and miscellaneous start up costs.

We are offering several perks for those who assist us in getting started.

$10 Gets you a Limited Edition start up T-Shirt.  These will only be available to those who donate.

$50 Gets you the T-Shirt and (2) 50 round boxes of either .380 ACP or 9mm Luger.  Donors choice

$100 Gets you the T-Shirt and a 1/4 case (250 rounds) of either .380ACP or 9mm Luger.  Donors choice

$500 Gets you the T-Shirt and a full case (1000 rounds) of either .380 ACP or 9mm Luger.  Donors Choice

$1000 Gets you the T-Shirt and (4) cases of either .380 ACP or 9mm Luger.  Donors choice.

 

Restricted Shipping States

It is your responsibility to know your state laws regarding ammunition and firearm related product purchases. Check for other Local & State laws before ordering. We comply with ALL local, state, and federal laws. The following list of state and local laws is NOT represented to be all inclusive of the 50 states’ numerous firearms, ammunition and magazine laws. You must be aware of any Federal, State, and Local Laws Relating to Ammunition Purchases and is your responsibility to know these laws and not knowingly break these laws by placing an order.

For the following mentioned restricted areas requiring subsequent documentation. Orders will be processed & retained until the sufficient documents are submitted All of these mentioned required documents MUST be current, valid, & completely legible. Ammo can only be shipped to the address on these said documents.

RESTRICTED AREAS

ILLINOIS CUSTOMERS:

Instructions for Illinois Ammunition Shipments: FOID cards AND state photo ID submitted by e-mail - archangelarmoryllc@gmail.com.  These MUST be current, valid, & completely legible. FFL Dealers must provide a copy of their FFL.

MASSACHUSETTS CUSTOMERS:

Instructions for Massachusetts Ammunition Shipments: We cannot ship ammunition to MA residents directly. Orders made must be shipped to a FFL dealer or to a valid License to Sell Ammunition Permit holder. A copy of the FFL MUST be emailed to archangelarmoryllc@gmail.com, before items can be shipped.

NEW JERSEY CUSTOMERS:

Instructions for New Jersey Ammunition Shipments: New Jersey Firearms/Ammunition Identification Card must accompany ammunition orders for first time. Firearms/Ammunition ID card can be submitted by e-mail -archangelarmoryllc@gmail.com

ALASKA CUSTOMERS:

No ammunition shipments.

CALIFORNIA CUSTOMERS:

No shipments of ammunition delivered to the counties of Marin, Napa, San  Francisco, Yolo and Ventura. No ammunition delivered to the Cities of: Berkley, Carson, Los Angeles, Oakland, Sacramento and San Francisco. Check for other Local & State laws before ordering.

CONNECTICUT CUSTOMERS:

Instructions for Connecticut Ammunition Shipments: A legible copy of state issued identification and one of the following is required to purchase ammunition: A valid CT permit to carry a pistol or revolver OR A valid CT long gun eligibility certificate OR A valid CT ammunition certificatecan be submitted by e-mail -archangelarmoryllc@gmail.com

HAWAII CUSTOMERS:

No ammunition shipments

 

Absolutely no ammunition will be shipped to addresses outside of the continental United States.

All donors will receive their items within two months of the end of the campaign if we receive full funding. Otherwise it could take longer to process all of the donations, but you will get the perk you donate for.

If we don't reach our funding goal we will still use what ever funds we receive to get Archangel Armory off the ground and flying.


The Impact

Our long term goal in 5 years is to open a shooting range and retail side of Archangel Armory LLC. Our focus will be to employee Veterans and be able to support local business and donate to local Schools, and many other local and national Charities.

  • Give back to those in the Community
  • Educate on  gun safety and additional training.
  • Make it real for people and build trust.
  
 

Other Ways to help

Spread the word and pass this on to others .
story_txt:
Short Summary Archangel Armory LLC is a family owned and operated company, run by my wife and I. Our goal is to create affordable quality ammunition using state of the art methods and only the finest quality components.  All of our products will be 100% made in the USA using components sourced from US companies.
Funding will go to the purchasing the presses, dies, additional equipment, start up inventory of components, advertising, and miscellaneous start up costs.
We are offering several perks for those who assist us in getting started.
$10 Gets you a Limited Edition start up T-Shirt.  These will only be available to those who donate.
$50 Gets you the T-Shirt and (2) 50 round boxes of either .380 ACP or 9mm Luger.  Donors choice
$100 Gets you the T-Shirt and a 1/4 case (250 rounds) of either .380ACP or 9mm Luger.  Donors choice
$500 Gets you the T-Shirt and a full case (1000 rounds) of either .380 ACP or 9mm Luger.  Donors Choice
$1000 Gets you the T-Shirt and (4) cases of either .380 ACP or 9mm Luger.  Donors choice.
 
Restricted Shipping States
It is your responsibility to know your state laws regarding ammunition and firearm related product purchases. Check for other Local & State laws before ordering. We comply with ALL local, state, and federal laws. The following list of state and local laws is NOT represented to be all inclusive of the 50 states’ numerous firearms, ammunition and magazine laws. You must be aware of any Federal, State, and Local Laws Relating to Ammunition Purchases and is your responsibility to know these laws and not knowingly break these laws by placing an order.
For the following mentioned restricted areas requiring subsequent documentation. Orders will be processed & retained until the sufficient documents are submitted All of these mentioned required documents MUST be current, valid, & completely legible. Ammo can only be shipped to the address on these said documents.
RESTRICTED AREAS
ILLINOIS CUSTOMERS:
Instructions for Illinois Ammunition Shipments: FOID cards AND state photo ID submitted by e-mail - archangelarmoryllc@gmail.com.  These MUST be current, valid, & completely legible. FFL Dealers must provide a copy of their FFL. 
MASSACHUSETTS CUSTOMERS:
Instructions for Massachusetts Ammunition Shipments: We cannot ship ammunition to MA residents directly. Orders made must be shipped to a FFL dealer or to a valid License to Sell Ammunition Permit holder. A copy of the FFL MUST be emailed to archangelarmoryllc@gmail.com, before items can be shipped. 
NEW JERSEY CUSTOMERS:
Instructions for New Jersey Ammunition Shipments: New Jersey Firearms/Ammunition Identification Card must accompany ammunition orders for first time. Firearms/Ammunition ID card can be submitted by e-mail -archangelarmoryllc@gmail.com
ALASKA CUSTOMERS: 
No ammunition shipments. 
CALIFORNIA CUSTOMERS: 
No shipments of ammunition delivered to the counties of Marin, Napa, San  Francisco, Yolo and Ventura. No ammunition delivered to the Cities of: Berkley, Carson, Los Angeles, Oakland, Sacramento and San Francisco. Check for other Local & State laws before ordering. 
CONNECTICUT CUSTOMERS: 
Instructions for Connecticut Ammunition Shipments: A legible copy of state issued identification and one of the following is required to purchase ammunition: A valid CT permit to carry a pistol or revolver OR A valid CT long gun eligibility certificate OR A valid CT ammunition certificatecan be submitted by e-mail -archangelarmoryllc@gmail.com 
HAWAII CUSTOMERS: 
No ammunition shipments
 
Absolutely no ammunition will be shipped to addresses outside of the continental United States.
All donors will receive their items within two months of the end of the campaign if we receive full funding. Otherwise it could take longer to process all of the donations, but you will get the perk you donate for.
If we don't reach our funding goal we will still use what ever funds we receive to get Archangel Armory off the ground and flying.


The Impact
Our long term goal in 5 years is to open a shooting range and retail side of Archangel Armory LLC. Our focus will be to employee Veterans and be able to support local business and donate to local Schools, and many other local and national Charities.

  Give back to those in the Community Educate on  gun safety and additional training. Make it real for people and build trust.        Other Ways to help
Spread the word and pass this on to others .

story:
vagabond coffee co. 


Short Summary

First thank you for taking a moment of your day to join us in our campaign.

In case you don't know that much about us here is a brief introduction:  We are a flourishing young business that specialize in Craft Coffee in the heart of Jacksonville, Fl. We have been in business for just over 8 months and have experienced amazing growth and support from our community. We currently sell coffee from our vintage 1967 caravan and private events around the city. 

We are taking a huge step and expanding into our first brick and mortar location, in the next month... We have 80% of the funds that we need to make the shop happen but we need our community's help to make up the last 20% of the funds we need to open in the next month. The funds will go directly toward completing the build out as soon as possible. 

Why we need your help: 

Over the past month we have been working as hard and as fast as possible to build-out our new location. But as many may know, running a small business is harder than you think and things always cost more than you project. 

As some of you may know, we have been a part of "crowd funding" before, which made us a little hesitant to take this step; however, after many people have asked us how they can help and encouraged us to use crowd funding again we decided this was our best step forward. 


The Campaign

So we are approaching this differently than last time and different than most crowd funding campaigns. We are going to throw a big launch party and we want you to be there! Here is how it will work. 

  • We are asking for at least 250 people to contribute $30 or more to help us reach our goal. 
  • Contributors will receive entrance to our Launch party & will receive: 1 coffee drink and samplings of our new baked goods menu, also every person that enters will recieve a prize envelope that will contain a special gift. 

    • *Gifts include: (one of the below) 

    - One free menu item.

    - Gift cards ranging for $5 to $200.

    - One person will receive COFFEE FOR A YEAR! (a cup a day for for 365)  

  • If you feel inclined to give less or more than the perks listed please feel free to. (If you contribute $30 or more you will be given entrance to the Launch party)


Other Ways You Can Help

If you contribute or not please help us get the word out about Vagabond Coffee and our first Brick & Mortar location in Murray Hill. 
Thank you for being apart of our story. 
Journey Well, 
Vagabond Coffee Co.

story:
Talking Waters Brewing Company was a dream of  three friends who share a love for craft beer and want to share it with everyone else.  We are excited to say that our dream is becoming a reality but we can't do it alone.  We need your help.  We want to be your neighborhood brewery and meeting place where everyone can come in, relax and enjoy exceptional beer with great friends.

We will utilize a small 5 barrel brewing system that will allow us to focus, first and foremost, on quality but also allow us to craft interesting seasonals and and experimental beers.  We have dreams of barrel-aged imperial stouts and funky sours to awaken the taste buds and push the limits of beer drinkers in this beautiful river valley that we call our home.
Your contribution will help us finalize construction throughout the taproom and brewery space, buy two shiny fermenters that will keep your beer nice and cozy as the yeast work their magic, obtain glassware, and pick up some odds and ends for the brewery like pumps, hoses, and fittings.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not all folks have the ability to help monetarily and that's okay!

There are other ways that you can contribute to the startup of the Talking Waters Brewing Company:

  • Make some noise, and share this page by word of mouth!
  • Share this page on all forms of social media. The more people we can reach, the greater chance we have of reaching our goal. Indiegogo has share tools to help you!
  • Share our Facebook page with your friends.  The more people we can get following us, the greater chance for success we will have.
  • If you can't or don't want to donate monetarily but still want to help, we can always use a helping hand at the space with our continuing renovations. 
  • Visit us once we open! We will be happy to share a drink with you, or simply shake your hand for taking the time to check out all of our hard work!

story: The goal of the A Road For The Cure Foundation is to raise money for pediatric oncology patients in the Broward County Community of South Florida. Many of these children stay at hospitals for extended periods of time, and the A Road for the Cure Foundation works hard to make them as comfortable as possible. Our events make a huge difference in their lives by allowing the children to take their minds off their illnesses and instead have fun with our dedicated volunteers. During the holidays, we use our funds to buy presents for the children at the hospital and throw a winter holiday party. In addition to the holiday party, we host various activities to brighten their day. All the proceeds from this campaign will go to projects that directly improve the treatment facilities in hospital settings in the Broward Community.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone, Thanks for checking out our campaign
We own a small community based website to help out online sellers, retailers, wholesalers and dropshipper's expand there sales and businesses for free, giving them an international exposure and more sales.

What We Need 

This website is free to use, we don"t take fee's from sellers or buyers. All the costs from hosting, server, seo and Advertising comes out of our pocket. Were doing this campaign to give our website a bigger exposure to the world to help out more small businesses.


Who Are We

We have sellers signed up from he United States, Australia, China, Hong Kong, Canada and the Middle East. We want to continue helping small retail businesses across the globe for many years to come.

Our website  www.eventstrade.net  is an online marketplace and is 100% free to use. Sellers can set up a personalised store with unlimited products, there company/ business logo and a redirect to there own website.


What You Get

Please check out or perks, if none of these things are your thing, we can do a custom perk for you, please contact us.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know money can be a bit hard at times and a lot of people cant donate to us, but please tell people about us, If you know someone who's been suspended or banned from eBay, or someone who has an online store who's not getting many sales would be great.

THANKS A LOT.


CONTACT US-  www.admin@eventstrade.net

story:
Nós Mesmas nace, hace casi 7 años, de un grupo de mujeres dispuestas a todo con un objetivo:


Eliminar la discriminación, social y legislativa, que sufrimos las personas homosexuales, bisexuales y transexuales.
Y esto...sigue siendo necesario? Estamos convencidas de que sí. Por que sigue habiendo discriminación laboral de las personas transexuales, por que un 17% de lxs jóvenes LGTB confiesan que se ha intentado suicidar debido a su orientación, por que quieren excluir a las parejas de mujeres de la reproducción asistida por la sanidad pública diferenciándolas así de parejas heteros, por que sigue habiendo tribunales que legislan discriminando hasta nuestra sangre, por que ser gay, lesbiana, bisexual o transexual sigue estándo perseguido y duramente castigado en muchos países y en España somos el colectivo que sufrimos más delitos de odio....y un largo etcétera que queremos acortar.
Pero sabemos que para construir una sociedad igualitaria, real y duradera, los cimientos deben ser sólidos y esto solo lo conseguiremos con el apoyo y la concienciación de todas y todos!
Para ello, organizamos en Vigo una Semana Cultural del Orgullo LGTBI donde compartir nuestras inquietudes con toda la ciudadanía, implicando, desde peques a mayores, en la construcción de una ciudad igualitaria con la Diversidad sexual y de género.

Qué es lo que tenemos pensado: 

Desde Nós Mesmas queremos llenar el mes de junio de actos sociales, educativos y reivindicativos, que alejen del imaginario la idea de Orgullo que los medios nos han enseñado y que desvirtúan la problemática que queremos visibilizar y erradicar en días señalados como estos.

[las fechas indicadas no son las definitivas, fíjate en cada actividad!]

-Realizar una actividad en la que todxs puedan participar, el momento para visibilizar la diversidad familiar, aprovecharemos el buen tiempo para realizar la Ruta de Senderismo del Río Lérez. Domingo 21 de Junio (fecha definitiva, horario y lugar de salida por concretar)

-Acercar a los barrios la diversidad afectiva y sexual a través de la cotidianidad de la fotografía de Javier Piñeiro y la exposición "Abrindo portas: visibilizando a diversidade". Este conjunto de fotografías rotara durante el mes de Junio por diferentes centros sociales de la cuidad, haciendo especial hincapié en las zonas rurales del municipio. Del 1 al 28 de Junio (fechas y lugares NO definitivos).

-Proyección cortos finalistas y ganadores del Festival La Pecca 2015, contaremos con la alguno de los directores de los cortos que nos hablarán sobre su experiencia y su visión para captar la diversidad a través de sus cámaras. Miércoles 24 de junio, a las 19h en el Museo MARCO (fecha, lugar y horario definitivos)

-Mesa redonda "Transexualidad: de niños/as a adultos/as" en está mesa, y a través de la experiencia de personas trans y familiares de menores trans, conoceremos cómo es su situación actual, los retos a los que se enfrentan y en que centran su trabajo la Asociación de Familias de Menores Transexuales. Viernes 26 de Junio, a las 19h en el Café Hashtag,  (fecha, lugar y horario definitivos)

-MANIfiestACCIÓN, bajo el lema "Orgullo es reivindicación" recorreremos las calles del centro de Vigo por que Orgullo es sinónimo de manifestación, sin carrozas, sin mercantilismo, celebrar reivindicando que nuestros derechos siguen sin ser los mismos, que la discriminación aún existe y que cada cuál es libre de amar a quién quiera. Sábado 27 de Junio, a las 20h (fecha y hora definitivos, lugar de salida aún por concretar)

-Fiesta Diversa, finalizaremos la manifestación celebrando todo lo conseguido hasta ahora y visibilizando que somos muchxs lxs que vamos a luchar por alcanzar lo que nos queda. Habrá conciertos, performance y Dj que pondrán el broche final a la Semana Cultural del Orgullo LGTBI. Sábado 27 de Junio, al finalizar la manifestación (lugar y artistas por concretar)


Para esto necesitamos tu contribución:

Para Nós Mesmas, al ser un colectivo pequeño y sin apenas financiación, abarcar la organización de todos estos actos junto con todos los obstáculos que, año tras año, nos encontramos, es un riesgo que afrontamos porque sabemos que merece la pena, por que solo saliendo a la calle y visibilizando nuestra realidad, ayudamos a que otrxs puedan hacer lo mismo y vivir libres de coerciones.
Este crowfounding es una forma más de recaudar los fondos necesarios, aproximadamente un total de 6500€ que intentamos recaudar además con fiestas solidarias, venta de merchandaising, la fiesta diversa y, esperamos, subvencionando parte del gasto.
Con esta acción, solicitamos tu contribución para cubrir los 1300€ iniciales, que irán si o si, a la organización de esta semana que tendrá un mayor o menor impacto dependiendo del total recaudado, siempre recortando en los actos y acciones con menos contenido (fiesta, cartelería, etc).
Con todo esto, queremos garantizar la transparencia en la gestión de los fondos y por tanto, del compromiso que adquirimos contigo cuando decides contribuir con Nós Mesmas.

Te lo devolveremos...

y así es! por que TE LO MERECES! hay una larga lista de recompensas vinculadas a las donaciones, sabemos que no será suficiente para agradecértelo, pero la acción genera cambio, y gracias a ti, todxs disfrutaremos del cambio que tu contribución hace posible.


Recuerda! siempre es posible ayudar, difunde está campaña por tus redes y danos voz!!!


GRACIAS!!

story:
If your employees experienced less conflict and built better working relationships would this be a happier and more productive workplace with improved business revenue?

We can make that happen and need your support and funding for a #survey #tech project. In return we are providing leadership and training perks for small business owners, HR directors, managers and companies desiring more cooperation between among employees and collaboration between departments.

The solution is our 360 Team Behavior Survey, which takes all the  guess work out of how to support and improve teams and their leaders. The TIGERS survey measures six principles that transform adequate teams into exceptional ones. The six principles  are trust, interdependence, genuineness, empathy, risk (resolution), and success. They form the acronym TIGERS.

The 6 Principles are anchored by behaviors that make common sense to everyone. The solution helps business leaders track improvements through cost savings and improved productivity.  The bottom line, however, is happier and more productive organizations.

Our goal is $2000. 

We know that work cultures that attract and retain employees are just as important as individual department teams when cooperation among employees is critical for business success.  So instead of offering a company wide survey and multiple department surveys, we would like to consolidate it into one survey.  This makes training and development more effective, less time-wasting and less confusing.

Take a look at our perk levels

Our turn-around for perks is within one business day.

Check out our perk descriptions and videos below for more complete details. The team consultant who invested in the team survey just received some stellar information to support her client -- a client with the desire to be one of the best companies to work for in their region. So we will continue to support your investment even beyond the end of this campaign.

Here's the perks!

$15 The Book TIGERS Among us showcasing successful businesses with 10 - 1800 employees.  Tips, strategies, examples and team meeting questions to take your organization up a notch in 2016



$30 Melting Your Stress Within 30 Days - Stress Mastery Home Study Course.

We were asked by a contact to include this.  So we did.  So, if your peeps are suffering from sleepless nights, turmoil and that feeling of being trapped between a rock and a hard spot, this gift from you will be appreciated for a life-time.

Melting Your Stress Within 30 Days Melting Your Stress will teach you how to holistically recover from burnout, tackle daily challenges, develop a winning mindset, and realize all your goals. Not merely theory or good ideas, this home study program provides you with the timeless strategies, exercises and surveys used by myself as well as some of the greatest and successful trainers and leaders today. Taken together and implemented every day, these stress management principles will transform you, your job and your relationships so that you are able to achieve what you deserve in life. Includes Study Guide, audio training support and more.

$30 Engaging Employee To Champion Change Audio and E-book Training Program.

If you know that something needs to change in your business so that you are more productive and successful, check out this perk.  It shows you the most important considerations for change so you don't waste time, money and your reputation.




$50 Webinar: Avoid 3 Serious Mistakes That Cause Collaboration and High Performance Teamwork to Fail  - This level also includes the first and second perks, too, as bonuses.

This webinar is HRCI recognized.  What does that mean?  It means that a HR certification company reviewed this material and gave it a gold star. No sales pitch webinar here.  Just darn good information that will keep leaders from investing in training that fails to transfer to improved skills and attitudes.



$100 6 Principles On-line Leadership Training - This level also includes level one, two and three perks as bonuses.

If you are a manager or supervisor and want to learn some very important team leadership skills on your own because you have the goal to advance your career, don't pass this one up.  The bonuses give you the book, the change program and this tool, too.



$250 The TIGERS Team Survey which includes premium support for groups of 8 - 150 people.  It also includes a free version of the comprehensive survey.

We help you run this survey for your team or small company. So don't think for one minute that you are on your own with this.  And we debrief the results with you.  So if you have the goal of improving your team or company but don't know where to start, this survey gives you both direction and insight for strategic results.



$800 On Line Team Facilitation Training. This includes the TIGERS Team Wheel Team Building Activity and effective Team Consensus facilitation for leaders, project managers, business owners, coaches and trainers. This level also includes level one, two, three and four perks as bonuses.

This is step one in the TIGERS licensing process.  It is available any time but not at this investment after 12/11. 



$1000 Full Day Leadership Retreat. We will facilitate a full day, customized TIGERS leadership retreat for your company or organization.  Your team will learn the behaviors that build strong teams and behaviors that cause problems.

Then we will facilitate your next steps so your entire team is on the same page with the same agreements. (Travel expenses are additional).



$2000 Two Day Leadership Team Development Problem Solving Clinic. We will facilitate a customized 2-day, clinic to help your leaders build cross functional teams for important company-wide problem solving or system development projects.

This clinic helps you develop team charters with behavior expectations with planning outcomes. (Travel expenses are additional).




The Impact

Before we put the survey on the internet, we used a pen and paper version for team improvement. 

Some of these companies are now  known as best places to work, have low turnover, very successful employees and leaders who have achieved national and international recognition.

Because the survey and anchored behaviors make such good common sense, it isn't hard to achieve these results. And the impact carries over into families and stronger more vibrant communities because businesses are more stable and successful.

Our vision is much larger than just "what's in it for us".

The trickle down effect of a positive work environment that employees look forward to returning to after a couple of days off reduces workplace conflict that employees take home with them, By helping us fund the next level of this survey you can help us put more positive resources in the hands of leaders who can make a difference, leaving the workplace and our communities in better shape.

If you know HR Directors, Consultants and Coaches that work with business and not-for-profit teams, we plan to teach them to use this resource, too.  We are making this resource open for others to use. 

We also designed this campaign so that the 2-4 funding levels actually give you the perks below it as bonuses to keep or share with others over the holidays. These are resources that managers, leaders and entrepreneurs can use immediately to improve their own business results.


Risks & Challenges

Much of what is necessary to take the survey to the next level has already been  tested.  We also plan to release the updated BETA version to people who fund  the survey level perk.  We are supplying technical support for the survey now and you can start a department survey or 8 or more people right away.

Other ways you can help

There are three ways and maybe more:

1. Tell your friends on all your social networks to go fund us.

2. Fund us at $10 or higher and join our referral contest. Get $5 for every funded referral you make!

Here's how:

  1. Make your own contribution at any perk level (IMPORTANT!)
  2. Sign up as a member of Indiegogo
  3. Using links at the top, share this campaign via facebook, twitter, google+, email, embed in your blog, copy the link or follow on Indiegogo.
  4. When your friends see your share and make a contribution, you get $5/referral for each one at the end of the campaign.
  5. Refer 3 or more friends and you basically get the first perk level for FREE. There is no limit to how many referrals you can make.
  6. All referrals can be tracked via your Indiegogo dashboard.
  7. Remember! The more you share, the more referrals you make, the more cash back you have!
3. Blogs and podcasts

We would also love to help you blog about our campaign or be a guest in your podcast or radio program to help you get the word out and to enhance your referral rewards.  We would love to help you help us. That is the spirit behind collaboration.

We sincerely appreciate all the support you can provide.  Every little bit counts!
story_txt:
If your employees experienced less conflict and built better working relationships would this be a happier and more productive workplace with improved business revenue? 
We can make that happen and need your support and funding for a #survey #tech project. In return we are providing leadership and training perks for small business owners, HR directors, managers and companies desiring more cooperation between among employees and collaboration between departments.
 The solution is our 360 Team Behavior Survey, which takes all the  guess work out of how to support and improve teams and their leaders. The TIGERS survey measures six principles that transform adequate teams into exceptional ones. The six principles  are trust, interdependence, genuineness, empathy, risk (resolution), and success. They form the acronym TIGERS. 
The 6 Principles are anchored by behaviors that make common sense to everyone. The solution helps business leaders track improvements through cost savings and improved productivity.  The bottom line, however, is happier and more productive organizations.


Our goal is $2000.  




We know that work cultures that attract and retain employees are just as important as 
individual department teams when cooperation among employees is critical for business success.  So instead of offering a company wide survey and multiple department surveys, we would like to consolidate it into one survey.  This makes training and development more effective, less time-wasting and less confusing.
Take a look at our perk levels
Our turn-around for perks is within one business day. 
Check out our perk descriptions and videos below for more complete details. The team consultant who invested in the team survey just received some stellar information to support her client -- a client with the desire to be one of the best companies to work for in their region. story:
MISSION

"Handy Gals" is a team of cheerful ladies living and working in our senior community. We are privileged to provide services to them, such as:

  • Cooking meals
  • Scrubbing floors
  • Cleaning houses
  • Shopping for groceries
  • Picking up prescriptions
  • Troubleshooting computer problems such as virus and malware removal, printer and software installation
  • Tutoring with computer-related tasks
  • Doing personal assistant type tasks, such as organizing paper work, typing, handling difficult situations
  • And much more.

When we first came to Solivita, we recognized the need demonstrated by seniors, particularly senior women, to have caring women help them with a variety of tasks. To gauge the interest, we started by assisting neighbors and friends with their computer problems and household tasks at a low hourly rate.

Within two weeks of starting Handy Gals, we were swamped with work!

Due to myriad hardships recently, including being defrauded by three successive landlords, illness, job loss and death, we have had to suspend the services, hopefully only temporarily.

Since starting "Handy Gals" just four months ago, we have made great friends and served many wonderful people. It is our sincere belief and hope that if we could buy our own residence (at 55 I would be a FIRST time home buyer), we could continue to assist many seniors at a very low hourly rate, and in the conscientious and cheerful manner we strive.

HOW FUNDS WILL BE USED

This campaign is toward solidifying "Handy Gals" as a business and also to obtain the required down payment on a modest home in our community in order to offer the services.

Business expenses include start-up costs such as incorporation, computer equipment, supplies, marketing, advertising, legal fees.

We are selling the remainder of personal possessions toward successfully funding our goal.

We have structured this campaign as follows:

  • Your kind contribution is gratefully accepted, OR
  • You may claim a "Perk" for our prepaid service if you are living in Solivita, Florida.
The people for whom we have worked in the community will recognize the name "Handy Gals," and we have a website HandyGals.org -- HandyGals.org -- where you can see who we are and what we provide.

I have been keenly reminded by a beautiful lady here in Solivita who is not only a dear friend but also a Handy Gals client and backer of this endeavor that "sometimes it does take a village."

We are grateful to have come upon this community and for all of the support.

Thank you kindly from Handy Gals.
